original: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i rim gyis thob nas 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i rnam par dbye bas sgrub byed du ma yan lag dang bcas par ston par mdzad la /
analyzed: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i rim gyis thob nas 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i rnam par dbye bas sgrub byed du ma yan lag dang bcas par ston par mdzad la /
translated: Having attained it through the stages of remembering former abodes, he teaches the many means of accomplishment by the divisions of the desirable and the undesirable, together with their branches.

original: gzhan gyis kyang 'jug par 'dod pas de de bzhin du 'jug pa'i yul la mkhas par 'gyur bar bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyis kyang 'jug par 'dod pas de de bzhin du 'jug pa'i yul la mkhas par 'gyur bar bya ba ma yin no //
translated: But it is not that he is skilled in the object of engagement because he wishes to engage in it.

original: de la yang rang nyid las rig pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: de la yang rang nyid las rig pa med pa yin te /
translated: And in that, he is not self-aware.

original: ji skad gsungs pa'i gdams ngag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji skad gsungs pa'i gdams ngag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he does not have the instructions as they are taught.

original: de'i phyir shes pa dang ldan pa de btsal bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir shes pa dang ldan pa de btsal bar bya ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, he who is endowed with knowledge should be sought,

original: rang dang gzhan la shes pa med na 'jug par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde la rang la shes pa'i @179a * //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan la shes pa med na 'jug par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro // de la rang la shes pa'i @179a * //
translated: because it is not reasonable to engage without knowledge of oneself and others.

original: thabs med ces te /
analyzed: thabs med ces te /
translated: In that, there is no means of knowledge for oneself.

original: gzhan la med par shes par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan la med par shes par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: It is not to be known as non-existent for others,

original: bra brtags pa la sogs pa bzhin du nye tshe ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bra brtags pa la sogs pa bzhin du nye tshe ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is temporary, like a scarecrow, and so on.

original: srid pa yin na yang de shes pa la yang de sngon du 'gro ba can du bstan pa ni /
analyzed: srid pa yin na yang de shes pa la yang de sngon du 'gro ba can du bstan pa ni /
translated: But even if it is a worldly thing, it is taught that it is preceded by knowledge.

original: 'di kho na yin gyi gzhan ma yin no zhes ci las shes /
analyzed: 'di kho na yin gyi gzhan ma yin no zhes ci las shes /
translated: How do you know that it is just this and not something else?

original: gal te bde gshegs kun shes na //
analyzed: gal te bde gshegs kun shes na //
translated: If the Sugata is omniscient,

original: ser skya mi zhes tshad ma gang //
analyzed: ser skya mi zhes tshad ma gang //
translated: what is the means of valid knowledge of Kapila and so on?

original: zhes bya ba'i tshig las so //üîΩphyogs gcig la mi slu bas shes pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi shes pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshig las so // phyogs gcig la mi slu bas shes pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi shes pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is from the words ‚ÄúIf the Sugata is omniscient,üîΩwhat is the means of valid knowledge of Kapila and so on?‚Äù

original: ma nges pa'i phyir dang skyes bu'i don phran tshogs kyi shes pa ni thams cad la rnyed bla ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma nges pa'i phyir dang skyes bu'i don phran tshogs kyi shes pa ni thams cad la rnyed bla ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Knowledge is not preceded by knowledge because it is not ascertained, and because the knowledge of a person‚Äôs many minor goals is easily found in all cases.üîΩThe teaching of liberation is said to have the same intention as that, because the highest goal of a person and its means are nondeceptive.

original: byang grol du bstan pa ni skyes bu'i don gyi dam pa thabs dang bcas pa ni mi slu ba can yin pa'i phyir de dang dgongs pa gcig pas gsungs pa'i mtho ris la sogs pa'i skyes bu don phran tshegs ngag gi snga rol nyid du de nyid shesüîΩpa yin te /
analyzed: byang grol du bstan pa ni skyes bu'i don gyi dam pa thabs dang bcas pa ni mi slu ba can yin pa'i phyir de dang dgongs pa gcig pas gsungs pa'i mtho ris la sogs pa'i skyes bu don phran tshegs ngag gi snga rol nyid du de nyid shesüîΩpa yin te /
translated: The minor goals of a person such as heaven and so on are known by that alone, prior to the words.

original: skyes bu'i don gyi dam ba la mi slu ba yin na cig shos la slu ba yin no zhes the tshom za ba ma yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu'i don gyi dam ba la mi slu ba yin na cig shos la slu ba yin no zhes the tshom za ba ma yin no //
translated: If it is not deceptive with regard to the highest aim of man, it is not deceptive with regard to the other either.üîΩThe opposite of this is the case with the other.

original: bzlog pa la ni de ltar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bsam pa'i dbye ba shes pa ni 'jig pa'i yin la /
analyzed: bzlog pa la ni de ltar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bsam pa'i dbye ba shes pa ni 'jig pa'i yin la /
translated: The knowledge of the distinction in the intention is the destruction of the world.

original: 'jig rten gyi thabs dang ldan pa ni gzhan du rnam par gzhag par mi rigs so //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi thabs dang ldan pa ni gzhan du rnam par gzhag par mi rigs so //
translated: The one who possesses the worldly means is not to be classified as another.

original: ser skya la sogs pa la ni 'di med pa yin te de'i phyir slu ba can nyid do //
analyzed: ser skya la sogs pa la ni 'di med pa yin te de'i phyir slu ba can nyid do //
translated: This is not the case with Kapila and the rest, and therefore they are deceptive.

original: gzhan las thos nas smra ba yin par mi rigs te /
analyzed: gzhan las thos nas smra ba yin par mi rigs te /
translated: It is not reasonable that they speak after having heard from another,

original: gang gis tshad ma yod pa can gyi dngos po'i bsgom pas 'dod pa dang nyan ngan las 'das pa bzhin du sngon du byed pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gis tshad ma yod pa can gyi dngos po'i bsgom pas 'dod pa dang nyan ngan las 'das pa bzhin du sngon du byed pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is possible that they have a prior desire and hatred, like the one who possesses valid cognition, by the cultivation of a thing.üîΩThe one who teaches the principal is the other.

original: gtso bo nye bar ston pa po nyid gzhan yang zhes ci las de lta bu nyid kyi dran pa rnam par gcod pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: gtso bo nye bar ston pa po nyid gzhan yang zhes ci las de lta bu nyid kyi dran pa rnam par gcod pa ma yin pas /
translated: What is the reason that he does not eliminate the memory of that kind?

original: rig byed la sogs pa skyes bus byas pa la ma yin pa la sogs pa bzhin du'o //
analyzed: rig byed la sogs pa skyes bus byas pa la ma yin pa la sogs pa bzhin du'o //
translated: like the Vedas, etc., which are not composed by a person.

original: rig byed la sogs pa la ni skyes bu'i don gyi gtso bo la mi snang bar yid ches ba nyid kyi shes pa'i rgyu med do //
analyzed: rig byed la sogs pa la ni skyes bu'i don gyi gtso bo la mi snang bar yid ches ba nyid kyi shes pa'i rgyu med do //
translated: In the Vedas, etc., there is no cause for the knowledge of reliability, since the principal human purpose does not appear.

original: de'i phyir de las gzhan pa la yang yid ches pa nyid du nges pa med par bstan pa ni mi shes pa ni skyes bu'i don gyi gtso bo'i dad par bya ba'i shes pa srid pa med pas so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de las gzhan pa la yang yid ches pa nyid du nges pa med par bstan pa ni mi shes pa ni skyes bu'i don gyi gtso bo'i dad par bya ba'i shes pa srid pa med pas so //
translated: Therefore, it is shown that there is no certainty of reliability even in something else, because the possibility of the knowledge of reliability in the principal human purpose is not known.

original: ston par byed pa zhes bya ba ni nye bar bstan par bya ba ste nan tan du bya ba'o //
analyzed: ston par byed pa zhes bya ba ni nye bar bstan par bya ba ste nan tan du bya ba'o //
translated: The word teacher means that which is to be taught, that which is to be earnestly practiced.

original: de la byed pa ni nan tan du bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la byed pa ni nan tan du bya ba'o //
translated: In that regard, the agent is that which is to be earnestly practiced.

original: de la ; slu ba yin par dogs rnams kyi //
analyzed: de la ; slu ba yin par dogs rnams kyi //
translated: Among them, those who suspect deception

original: zhes bya ba ni skyes bu'i don gyi gtso bo'i shes pa'i rim gyis dad par bya ba'i shes pa kho na tshol @179b bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni skyes bu'i don gyi gtso bo'i shes pa'i rim gyis dad par bya ba'i shes pa kho na tshol @179b bar byed pa yin te /
translated: means that they seek only the knowledge of reliability through the knowledge of the principal human purpose.

original: thabs dang bcas pa'i skad cig ma nyid mthong na cig shos mi mthong ba ma yin te /
analyzed: thabs dang bcas pa'i skad cig ma nyid mthong na cig shos mi mthong ba ma yin te /
translated: But it is not the case that one does not see the other when one sees the momentariness together with the method.

original: mthong ba'i sgrub byed ba sgom pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba'i sgrub byed ba sgom pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the proof of seeing is the cultivation of meditation.

original: gang gi phyir skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa'i bsgom pas sgrib pa ma lus pa'i nyes pa spangs pa yin na dran pa goms pa phun sum tshogs pa las sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i shes pa thob pa las /
analyzed: gang gi phyir skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa'i bsgom pas sgrib pa ma lus pa'i nyes pa spangs pa yin na dran pa goms pa phun sum tshogs pa las sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i shes pa thob pa las /
translated: When one abandons all the faults of the obscurations by the cultivation of momentariness, etc., then, from the perfection of the cultivation of mindfulness, one attains the knowledge of the recollection of former lives.

original: las dang 'bras bu dang 'brel par bde bar rtogs pa'i phyir dran pas goms pa bzhin du gtso bo'i shes pa yang de las mkho ba yin no //
analyzed: las dang 'bras bu dang 'brel par bde bar rtogs pa'i phyir dran pas goms pa bzhin du gtso bo'i shes pa yang de las mkho ba yin no //
translated: Because one easily understands the connection between action and effect, the knowledge of the principal one is as necessary as the cultivation of mindfulness.

original: de'i phyir skyes bu'i don gyi gtso po rtogs pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi dran pa goms ba'i blo gsal ba ni nyams su myong ba dran pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir skyes bu'i don gyi gtso po rtogs pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi dran pa goms ba'i blo gsal ba ni nyams su myong ba dran pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: Therefore, the clear mind of the cultivation of mindfulness, which precedes the understanding of the principal human goal, is the cause of the recollection of experience.

original: gegs byed pa med na mthong ba bzhin du snying rdze goms pa phul du byung ba las gegs byed pa med par shin tu nges pa yin pa'i phyir gdon mi za bar 'byung ba'i 'bras bu ni rgyu yin la /
analyzed: gegs byed pa med na mthong ba bzhin du snying rdze goms pa phul du byung ba las gegs byed pa med par shin tu nges pa yin pa'i phyir gdon mi za bar 'byung ba'i 'bras bu ni rgyu yin la /
translated: The result that definitely occurs is the cause.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i 'bras bu sngon gyi pa nas rjes su dran pa'i 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i 'bras bu sngon gyi pa nas rjes su dran pa'i 'bras bu yin te /
translated: The result that is remembered from the past is the result of the subsequent.

original: de med na med pa'i bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med na med pa'i bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because without it, there is no distinction of nonexistence.üîΩThe knowledge that is trusted from nondeceptive knowledge of the principal is also nondeceptive with regard to the other.

original: 'jig rten pa'i yang gtso bo la mi slu bas cig shos la yang mi slu ba'i shes pa las yid ches pa'i shes pa yin par gtso bo'i don la slu min las gzhan la rjes su dpag pa yang zhes bya bas 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i yang gtso bo la mi slu bas cig shos la yang mi slu ba'i shes pa las yid ches pa'i shes pa yin par gtso bo'i don la slu min las gzhan la rjes su dpag pa yang zhes bya bas 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is explained by the statement, ‚ÄúInference is from the nondeception of the principal object.‚Äù

original: 'dir ni de yongs su ma shes pa'i skyon brjod pa yin la /
analyzed: 'dir ni de yongs su ma shes pa'i skyon brjod pa yin la /
translated: Here, the fault of not fully understanding that is stated.

original: 'di la yang 'di'i nan tan du bya ba'i shes pa ni rtogs bya yin par bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di la yang 'di'i nan tan du bya ba'i shes pa ni rtogs bya yin par bstan pa yin la /
translated: And here, the knowledge that is to be earnestly practiced is taught to be the object of realization.üîΩAnd with regard to that, all subjects

original: de la ni yul can thams cad dam /
analyzed: de la ni yul can thams cad dam /
translated: In this regard, all subjects are eitherüîΩ

original: yang na nan tan bya ba dang nan tan byed par rang nyid rtogs pa dang ldan pa yin la /
analyzed: yang na nan tan bya ba dang nan tan byed par rang nyid rtogs pa dang ldan pa yin la /
translated: Or else, one who is serious about the matter is one who is endowed with understanding.

original: 'ga' zhig khas blangs par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig khas blangs par bya ba yin no //
translated: But some are to be accepted.

original: gzhan du shes pa zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa yin la /
analyzed: gzhan du shes pa zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa yin la /
translated: Otherwise, ‚Äúknowledge‚Äù is understanding.

original: gang la de med pa ni 'di'i mi shes par ston pa'o //
analyzed: gang la de med pa ni 'di'i mi shes par ston pa'o //
translated: That which is devoid of that is shown to be ‚Äúignorance.‚Äù

original: de las byed pa ni byed pa ste /
analyzed: de las byed pa ni byed pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúFrom that‚Äù means ‚Äúfrom that.‚Äù

original: nan tan tu byed na slu ba srid pa yin te /
analyzed: nan tan tu byed na slu ba srid pa yin te /
translated: If one is serious about the matter, then it is possible to deceive.

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i rgya brten dang bral ba'i nye bar bstan pa tsam las ni bcos ma ma yin pa las kyang don dang 'brel pa'i rang bzhin can ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i rgya brten dang bral ba'i nye bar bstan pa tsam las ni bcos ma ma yin pa las kyang don dang 'brel pa'i rang bzhin can ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: For, from mere instruction devoid of the support of direct perception and inference, even if it is not fabricated, it is not necessarily connected with the meaning.

original: de tsam nan tan du byed pa ni rang gi rtog pa tsam nan tan byed pa bzhin du yid ches pa'i gnas ma yin no //üîΩde'i nye bar bstan pa ni rmongs pa las kyang 'byung ba yin la /
analyzed: de tsam nan tan du byed pa ni rang gi rtog pa tsam nan tan byed pa bzhin du yid ches pa'i gnas ma yin no // de'i nye bar bstan pa ni rmongs pa las kyang 'byung ba yin la /
translated: Therefore, being serious about mere instruction is not a reliable basis, just like being serious about one‚Äôs own thoughts.üîΩFor, instruction can arise even from delusion,

original: rmongs pa med na rig byed las kyang 'byung @180a * //
analyzed: rmongs pa med na rig byed las kyang 'byung @180a * //
translated: and even from the Veda if there is no delusion.

original: zhes pa gsal ba yin te /
analyzed: zhes pa gsal ba yin te /
translated: This is clear.

original: don dang 'brel pa skyes bu byas pa nyid kyis rmongs pa srid pa mi ldog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dang 'brel pa skyes bu byas pa nyid kyis rmongs pa srid pa mi ldog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the connection with the object, the person is confused and does not turn away from existence.

original: de'i phyir de lta bu'i rnam shes bskyed pa la mig la sogs pa rgyu ma yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir de lta bu'i rnam shes bskyed pa la mig la sogs pa rgyu ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, the eye, etc. are not the cause of the production of such consciousness.

original: bsgom pa yang yin par ni mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: bsgom pa yang yin par ni mi 'gyur te /
translated: Nor is meditation,

original: dbang po las 'das pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: dbang po las 'das pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: because it is beyond the senses.

original: / cung zad kyang mngon sum gyi nus pas ma mthong ba yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang gsal ba yin te /
analyzed: / cung zad kyang mngon sum gyi nus pas ma mthong ba yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang gsal ba yin te /
translated: It is also clear that ‚Äúit is not seen by the power of perception at all.‚Äù

original: dran pa goms pa las nyams su myong ba dran pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dran pa goms pa las nyams su myong ba dran pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the sign of the memory of experience is the cultivation of memory.

original: de lta yin na dran pas shes pa yin gyi mngon sum gyis ni ma yin no zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta yin na dran pas shes pa yin gyi mngon sum gyis ni ma yin no zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If that is so, it is knowledge by memory, not by perception.

original: shin tu goms pa las gsal bar snang ba nyid kyis mngon sum yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu goms pa las gsal bar snang ba nyid kyis mngon sum yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because it is perception due to the clear appearance from very familiarization.

original: de ltar na nye bar bstan pa las shes pa ni pha la sogs pa'i nye bar bstan pa bzhin du /
analyzed: de ltar na nye bar bstan pa las shes pa ni pha la sogs pa'i nye bar bstan pa bzhin du /
translated: In that case, knowledge from instruction is like the instruction of father, etc.

original: rtogs bzhin pa yin na khyed kyis ci las shes zhes glags btsal bar bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rtogs bzhin pa yin na khyed kyis ci las shes zhes glags btsal bar bya ba ma yin te /
translated: If it is being realized, it is not to be criticized by asking, ‚ÄúHow do you know?‚Äù

original: shin tu goms pa las ni rtogs par ma byas kyang lus dang ngag gi tha snyad mthong ba'i phyir rtogs pa med na ji ltar ston pa yin zhes bya ba gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: shin tu goms pa las ni rtogs par ma byas kyang lus dang ngag gi tha snyad mthong ba'i phyir rtogs pa med na ji ltar ston pa yin zhes bya ba gsal ba yin no //
translated: Since one sees the conventions of body and speech through thorough familiarity, it is clear that if there is no realization, how can it be taught?

original: de gal te yid ches pa las dbang po'i yul zhes smra bas /
analyzed: de gal te yid ches pa las dbang po'i yul zhes smra bas /
translated: If it is said that it is the object of the sense faculties from being credible,

original: bden pa smra ba nyid dang dbang po'i yul du smra ba nyid yid ches pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: bden pa smra ba nyid dang dbang po'i yul du smra ba nyid yid ches pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa yin la /
translated: then the definition of credibility is taught to be the truth and the object of the sense faculties.

original: de yang 'jig rten pha rol pa'i las rjes su sgrub pa las dgongs pa yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de yang 'jig rten pha rol pa'i las rjes su sgrub pa las dgongs pa yod pa ma yin la /
translated: That is not the intention of the treatise because it is not established by the world.

original: de'i don nyid du rtogs pa dang ldan pa rnams rtsom pa'i phyir skyes bus byas pa ma yin pa nyid las sam /
analyzed: de'i don nyid du rtogs pa dang ldan pa rnams rtsom pa'i phyir skyes bus byas pa ma yin pa nyid las sam /
translated: Since those who possess realization compose the treatise for that purpose, it is not the composition of a person.

original: gzhan las kyang de 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir dbang po las 'das pa mthong ba des na skal ba dang ldan pa yin par bstan pa ni ;
analyzed: gzhan las kyang de 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir dbang po las 'das pa mthong ba des na skal ba dang ldan pa yin par bstan pa ni ;
translated: The Fortunate One has taught that it is the domain of the noble ones.

original: shes ldan tshol byed pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: shes ldan tshol byed pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The Fortunate One is called the knower of the world because he knows the world in all ways:

original: 'bras bu dang de'i khyad par mthong ba las rgyu dang / de'i khyad par dag pa yin la /
analyzed: 'bras bu dang de'i khyad par mthong ba las rgyu dang / de'i khyad par dag pa yin la /
translated: by knowing the effect and its specific cause, he knows the cause and its specific effect.

original: de las kyang de las gzhan pa yin //
analyzed: de las kyang de las gzhan pa yin //
translated: And from that, he knows what is other than that.

original: zhes rjes su dpag pas nges pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes rjes su dpag pas nges pa yin te /
translated: This is ascertained by inference.

original: goms pa khyad par can gyis ches gsal ba la ni lus pa mngon sum du 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: goms pa khyad par can gyis ches gsal ba la ni lus pa mngon sum du 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For the one who has attained a special cultivation, the remainder is directly perceived.

original: ji ltar thog ma dang tham med pa 'gal pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar thog ma dang tham med pa 'gal pa yin /
translated: How is it that beginninglessness and endlessness are contradictory?

original: rnam par rtog pa bzhin du mngon sum gyi rtogs pas bsgom pa tsam las 'byung ba gsal ba yin pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa bzhin du mngon sum gyi rtogs pas bsgom pa tsam las 'byung ba gsal ba yin pa'i phyir la /
translated: Because, like a conceptual thought, it is clear only through cultivation, and not through direct perception.

original: mngon sum nyid nyams pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum nyid nyams pa yang ma yin te /
translated: And direct perception is not impaired.

original: skad cig ma gzhan la yang de dang 'dra ba kho na'i rgyun gyis 'u bu cag ci shes pa bzhin du @180b 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma gzhan la yang de dang 'dra ba kho na'i rgyun gyis 'u bu cag ci shes pa bzhin du @180b 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and in the same way, in other moments, by a continuity of the same kind, they engage in the way we know.

original: gdul bya mtha' yas pa nyid kyi skyang skad cig ma re re la yang mngon par 'dod par byed pa'i phyir tshad ma yin te de'i phyir khyad par yod do //
analyzed: gdul bya mtha' yas pa nyid kyi skyang skad cig ma re re la yang mngon par 'dod par byed pa'i phyir tshad ma yin te de'i phyir khyad par yod do //
translated: It is valid because it is desired in each moment, for the sake of the infinite disciples. Therefore, there is a difference.

original: pha rol la yod pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa rigs pa'i phyir de dang ldan pa'i yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rgol ba dang lan rgyas par ni rnal 'byor ba'i mngon sum rnam par bshad pa las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: pha rol la yod pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa rigs pa'i phyir de dang ldan pa'i yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rgol ba dang lan rgyas par ni rnal 'byor ba'i mngon sum rnam par bshad pa las shes par bya'o //
translated: The extensive refutation and affirmation, in terms of the existence of desire, etc., in others, should be understood from the YogƒÅcƒÅra-prƒÅmƒÅ·πáya-vyavasthƒÅli

original: gzugs la sogs pa mngon du byed ba mig la sogs pa rjes su 'jug pa can ni bsgom pa las sam gzhan las kyang ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa mngon du byed ba mig la sogs pa rjes su 'jug pa can ni bsgom pa las sam gzhan las kyang ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: How could the eye, etc., which is engaged in the manifestation of form, etc., be from meditation or from anything else?

original: glur blang bya ba la sogs pa tsam la sogs pa yang khyad par can gyi dang po'i dbang po dang 'brel pa las 'byung ba ni bsgoms pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i shes pa gsal bar nye bar dmigs pa ma yin no zhes smra ba rnams kyis bsgoms pa'i
analyzed: glur blang bya ba la sogs pa tsam la sogs pa yang khyad par can gyi dang po'i dbang po dang 'brel pa las 'byung ba ni bsgoms pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i shes pa gsal bar nye bar dmigs pa ma yin no zhes smra ba rnams kyis bsgoms pa'i
translated: and so on, and that which arises from the connection with the special first sense faculty is not observed as clear consciousness that engages in meditation.

original: bskyed bya brjod pa la 'di tsam zhes bya ba med de /
analyzed: bskyed bya brjod pa la 'di tsam zhes bya ba med de /
translated: There is no such thing as the expression ‚Äúthat which is produced‚Äù in regard to this.

original: dbang po rnams lhan cig byed pa nyid kyis rjes su 'jug par byed pa rnams yul so sor nges pa yin na gzhal du med pa'i phyir thams cad shes pa ma yin pa nyid la sngon po dang sngon po ma yin pa'am /
analyzed: dbang po rnams lhan cig byed pa nyid kyis rjes su 'jug par byed pa rnams yul so sor nges pa yin na gzhal du med pa'i phyir thams cad shes pa ma yin pa nyid la sngon po dang sngon po ma yin pa'am /
translated: If the sense faculties, as co-operators, engage in the determination of individual objects, then since they are innumerable, not all consciousnesses would be of blue or not blue,

original: rig pa'am rig par byed pa ma yin zhes bya bar 'gyur te 'gal ba med pa'i phyir ma yin zhes bya bar mtshungs so //
analyzed: rig pa'am rig par byed pa ma yin zhes bya bar 'gyur te 'gal ba med pa'i phyir ma yin zhes bya bar mtshungs so //
translated: or of cognition or non-cognition, because there would be no contradiction. It is the same for ‚Äúnot.‚Äù

original: thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa la ni 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa la ni 'gal ba med do //
translated: There is no contradiction for one who is not omniscient.

original: thams cad shes pa ma yin pa nyid thams cad mkhyen par 'gyur te dpyod pa pa ma yin par dpyod pa bar 'gyur ba bzhin du'o //
analyzed: thams cad shes pa ma yin pa nyid thams cad mkhyen par 'gyur te dpyod pa pa ma yin par dpyod pa bar 'gyur ba bzhin du'o //
translated: All would become omniscient, just as all would become logicians, if one who is not omniscient or a logician were omniscient or a logician.

original: thabs yod pa'i phyir te dran pa goms pa ni thabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thabs yod pa'i phyir te dran pa goms pa ni thabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is a means, because the means is the cultivation of mindfulness.

original: mtho ris dang thar pa'i lam shes pa nyid kyis rjes su sgrub par 'dod pa rnams kyi bsnyen par bya ba 'di yin gyi /
analyzed: mtho ris dang thar pa'i lam shes pa nyid kyis rjes su sgrub par 'dod pa rnams kyi bsnyen par bya ba 'di yin gyi /
translated: This is the one to be served by those who desire to practice by knowing the path to heaven and liberation.

original: dgos pa med pa thams cad kyi shes pa las ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: dgos pa med pa thams cad kyi shes pa las ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: But not by the knowledge of all that is useless.

original: thams cad rig pa zhes bya ba tshad ma gzhan ni 'dod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: thams cad rig pa zhes bya ba tshad ma gzhan ni 'dod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The one who knows all is not asserted to be another valid cognition,

original: 'on kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: but rather.

original: thams cad shes pa yin pa'i phyir yang shes pa phul du byung ba dang ldan pa'i phyir bsnyen par bya ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: thams cad shes pa yin pa'i phyir yang shes pa phul du byung ba dang ldan pa'i phyir bsnyen par bya ba ma yin nam /
translated: Is he not to be served because he has the best knowledge, since he knows all?

original: de yang thams cad kyi shes pa ches shin tu yin pa'i phyir thams cad kyi shes pa la gus pa ma byas pas skyes bu'i don gyi shes pa nyid ji ltar tshol bar byed snyam du sems pas ci'i phyir zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: de yang thams cad kyi shes pa ches shin tu yin pa'i phyir thams cad kyi shes pa la gus pa ma byas pas skyes bu'i don gyi shes pa nyid ji ltar tshol bar byed snyam du sems pas ci'i phyir zhes zer ba la /
translated: Moreover, since the knowledge of all is very much superior, one should not be disrespectful to the knowledge of all. How then does one seek the knowledge of the meaning of the person?

original: lan du des gsungs zhes bya ba ste /üîΩrtogs par bya ba'i phyir ni nan tan du @181a * //
analyzed: lan du des gsungs zhes bya ba ste / rtogs par bya ba'i phyir ni nan tan du @181a * //
translated: The reply is: ‚Äúbecause of that, it is said.‚Äù

original: bya ba'i don du yin gyi /
analyzed: bya ba'i don du yin gyi /
translated: For the sake of understanding, i.e., for the sake of practice.

original: shes pa khyad par can dang ldan pa nyid tsam kho na las 'di bsnyen par bya ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: shes pa khyad par can dang ldan pa nyid tsam kho na las 'di bsnyen par bya ba ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not that this should be attended to merely because of possessing special knowledge.

original: 'on kyang nan tan du bya ba'i yul shes pa khyad par can dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'on kyang nan tan du bya ba'i yul shes pa khyad par can dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: However, the meaning is that it is because of possessing special knowledge, the object of practice.

original: yul gzhan shes pa khyad par can dang ldan pa shes pa yin na yang 'jug pa'i yul khyad par can dang ldan pa mi shes na mi 'jug ste /
analyzed: yul gzhan shes pa khyad par can dang ldan pa shes pa yin na yang 'jug pa'i yul khyad par can dang ldan pa mi shes na mi 'jug ste /
translated: Even if one knows the special knowledge of other objects, one does not engage if one does not know the special object of engagement.

original: rang nyid dam gzhan gyis nges par brtags pa la 'jug pa yin par bstan pa ni gzhan rjes su sgrub par 'dod pas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang nyid dam gzhan gyis nges par brtags pa la 'jug pa yin par bstan pa ni gzhan rjes su sgrub par 'dod pas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement that it is engaged in the ascertainment by oneself or by another is ‚Äúbecause of the desire to establish for another.‚Äù

original: yul gzhan shes pa khyad par can dang ldan pa nyid shes kyang /
analyzed: yul gzhan shes pa khyad par can dang ldan pa nyid shes kyang /
translated: Even though one has the special cognition of the other object,

original: 'jug pa'i yul shes pa khyad par can dang ldan pa srid pa yin na 'jug par 'gyur ba ma yin nam snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i yul shes pa khyad par can dang ldan pa srid pa yin na 'jug par 'gyur ba ma yin nam snyam du sems pa la /
translated: if one has the possibility of the special cognition of the object of engagement, one will not engage.

original: de des kyang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de des kyang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The response to that is ‚ÄúEven though he has that.‚Äù

original: 'jug pa'i yul shes pa la nges pa med na 'ga' yang 'jug par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i yul shes pa la nges pa med na 'ga' yang 'jug par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If there is no ascertainment of the object of engagement, then no one will engage,

original: yul gzhan la nges pa yang yul de la the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul gzhan la nges pa yang yul de la the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because even the ascertainment of the other object is doubt with regard to that object.

original: the tshom nyid ni 'jug pa'i yan lag ma yin te /
analyzed: the tshom nyid ni 'jug pa'i yan lag ma yin te /
translated: Doubt itself is not a limb of engagement,

original: 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa la slu bar dogs pa yin na /
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa la slu bar dogs pa yin na /
translated: because if one doubts that there is deception with regard to the other world and so on,

original: rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: then those who have conceptual thought will not engage. This is the meaning.

original: 'jug pa'i yul shes par nges pa kho na 'jug pa yin par ni bden te /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i yul shes par nges pa kho na 'jug pa yin par ni bden te /
translated: It is true that the cognition of the object of engagement is only the engagement.

original: de'i nges pa 'ba' zhig bzhin du yul gzhan shes pa la nges pa yang de la yod do zhes bdag smra ba yin no snyam du sems pa ni /üîΩ'on te der yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i nges pa 'ba' zhig bzhin du yul gzhan shes pa la nges pa yang de la yod do zhes bdag smra ba yin no snyam du sems pa ni / 'on te der yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But I maintain that just as it is ascertained, the cognition of another object also exists in that cognition.

original: shes pa de'i shes bya shes pa med na de'i shes pa la ji ltar nges pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: shes pa de'i shes bya shes pa med na de'i shes pa la ji ltar nges pa yin zhe na /
translated: But if it is not ascertained in that cognition, then how is it ascertained?

original: lan du thams cad du shes pa la zhes smos so //
analyzed: lan du thams cad du shes pa la zhes smos so //
translated: The response is: ‚Äúin all cases, in the cognition.‚Äù

original: nye bar bsdu ba ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: nye bar bsdu ba ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The summary is stated: ‚ÄúTherefore, that very cognition is the object of engagement.‚Äù

original: de nyid ces bya ba de nan tan du bya ba kho na yin par shes par bya ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba de nan tan du bya ba kho na yin par shes par bya ba ste /
translated: That very cognition is to be understood as the object of engagement.

original: slu ba yin par dogs rnams kyis //
analyzed: slu ba yin par dogs rnams kyis //
translated: For those who suspect deception,

original: zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: this is to be applied.

original: des ni nye bar bstan pa las so //
analyzed: des ni nye bar bstan pa las so //
translated: This is taught.

original: ci las the tshom za ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci las the tshom za ba yin zhe na /
translated: From what is there doubt?

original: mi shes zhes bya ba ni rang nyid la 'jug pa'i yul la nges par rtogs med par bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: mi shes zhes bya ba ni rang nyid la 'jug pa'i yul la nges par rtogs med par bstan pa yin la /
translated: ‚ÄúNot knowing‚Äù teaches that one does not ascertain the object of engagement for oneself.

original: mi shes pa nye bar ston pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan la nges par rtog pa med par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mi shes pa nye bar ston pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan la nges par rtog pa med par bstan pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTeaching what is not known‚Äù means teaching without ascertaining in another.

original: 'di tshad ma nyid do zhes bya ba 'di la yang shes nas zhes bya bar rjes su 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di tshad ma nyid do zhes bya ba 'di la yang shes nas zhes bya bar rjes su 'jug pa yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúThis is valid cognition‚Äù is also to be supplied with ‚Äúknowing.‚Äù

original: skyes bu'i don shes pa khyad pa can dang ldan pa nyid kyi shes pa la tshad @181b ma yin te /
analyzed: skyes bu'i don shes pa khyad pa can dang ldan pa nyid kyi shes pa la tshad @181b ma yin te /
translated: It is valid cognition in the cognition of a person who possesses a special knowledge of the object,

original: rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: because it is supplied. This is the meaning.

original: gal te yul gzhan shes pa khyad par can la nges pa ma yin pa kho na ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: gal te yul gzhan shes pa khyad par can la nges pa ma yin pa kho na ci zhig ce na /
translated: If it is not ascertained in a special cognition of another object, what is it?

original: srid pa yin par 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: srid pa yin par 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
translated: It is taught that it is possible.

original: gzhan la yang de'i zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan la yang de'i zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIn another, too, that‚Äù means

original: skyes bu'i don shes pa khyad par can la srid pa ni sgrub par byed pa dang gnod pa can med pa'i phyir the tshom yin la /
analyzed: skyes bu'i don shes pa khyad par can la srid pa ni sgrub par byed pa dang gnod pa can med pa'i phyir the tshom yin la /
translated: that it is possible in the special cognition of the object of a person, because there is no proof or refutation.

original: 'di 'jug pa'i yan lag ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di 'jug pa'i yan lag ni ma yin te /
translated: This is not a limb of engagement.

original: 'khrul pa srid par 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / thams cad du yang 'jug par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrul pa srid par 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / thams cad du yang 'jug par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because error would be possible and because it would follow that it would engage all objects.

original: de'i phyir nges pa can gyi skyes bu'i don gyi gtso ba'i shes pa la nges pa ni 'jug pa'i yan lag yin par bstan pa ni skyes bu'i don gyi gtso bo shes pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir nges pa can gyi skyes bu'i don gyi gtso ba'i shes pa la nges pa ni 'jug pa'i yan lag yin par bstan pa ni skyes bu'i don gyi gtso bo shes pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Thus, the statement that ascertainment is a factor of engagement in the cognition of the principal object of a certain person is the cognition of the principal object of a person.

original: skyes bu'i don kun gyi gtso bo las gzhan pa'i yul shes pa la ji ltar shes pa yin zhes rgol ba ni rig byed dang dbang phyug la sogs pa rnams bsnyen pa la yang mtshungs pa yin la /
analyzed: skyes bu'i don kun gyi gtso bo las gzhan pa'i yul shes pa la ji ltar shes pa yin zhes rgol ba ni rig byed dang dbang phyug la sogs pa rnams bsnyen pa la yang mtshungs pa yin la /
translated: The objection is that if the cognition of an object other than the principal object of a person is not cognition, then it is the same for those who revere the Vedas, ƒ™≈õvara, and so on.

original: de la khyed kyi lan gang yin pa de kho bo cag gi yang yin par mtshungs par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de la khyed kyi lan gang yin pa de kho bo cag gi yang yin par mtshungs par bstan pa ni /
translated: The response to that is that it is the same for us.

original: lhag ma thams cad ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lhag ma thams cad ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The rest is as follows.

original: gal te rig byed dang dbang phyug la sogs pa yang bsnyen par bya ba ma yin du zin kyang bdag la gnod pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: gal te rig byed dang dbang phyug la sogs pa yang bsnyen par bya ba ma yin du zin kyang bdag la gnod pa ci yod ce na /
translated: If the Vedas, ƒ™≈õvara, and so on are not to be revered, what harm is there for us?

original: ci'i phyir mi gnod pa yin te bsnyen par bya ba thams cad dgag pa /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi gnod pa yin te bsnyen par bya ba thams cad dgag pa /
translated: Why is it not harmful? It is the same to say, ‚ÄúAll that is to be relied upon is refuted,‚Äù

original: bsnyen bya gang kho na yin pa de kho na ji ltar shes pa yin zhes bya bar mtshungs so //
analyzed: bsnyen bya gang kho na yin pa de kho na ji ltar shes pa yin zhes bya bar mtshungs so //
translated: and ‚ÄúHow is it known that only that which is to be relied upon is refuted?‚Äù

original: bdag cag gi bsnyen par bya ba ni 'ga' yang med pa kho na yin no zhe na de ltar yin na 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad la rjes su 'jug par byed pas khyod 'jig rten pa yin te /
analyzed: bdag cag gi bsnyen par bya ba ni 'ga' yang med pa kho na yin no zhe na de ltar yin na 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad la rjes su 'jug par byed pas khyod 'jig rten pa yin te /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúWe do not rely on anything at all,‚Äù then you are a worldly person, because you engage in worldly conventions.

original: skyes bu'i don gtso bo shes pa la nges par byed na shes pa gzhan la yang srid par byed pas 'jug par byed pa yin na gzhan la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: skyes bu'i don gtso bo shes pa la nges par byed na shes pa gzhan la yang srid par byed pas 'jug par byed pa yin na gzhan la ni ma yin te /
translated: If you are certain that the primary purpose of a person is to know, then you engage in other knowledge, but not in other things.

original: de ltar shes pa med bas slu ba yin par dogs pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar shes pa med bas slu ba yin par dogs pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: This is because you fear that without such knowledge you will be deceived.

original: gang zhig tshad mas mthong ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang zhig tshad mas mthong ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is stated in the line ‚ÄúWhatever is seen by valid knowledge.‚Äù

original: shes pa dang nye bar bstan pa dag gis kyang nye bar bstan pa mthong ba las the tshom za ba yin no zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: shes pa dang nye bar bstan pa dag gis kyang nye bar bstan pa mthong ba las the tshom za ba yin no zhes zer ba ni /
translated: Some say that even if something is seen by valid knowledge, it is doubted if it is seen by knowledge and what is taught.

original: 'on te thams cad yongs su mi shes na zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'on te thams cad yongs su mi shes na zhes bya ba ste /
translated: But if one does not understand everything,

original: thams cad ni las kyi 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyi 'gro ba yin te /
analyzed: thams cad ni las kyi 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyi 'gro ba yin te /
translated: then everything is the nature of the effect of karma,

original: gzhan la med pa'i phyir la gal te de shes na thams cad kyi shes pa kho na tshig gsal ba 'di kho nas brjod pa yin la /üîΩde la yang nus pa med par bstan pa kho na @182a * //
analyzed: gzhan la med pa'i phyir la gal te de shes na thams cad kyi shes pa kho na tshig gsal ba 'di kho nas brjod pa yin la / de la yang nus pa med par bstan pa kho na @182a * //
translated: because it does not exist elsewhere. If one understands that, then the statement ‚Äúone understands everything‚Äù is clear.üîΩBut if one does not understand that, then the statement ‚Äúone understands everything‚Äù is not clear.

original: yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is taught that one is not able to understand everything.

original: lan du las dang 'bras bu 'brel pa mngon du byed pa yod pa las de bzhin du thams cad kyi shes pa 'thob pa yin na 'ga' yang nyams pa med la shes pa med pa yang ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: lan du las dang 'bras bu 'brel pa mngon du byed pa yod pa las de bzhin du thams cad kyi shes pa 'thob pa yin na 'ga' yang nyams pa med la shes pa med pa yang ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: In response to that, it is taught that if one actualizes the connection between karma and its effect, then one obtains the understanding of everything in that way, and no one is harmed and there is no lack of understanding:

original: tshad ma med pa'i dngos po las zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: tshad ma med pa'i dngos po las zhes bya ba ste /
translated: From a thing that lacks valid knowledge.

original: rig byed grangs can la sogs pa la tshad ma med pa'i phyir nye bar bstan pa brgyud pa kho na las don gyi gtso bo la slu ba med pa'i don du skyabs su mi 'gro ba yin te /
analyzed: rig byed grangs can la sogs pa la tshad ma med pa'i phyir nye bar bstan pa brgyud pa kho na las don gyi gtso bo la slu ba med pa'i don du skyabs su mi 'gro ba yin te /
translated: Because the Vedas, the Samkhya, etc. do not have valid cognition, one does not go for refuge in them, thinking that they are infallible with regard to the principal matter, i.e., the transmission of the teachings.

original: gzhan las shes pa spangs pa la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan las shes pa spangs pa la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: But one does not avoid knowing from others.

original: tshigs su bcad pa'i tshig phyed snga ma rnam par 'grel pa ni /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa'i tshig phyed snga ma rnam par 'grel pa ni /
translated: The first half of the verse is commented on by:

original: tshad ma med pa brtag pa nyid la sogs pa la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshad ma med pa brtag pa nyid la sogs pa la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äúbecause of the investigation of the absence of valid cognition, etc.‚Äù

original: phyed phyi ma bshad pa ni /
analyzed: phyed phyi ma bshad pa ni /
translated: The second half is explained by:

original: tshad ma dngos po zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: tshad ma dngos po zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚Äúvalid cognition is a thing.‚Äù

original: ma shes pa ste mngon du mi byed pa la /
analyzed: ma shes pa ste mngon du mi byed pa la /
translated: ‚ÄúNot known‚Äù means not manifested.

original: de la dogs pa ni mngon sum du byed pa ste /
analyzed: de la dogs pa ni mngon sum du byed pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúDoubt‚Äù means manifested.

original: ma nges pa'o //
analyzed: ma nges pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNot ascertained‚Äù means

original: tshad mas yongs su bcad pa ni mngon sum gyis yongs su bcad pa la gnyis su med pa'am /
analyzed: tshad mas yongs su bcad pa ni mngon sum gyis yongs su bcad pa la gnyis su med pa'am /
translated: ‚Äúdetermined by valid cognition.‚Äù ‚ÄúDetermined by perception‚Äù means ‚Äúwithout duality.‚Äù

original: skad cig ma nyid kyi dngos po las dngos po rnams kyi snga ma dang phyi ma dag gis gnyis dang bral ba nyid ni de dang ldan pa nyid du mthong ba 'gal ba las de dang ldan pa nyid du mthong ba 'ongs pa yin na //
analyzed: skad cig ma nyid kyi dngos po las dngos po rnams kyi snga ma dang phyi ma dag gis gnyis dang bral ba nyid ni de dang ldan pa nyid du mthong ba 'gal ba las de dang ldan pa nyid du mthong ba 'ongs pa yin na //
translated: In the case of momentary things, the fact that they are devoid of a prior and subsequent end is seen to be their possession of that, and it is seen to be incompatible with the possession of that.

original: de las kyang de las byung ba'i 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams te /
analyzed: de las kyang de las byung ba'i 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams te /
translated: And from that, attachment and so on arise.

original: de'i phyir skad cig ma'am gnyis su med pa mngon du byed pa ni de dang 'gal ba spangs pa mngon du byed pa'i ngo bo yin par 'u bu cag la sogs pa'i yang mngon sum yin par gnyis su med pa la sogs pa mngon du byed pa de
analyzed: de'i phyir skad cig ma'am gnyis su med pa mngon du byed pa ni de dang 'gal ba spangs pa mngon du byed pa'i ngo bo yin par 'u bu cag la sogs pa'i yang mngon sum yin par gnyis su med pa la sogs pa mngon du byed pa de
translated: Therefore, the realization of momentariness or nonduality is the essence of the realization of the abandonment of that which is incompatible with it. This is directly perceived by us and others.

original: yang bsgoms pa khyad par can gyi phul du byung bar 'gro ba yin te /
analyzed: yang bsgoms pa khyad par can gyi phul du byung bar 'gro ba yin te /
translated: Moreover, the realization of nonduality and so on becomes the culmination of special meditation.

original: spangs pa phul du byung ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ba yang mngon sum yin no //
analyzed: spangs pa phul du byung ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ba yang mngon sum yin no //
translated: The possession of the culmination of abandonment is also directly perceived.

original: gnyis kyis bden pa'i bsgom pa ni gnyis kyi ngo bor 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyis kyis bden pa'i bsgom pa ni gnyis kyi ngo bor 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: The meditation on the two truths is not in the nature of the two.

original: bde ba dang 'dod chags la sogs pa gzhan las thos nas sam /
analyzed: bde ba dang 'dod chags la sogs pa gzhan las thos nas sam /
translated: Having heard from others about bliss, desire, and so on,

original: rang nyid kyis rig pa bsgom bzhin pa phul du byung bar 'gro ba ni gzung ba la sogs pa'i ngo bor 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rang nyid kyis rig pa bsgom bzhin pa phul du byung bar 'gro ba ni gzung ba la sogs pa'i ngo bor 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: or having cultivated them oneself, they do not become the nature of apprehended and apprehender.

original: de bzhin du gnyis su med pa la sogs pa bsgoms pas 'dod chags dang bral ba ma bslus pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du gnyis su med pa la sogs pa bsgoms pas 'dod chags dang bral ba ma bslus pa yin te /
translated: Similarly, through cultivating non-duality and so on, one becomes undeluded about freedom from desire.

original: dran pa goms pa phul du byung bas blo phul du byung ba skyes pa yin na /
analyzed: dran pa goms pa phul du byung bas blo phul du byung ba skyes pa yin na /
translated: When the mind becomes excellent through the excellence of cultivated mindfulness,

original: nyams su myong ba thams cad dran pa'i thams cad kyi shes par 'gyur pa @182b yin no zhes rtogs pa nye bar ston pa pos bstan pa las rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba thams cad dran pa'i thams cad kyi shes par 'gyur pa @182b yin no zhes rtogs pa nye bar ston pa pos bstan pa las rtogs pa yin no //
translated: all experiences become the cognition of all through mindfulness. This is understood from the teachings of the one who reveals realization.

original: nye bar bstan pa gcig pu'i yul la shes pa ni nye bar bstan pa las yin te /
analyzed: nye bar bstan pa gcig pu'i yul la shes pa ni nye bar bstan pa las yin te /
translated: Cognition of the object of a single revelation is from revelation.

original: nye bar bstan pa sngon du 'gro ba can du rtogs pa yin gyi mngon sum gyi yul la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nye bar bstan pa sngon du 'gro ba can du rtogs pa yin gyi mngon sum gyi yul la ni ma yin no //
translated: It is understood to be preceded by the teaching, but it is not the object of direct perception.

original: de'i phyir mngon sum gyi yul gyi khyad par can gyis nye bar ston pa pos bstan pa las mngon sum kho nar rtogs bzhin pa ni nye bar bstan pa tsam gyi shes pa dang 'gal ba dgag par byed pa yin pa'i phyir nye bar bstan pa brgyud pa
analyzed: de'i phyir mngon sum gyi yul gyi khyad par can gyis nye bar ston pa pos bstan pa las mngon sum kho nar rtogs bzhin pa ni nye bar bstan pa tsam gyi shes pa dang 'gal ba dgag par byed pa yin pa'i phyir nye bar bstan pa brgyud pa
translated: Therefore, the one who is in the process of understanding direct perception, which is qualified by the object of direct perception that is taught by the teacher, is refuting the contradiction with the mere cognition of the teaching, because the teaching is the indirect cause.

original: yin na mngon sum gyi yul khyad par can nye bar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: yin na mngon sum gyi yul khyad par can nye bar bstan pa ni /
translated: If the teaching is the indirect cause, then the teaching of the qualified object of direct perception

original: 'gal ba khyab pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'gal ba khyab pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: is pervaded by contradiction. This is the meaning.

original: rang nyid mngon sum gyi yul yin na de nyid kho na 'jug pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: rang nyid mngon sum gyi yul yin na de nyid kho na 'jug pa ma yin nam /
translated: If it is itself the object of direct perception, doesn't it just engage that?

original: mngon sum gyis ci dgos /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis ci dgos /
translated: What is the need for direct perception?

original: de ni de'i 'jug par byed pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: de ni de'i 'jug par byed pa yang ma yin la /
translated: It is not the cause of its engagement,

original: slu bar dogs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: slu bar dogs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: and there is no fear of deception,

original: rang nyid mngon sum yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: rang nyid mngon sum yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa la /
translated: because it is itself direct perception.

original: dogs su chug pa de lta na yang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dogs su chug pa de lta na yang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Even if it were doubted, it would be like this.

original: rang nyid mngon du byed pa kho nas mgu ba yin pa'i phyir nye bar ston pa po ni de mngon du byed par nges par 'gyur ba yin gyi /
analyzed: rang nyid mngon du byed pa kho nas mgu ba yin pa'i phyir nye bar ston pa po ni de mngon du byed par nges par 'gyur ba yin gyi /
translated: Because he is satisfied only by manifesting it himself, the teacher is certain to manifest it.

original: med pa las sam tshad ma med pa las ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: med pa las sam tshad ma med pa las ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is not from nonexistence or from nonvalid cognition.

original: da ltar byung ba'i shes pa dang spangs pa dag phul du byung ba ni bdag cag la sogs pa bzhin du nye bar ston pa po yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i shes pa dang spangs pa dag phul du byung ba ni bdag cag la sogs pa bzhin du nye bar ston pa po yin du zin kyang /
translated: Even if the teacher has the best present knowledge and abandonment, like us,

original: de'i khyad par 'gog pa mngon du byed pa la sogs pa bdag gi ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin la /
analyzed: de'i khyad par 'gog pa mngon du byed pa la sogs pa bdag gi ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin la /
translated: his special cessation, manifestation, and so on, will occur.üîΩHow do we know that it will occur for him?

original: de'i ni byung bar 'gyur ba yin par ci las shes snyam du sems pa ni 'on te tshad mas mthong ba yin yang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i ni byung bar 'gyur ba yin par ci las shes snyam du sems pa ni 'on te tshad mas mthong ba yin yang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Even if he sees it by valid cognition,

original: 'dir mngon du byed pa zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa yin zhes bya ba ltos pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir mngon du byed pa zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa yin zhes bya ba ltos pa yin no //
translated: Here, ‚Äúmanifestation‚Äù is cessation.

original: lan ni de ni 'dir 'gyur te zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: lan ni de ni 'dir 'gyur te zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The answer to that is ‚ÄúThat is not so here.‚ÄùüîΩFirst, since the teacher himself does not have the highest degree of wisdom and abandonment, it is not certain that the highest degree of wisdom and abandonment will arise in his disciples.

original: re zhig rang nyid la shes rab dang spangs pa dag phul du byung ba med pas 'byung bar 'gyur pa de'i phul du byung bar nges pa ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig rang nyid la shes rab dang spangs pa dag phul du byung ba med pas 'byung bar 'gyur pa de'i phul du byung bar nges pa ma yin te /
translated: The teacher‚Äôs teaching is not certain to arise from his disciples‚Äô highest degree of wisdom and abandonment.üîΩThe teacher‚Äôs teaching is not certain to arise from his disciples‚Äô highest degree of wisdom and abandonment.üîΩThe teacher‚Äôs teaching is not certain to arise from his disciples‚Äô highest degree of wisdom and abandonment.üîΩThe teacher‚Äôs teaching is not certain to arise from his disciples‚Äô highest degree of wisdom and abandonment.üîΩThe teacher‚Äôs teaching is not certain to arise from his disciples‚Äô highest degree of wisdom and abandonment.

original: rigs pa mtshungs pa nyid kyis ston pa po'i yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba las nges pa ma yin no zhes tshad mas mthong bar ston pa ni go byed yin pa'i phyir ltos pa dang bcas pa'i bsdu ba yin no //üîΩtshad mas mthong ba ston pa'am de ltar bstan pa yin no //üîΩnye bar bstan pa yang shes ba sngon du 'gro ba can gyi mthong ba yin @183a * //
analyzed: rigs pa mtshungs pa nyid kyis ston pa po'i yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba las nges pa ma yin no zhes tshad mas mthong bar ston pa ni go byed yin pa'i phyir ltos pa dang bcas pa'i bsdu ba yin no // tshad mas mthong ba ston pa'am de ltar bstan pa yin no // nye bar bstan pa yang shes ba sngon du 'gro ba can gyi mthong ba yin @183a * //
translated: The teacher‚Äôs teaching is not certain to arise from his disciples‚Äô highest degree of wisdom and abandonment.üîΩThe teacher‚Äôs teaching is not certain to arise from his disciples‚Äô highest degree of wisdom and abandonment.üîΩThe teacher‚Äôs teaching is not certain to arise from his disciples‚Äô highest degree of wisdom and abandonment.üîΩThe teacher‚Äôs teaching is not certain to arise from his disciples‚Äô highest degree of wisdom and abandonment.

original: na shes pa go byed yin la mngon sum gyi yul nyid kyi rang gi bye brag gis rtogs bya'i shes pa'i khyad par mngon du byed par rtogs par byed pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: na shes pa go byed yin la mngon sum gyi yul nyid kyi rang gi bye brag gis rtogs bya'i shes pa'i khyad par mngon du byed par rtogs par byed pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The teacher‚Äôs teaching is not certain to arise from his disciples‚Äô highest degree of wisdom and abandonment.üîΩThe teacher‚Äôs teaching is not certain to arise from his disciples‚Äô highest degree of wisdom and abandonment.üîΩThe teacher‚Äôs teaching is not certain to arise from his disciples‚Äô highest degree of wisdom and abandonment.üîΩThe teacher‚Äôs teaching is not certain to arise from his disciples‚Äô highest degree of wisdom and abandonment.üîΩThe teacher‚Äôs teaching is not certain to arise from his disciples‚Äô highest degree of wisdom and abandonment.

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa ni tshad mas mthong ba gsung ba yin zhes bya ba'o//
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa ni tshad mas mthong ba gsung ba yin zhes bya ba'o//
translated: The Blessed One is the one who teaches that the TathƒÅgata is seen by means of valid cognition.

original: de bzhin du nye bar bstan pa'i khyad par gyi shes pa'i khyad par ni mngon du byed pa yin no zhes nye bar bsdu ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du nye bar bstan pa'i khyad par gyi shes pa'i khyad par ni mngon du byed pa yin no zhes nye bar bsdu ba ni /
translated: Thus, the special cognition that is taught is the one that is manifested. The summary is:

original: bcom ldan 'das ni tshad ma nyid do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni tshad ma nyid do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The Blessed One is valid cognition.üîΩThe summary verse:

original: mtho ris dang ni byang grol lam //üîΩzhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'o //
analyzed: mtho ris dang ni byang grol lam // zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'o //
translated: The path to heaven and liberation

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni skyes bu'i don las gzhan gyi yul can gyi shes pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni skyes bu'i don las gzhan gyi yul can gyi shes pa'o //
translated: Thus, the cognition of an object other than the object of a person.

original: byung gyur byung dang 'byung 'gyur dngos //
analyzed: byung gyur byung dang 'byung 'gyur dngos //
translated: The actual past, future, and present

original: thog mtha' med par rim gyis ni //
analyzed: thog mtha' med par rim gyis ni //
translated: Without beginning or end,

original: so so re re rtog pa ni //
analyzed: so so re re rtog pa ni //
translated: The individual, each one, is imagined

original: bskal ba'i bar du'ang nus ma yin //
analyzed: bskal ba'i bar du'ang nus ma yin //
translated: Even for the duration of an eon.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa yul gzhan gyi shes pa bkag pa ni shes pa de khas blangs pa kho nas gsal ba yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa yul gzhan gyi shes pa bkag pa ni shes pa de khas blangs pa kho nas gsal ba yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The negation of cognition of another object, such as this, is shown to be clear by merely accepting that cognition.

original: 'dir ni chos mkhyen 'gog pa nyid //
analyzed: 'dir ni chos mkhyen 'gog pa nyid //
translated: Here, the knowledge of phenomena is the cessation itself.üîΩüîΩ

original: ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba ste /
translated: Here, the knowledge of Dharma is the cessation itself.

original: phyogs gcig mkhyen pa zhes bya ba ni skyes bu'i don gyi ngo bo phyogs gcig yongs su mkhyen pa yin par srid na'o //
analyzed: phyogs gcig mkhyen pa zhes bya ba ni skyes bu'i don gyi ngo bo phyogs gcig yongs su mkhyen pa yin par srid na'o //
translated: If it is said that one part is known, it is possible that one part of the nature of the person‚Äôs aim is completely known.

original: me ni grang ba'i sman yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: me ni grang ba'i sman yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because fire is the remedy for cold,

original: nye bar blang bya yin par bstan pa ni me ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar blang bya yin par bstan pa ni me ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: it is taught to be the object to be appropriated.

original: skyes bu'i don ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni skyes bu'i don gyi gtso bo las gzhan pa'i skyes bu'i don nyid ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: skyes bu'i don ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni skyes bu'i don gyi gtso bo las gzhan pa'i skyes bu'i don nyid ma yin pa'o //
translated: That which is not characterized by the person‚Äôs aim is not the person‚Äôs aim itself, other than the principal person‚Äôs aim.

original: las dang 'bras bu 'brel ba'i shes pa ni dran pa goms pas blo gsal ba yin na /
analyzed: las dang 'bras bu 'brel ba'i shes pa ni dran pa goms pas blo gsal ba yin na /
translated: The knowledge of the connection between action and effect is the clarity of mind through the cultivation of mindfulness.

original: 'di 'byung ngo zhes 'di dag bstan pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'di 'byung ngo zhes 'di dag bstan pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt it taught that this arises?

original: de ni mi shes te de ci me'i sbyin sreg la sogs pa'am /
analyzed: de ni mi shes te de ci me'i sbyin sreg la sogs pa'am /
translated: That is not known. What is it? Is it the fire offering, etc.,

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa yin no snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa yin no snyam du sems pa la /
translated: or is it generosity, etc.?

original: des pa'i las bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des pa'i las bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the proper action,

original: mtho ris dang ni byang grol lam //
analyzed: mtho ris dang ni byang grol lam //
translated: the path to heaven and liberation,

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: This is the meaning.

original: yul rnam par dag pa gnyis la mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa rnam par gzhag pa yin la /
analyzed: yul rnam par dag pa gnyis la mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa rnam par gzhag pa yin la /
translated: Direct perception and inference are posited in relation to the two pure objects.

original: skyes bu'i don thar pa'i lam gyi ngo bo la ni bstan bcos de'i phyogs gcig bstan pa dang 'gal ba can gzhan tshad mas yongs su dpyad bya nyid ma yin pa'i las me'i sbyin sreg la sogs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: skyes bu'i don thar pa'i lam gyi ngo bo la ni bstan bcos de'i phyogs gcig bstan pa dang 'gal ba can gzhan tshad mas yongs su dpyad bya nyid ma yin pa'i las me'i sbyin sreg la sogs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: But in the case of the object of a person, the path to liberation, the treatise does not teach a different part that is contradictory to what is taught, such as fire sacrifice, which is not an object to be analyzed by a valid means of knowledge.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni dngul chu dang bcud kyis len dang dbang du @183b byed pa la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye bas mi shes pas mgu bar bstan pa ni thams cad shes pa ma yin zhes bya bas ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i shes pa ma yin
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni dngul chu dang bcud kyis len dang dbang du @183b byed pa la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye bas mi shes pas mgu bar bstan pa ni thams cad shes pa ma yin zhes bya bas ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i shes pa ma yin
translated: Moreover, since the divisions of mercury, elixir, and subjugation are not known, the teaching to please is stated by ‚Äúnot all knowing,‚Äù meaning not the knowledge of an omniscient one.

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This is the meaning.

original: mi slu ba de ni shes pa srid pa dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir nye bar bstan pa brgyud pa dor bya ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: mi slu ba de ni shes pa srid pa dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir nye bar bstan pa brgyud pa dor bya ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: Since that nondeceptive knowledge is not incompatible with existence, the teaching of the transmission is taught as not to be discarded.

original: de'i phyir chad ma can gyi don gsungs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir chad ma can gyi don gsungs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Therefore, the meaning of ‚Äúone who is bereft of a limb‚Äù is stated.

original: gang gi phyir shes pa dang ldan pa nan tan bya ba'i don du btsal ba ni /
analyzed: gang gi phyir shes pa dang ldan pa nan tan bya ba'i don du btsal ba ni /
translated: Because one who is endowed with knowledge seeks the meaning of practice,

original: de phyir de yi ye shes ni //üîΩnan tan bya rtogs rnam dpyad bya'o //
analyzed: de phyir de yi ye shes ni // nan tan bya rtogs rnam dpyad bya'o //
translated: therefore his knowledge

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: should be understood through the analysis of practice.

original: yul gzhan ni ma yin te dgos pa med pa'i phyir dang mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul gzhan ni ma yin te dgos pa med pa'i phyir dang mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not another object, because that would serve no purpose and would be impossible.

original: las dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa shes pa srid pa bzhin du yul gzhan shes pa srid pa ni don gyi gtso bo la mi slu bar khyad par med pas so //
analyzed: las dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa shes pa srid pa bzhin du yul gzhan shes pa srid pa ni don gyi gtso bo la mi slu bar khyad par med pas so //
translated: Just as it is possible to know the connection between action and result, so it is possible to know another object, because there is no difference in the principal purpose of nondeception.

original: de'i shes pa'i shes bya rnam par rig pa dang bral ba rnams kyis ji ltar go ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: de'i shes pa'i shes bya rnam par rig pa dang bral ba rnams kyis ji ltar go ba yin zhe na /
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúHow can those who know the object of that knowledge, which is free from representations, understand it?‚Äù

original: las dang 'bras bu la sogs pa shes par mtshungs pa yin no //
analyzed: las dang 'bras bu la sogs pa shes par mtshungs pa yin no //
translated: It is similar to knowing action, result, and so on.

original: 'on te rgyu yod pa las de la mi slu ba'i phyir de yod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te rgyu yod pa las de la mi slu ba'i phyir de yod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say, ‚ÄúIt exists because it is not deceptive with regard to the existence of a cause,‚Äù

original: de ni gzhan la yang mtshungs so //
analyzed: de ni gzhan la yang mtshungs so //
translated: that is the same for others.

original: 'di la rnam par dbye bas shes pa med do zhe na la sogs pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: 'di la rnam par dbye bas shes pa med do zhe na la sogs pa la yang ngo //
translated: If it is argued that it is not known by means of analysis, etc.

original: de'i phyir yul gzhan shes pa dgos pa med pa nyid kyi phyir brtag bya ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir yul gzhan shes pa dgos pa med pa nyid kyi phyir brtag bya ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the necessity of knowing other objects is shown to be groundless:

original: de yis srin po'i grangs mkhyen pa /
analyzed: de yis srin po'i grangs mkhyen pa /
translated: By that, one knows the number of demons,

original: ded la 'ga' yang nyer mkho med //üîΩces bya ba'o //
analyzed: ded la 'ga' yang nyer mkho med // ces bya ba'o //
translated: but it is of no use to the caravan.

original: de lta yin na las dang 'bras bu la sogs pa'i shes pa dang shes pa gzhan yang gang gi srid par byed pa ste /
analyzed: de lta yin na las dang 'bras bu la sogs pa'i shes pa dang shes pa gzhan yang gang gi srid par byed pa ste /
translated: If that were so, then the knowledge of karma, result, etc., and other knowledge would be the cause of existence,üîΩbecause it would be too much to be just the knowledge of one part.

original: phyogs gcig shes pa tsam du mi 'gyur ba yin gyi thal ches pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa la rgyu mtshan gyi khyad par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: phyogs gcig shes pa tsam du mi 'gyur ba yin gyi thal ches pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa la rgyu mtshan gyi khyad par bstan pa ni /
translated: The distinctive reason is taught:

original: dor dang blang bya'i de nyid ni //
analyzed: dor dang blang bya'i de nyid ni //
translated: The reality of what is to be rejected and accepted,

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: is not known by that.

original: don gyi gtso bo la mi slu ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don gyi gtso bo la mi slu ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not deceptive with regard to the principal object.

original: nan tan du bya ba'i shes pa rtogs pa la don gyi gtso bo mi slu ba bzhin du thams cad shes pa nyid kyang rgyu mtshan ma yin par gang gis shes pa bya bar 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: nan tan du bya ba'i shes pa rtogs pa la don gyi gtso bo mi slu ba bzhin du thams cad shes pa nyid kyang rgyu mtshan ma yin par gang gis shes pa bya bar 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
translated: The following verse is stated to illustrate that just as the principal object is not deceptive in the realization of the knowledge of earnest practice, so also the knowledge of all things is not a reason for the knowledge of the knower.

original: ring por mthong ngam min yang rung //
analyzed: ring por mthong ngam min yang rung //
translated: Whether one sees it from far away or not,

original: 'dod pa'i de nyid mthong ba yin //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i de nyid mthong ba yin //
translated: one sees the reality of the desire realm.

original: zhes bya ba ste thag ring bor mthong ba po'i rtogs pa la yang don gyi gtso bo la mi slu ba med na nan tan bya ba shes pa srid pa ji skad bstan pa'i rim pas med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste thag ring bor mthong ba po'i rtogs pa la yang don gyi gtso bo la mi slu ba med na nan tan bya ba shes pa srid pa ji skad bstan pa'i rim pas med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If the principal object is not deceptive in the realization of the knowledge of the seer who sees from far away, then the knowledge of earnest practice does not exist, as has been explained.

original: de bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de bstan pa ni /
translated: This is illustrated:

original: gal te ring mthong tshad yin na//
analyzed: gal te ring mthong tshad yin na//
translated: If seeing from far away is valid cognition,

original: @184a * // tshur shog bya rgod bsnyen bkur gyis //
analyzed: @184a * // tshur shog bya rgod bsnyen bkur gyis //
translated: then come and pay homage to the vulture!

original: zhes bya ba'o //üîΩde ltar rnam par 'grel par ni //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o // de ltar rnam par 'grel par ni //
translated: Thus,

original: ring po mthong ba yod do zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ring po mthong ba yod do zhes bya ba ste /
translated: there is the knowledge of seeing from far away.

original: de de bzhin du rtogs par 'dod pa po'i thams cad kyi shes pa dgos pa can ma yin la mthong ba po dang ston pa bo'i ni dgos pa yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin du rtogs par 'dod pa po'i thams cad kyi shes pa dgos pa can ma yin la mthong ba po dang ston pa bo'i ni dgos pa yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Thus, the consciousness of one who desires to understand that way is not purposeful, but the consciousness of one who sees and teaches is purposeful.üîΩIf one does not understand even one thing, it is not reasonable to claim that the teaching is not impaired.

original: gcig kyang yongs su mi shes na bsgrub pa ma nyams pa mi rigs pa'i phyir zhes brjod pas yod pa yang yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gcig kyang yongs su mi shes na bsgrub pa ma nyams pa mi rigs pa'i phyir zhes brjod pas yod pa yang yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThe Omniscient One is not refuted‚Äù teaches that the Omniscient One exists.

original: thams cad rig par mdzad pa yi /üîΩthams cad mkhyen pa 'gog pa min /
analyzed: thams cad rig par mdzad pa yi / thams cad mkhyen pa 'gog pa min /
translated: The Omniscient One who knows all

original: zhes bya ba ste /üîΩnged kyis shes par mi nus pas te dgos pa yod pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba la ltos pa yin te ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste / nged kyis shes par mi nus pas te dgos pa yod pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba la ltos pa yin te ;
translated: is not refuted.üîΩSince we cannot know that, the statement ‚Äúbecause of the existence of a purpose‚Äù is dependent on that.

original: la sogs pa'i shes pa srid pa bzhin du de'i srid par yang nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: la sogs pa'i shes pa srid pa bzhin du de'i srid par yang nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Just as the existence of the consciousness of one who sees and so on is possible, so too the existence of the Omniscient One is possible.

original: mtho ris dang byang grol gyi lam gyis shes pa'i lkog tu gyur pa'i don shes pa po nyid tshad ma nyid yin gyi thams cad ni ma yin te nan tan du bya ba'i yul yin ba'i phyir dang / don kyi gtso bo la mi slu ba'i 'bras bus shes par bya ba yang yin no zhes tshad ma nyid kyis rang gi ngo bo go bar byed pa yang rtogs par byas nas da ni rgyu bstan pa ni /
analyzed: mtho ris dang byang grol gyi lam gyis shes pa'i lkog tu gyur pa'i don shes pa po nyid tshad ma nyid yin gyi thams cad ni ma yin te nan tan du bya ba'i yul yin ba'i phyir dang / don kyi gtso bo la mi slu ba'i 'bras bus shes par bya ba yang yin no zhes tshad ma nyid kyis rang gi ngo bo go bar byed pa yang rtogs par byas nas da ni rgyu bstan pa ni /
translated: Having understood that the nature of valid cognition is to be understood by itself, now the cause is taught:üîΩThat is from the cultivation of compassion,

original: sgrub byed thugs rje bsgoms las de //
analyzed: sgrub byed thugs rje bsgoms las de //
translated: the means of accomplishment.

original: zhes bya ba ste thugs rje la sogs pa bsgom pa'i rim gyis dran ba goms pa ni dbang po las 'das pa shes pa'i rgyu yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste thugs rje la sogs pa bsgom pa'i rim gyis dran ba goms pa ni dbang po las 'das pa shes pa'i rgyu yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the cause of consciousness that transcends the senses is the cultivation of mindfulness through the stages of cultivating compassion and so forth.

original: gnyi ga'i mtshan nyid la yang zhes bya ba ni skyes bu'i don gyi gtso bo shes pa dang thams cad kyi shes pa yang ngo //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i mtshan nyid la yang zhes bya ba ni skyes bu'i don gyi gtso bo shes pa dang thams cad kyi shes pa yang ngo //
translated: Also in both characteristics means the knowledge of the principal meaning of a person and the knowledge of everything.

original: sgrub pa gang las zhes bya ba ni rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa gang las zhes bya ba ni rdzogs pa'o //
translated: From what is accomplished? means from the complete.

original: rgyu yang gang yin zhes bya ba ni de ltar rdzogs pa yang gzhan gyi don la 'jug pa med na tshad ma nyid ma yin pa'i phyir de la 'jug pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩrgyu yang gang yin zhes bya ba 'di la sbyor bar byed pa yin no //üîΩyang na sgrub pa zhes bya ba thugs rje bsgoms pa'i sgo nas blo tsam ni lus la brten pa nyid kyis dran pa goms pa las kyang sngon gyi gnas shes pa med pa kho na yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: rgyu yang gang yin zhes bya ba ni de ltar rdzogs pa yang gzhan gyi don la 'jug pa med na tshad ma nyid ma yin pa'i phyir de la 'jug pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba'i don to // rgyu yang gang yin zhes bya ba 'di la sbyor bar byed pa yin no // yang na sgrub pa zhes bya ba thugs rje bsgoms pa'i sgo nas blo tsam ni lus la brten pa nyid kyis dran pa goms pa las kyang sngon gyi gnas shes pa med pa kho na yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: The meaning is that if one who is perfect does not engage in the welfare of others, then he is not a valid person. The cause of that is the cultivation of compassion.

original: blo ni lus la brten pa'i phyir //üîΩzhes bya ba ste 'jig rten 'di ni 'jig rten gzhan gyi 'bras bu yin na /
analyzed: blo ni lus la brten pa'i phyir // zhes bya ba ste 'jig rten 'di ni 'jig rten gzhan gyi 'bras bu yin na /
translated: The cultivation of compassion is the cause of the knowledge of the destinies of beings.üîΩOr, the cultivation of compassion is the cause of the knowledge of the destinies of beings.üîΩOr, the cultivation of compassion is the cause of the knowledge of the destinies of beings.üîΩOr, the cultivation of compassion is the cause of the knowledge of the destinies of beings.üîΩOr, the cultivation of compassion is the cause of the knowledge of the destinies of beings.üîΩOr, the cultivation of compassion is the cause of the knowledge of the destinies of beings.

original: dran ba goms pa las las dang 'bras bu 'brel pa'i khyad par shes pa ni sngon gyi gnas shes pa'i rim gyis 'gyur ba yin gyi /üîΩ'di srid pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dran ba goms pa las las dang 'bras bu 'brel pa'i khyad par shes pa ni sngon gyi gnas shes pa'i rim gyis 'gyur ba yin gyi /üîΩ'di srid pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Or, the cultivation of compassion is the cause of the knowledge of the destinies

original: 'jig rten @184b 'di ni 'jig rten gzhan tsam gyi 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'jig rten @184b 'di ni 'jig rten gzhan tsam gyi 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: because this world is the effect of another world.

original: rten ni bkag phyir ro zhes bya ba ni blo'i rten nyid rang gi ngo bo rig pa las gzhan pa rig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rten ni bkag phyir ro zhes bya ba ni blo'i rten nyid rang gi ngo bo rig pa las gzhan pa rig pa ma yin te /
translated: The support is refuted, because the support of cognition is not cognition, as it is not different from the nature of cognition.

original: gang gi phyir dkar po la sogs pa'i ngo bo lta bur de srog la sogs pa bzhin du rdzas la brten par dmigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dkar po la sogs pa'i ngo bo lta bur de srog la sogs pa bzhin du rdzas la brten par dmigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Because it is not perceived as a substance, like the nature of white, etc., like life, etc.

original: shes pa dang ldan pa ni srog dang ldan par dmigs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: shes pa dang ldan pa ni srog dang ldan par dmigs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But it is perceived as having life, because it has consciousness.

original: ma yin te lus ni yul mtshungs pa nyid kyis de ltar sgro btags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te lus ni yul mtshungs pa nyid kyis de ltar sgro btags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because the body is imputed in that way by the mere similarity of the object.

original: 'on te lus las gzhan po shes pa can dang srog can du 'gyur ba de lta na yang 'jig rten pha rol po yod pa'i phyir thog ma med pa'i skye ba brgyud pa goms pa las gsal bar 'gyur ba yin no //
