analyzed: 'on te lus las gzhan po shes pa can dang srog can du 'gyur ba de lta na yang 'jig rten pha rol po yod pa'i phyir thog ma med pa'i skye ba brgyud pa goms pa las gsal bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: But if it were different from the body, it would be conscious and have life. Even so, because of the existence of another world, it becomes clear through the practice of beginningless transmigration.

original: 'ba' zhig pa gzhan po 'di dag gang kho na yin pa kho bo cag la nges pa med do //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig pa gzhan po 'di dag gang kho na yin pa kho bo cag la nges pa med do //
translated: We are not certain which of these is the correct explanation.

original: dbugs rngub pa dang 'byin par byed pa gang yin pa de yin no zhe na /üîΩlus nyid dbugs 'byung rngub byed pa ma yin nam gzhan ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dbugs rngub pa dang 'byin par byed pa gang yin pa de yin no zhe na / lus nyid dbugs 'byung rngub byed pa ma yin nam gzhan ni ma yin te /
translated: If you say that it is the in-breath and out-breath,üîΩis not the body itself the in-breath and out-breath?

original: mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not something else, because the body is not conceptual.

original: gang gi phyir srog la sogs pa rnams ni gzhan ba'i chos nyid dang 'bras bu nyid du dmigs pa ni ma yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir srog la sogs pa rnams ni gzhan ba'i chos nyid dang 'bras bu nyid du dmigs pa ni ma yin la /
translated: Because life-force and so on are not observed as the intrinsic nature of another or as its effect,

original: lus kyi ni yin te /üîΩde yang yod pa nyid du dmigs pa'i phyir ro lus kyi yon tan dang chos mi mthun pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: lus kyi ni yin te / de yang yod pa nyid du dmigs pa'i phyir ro lus kyi yon tan dang chos mi mthun pa yang ma yin te /
translated: but the body is observed as their effect.üîΩAnd the body is not incompatible with the qualities of the body, because as long as the substance exists, its two qualities exist.

original: ji srid rdzas yod pa nyid kyis de'i yon tan rnam pa gnyis yin pa'i phyir lus ji srid pa de srid du 'di'i yon tan gzugs la sogs pa rnams yin la /
analyzed: ji srid rdzas yod pa nyid kyis de'i yon tan rnam pa gnyis yin pa'i phyir lus ji srid pa de srid du 'di'i yon tan gzugs la sogs pa rnams yin la /
translated: As long as the body exists, its qualities such as form exist.

original: ji srid rdzas yod pa nyid du ring ba la sogs pa yang yin /
analyzed: ji srid rdzas yod pa nyid du ring ba la sogs pa yang yin /
translated: And as long as the substance exists, its qualities such as distance exist.

original: tsho ba nyid la sogs pa'i gnas skabs gzhan bskyed pas rid pa med par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: tsho ba nyid la sogs pa'i gnas skabs gzhan bskyed pas rid pa med par byed pa yin te /
translated: It is not emaciated because it generates other states such as youthfulness.üîΩ

original: gzugs la sogs pa'am gzugs la sogs pa gzhan skyed pa'i phyir mi mthun pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'am gzugs la sogs pa gzhan skyed pa'i phyir mi mthun pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not a cause of destruction because it generates another state of the continuum, such as youthfulness, and it is not a cause of nonconcordance because it generates either form or another form.

original: de lta yin na de srog la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams kyang zhig pa'i rgyu ni de'i bral ba nye bar mtshon pa gnas skabs gzhan skye ba yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta yin na de srog la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams kyang zhig pa'i rgyu ni de'i bral ba nye bar mtshon pa gnas skabs gzhan skye ba yod pa'i phyir /
translated: If that were so, then the cause of the destruction of the qualities of life force and so on would be the generation of another state that is the mere absence of that life force and so on.

original: chos mi mthun pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: chos mi mthun pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: It would not be a cause of nonconcordance.

original: de yang 'on te de la gnas skabs gzhan de bzhin du 'chi ba la yang 'dod ces smos pa'o //üîΩde lta yin na gang gi tshe lus gnas skabs de kho na yin na /
analyzed: de yang 'on te de la gnas skabs gzhan de bzhin du 'chi ba la yang 'dod ces smos pa'o // de lta yin na gang gi tshe lus gnas skabs de kho na yin na /
translated: If that were so, then you would have to assert that death is also like that, that is, that it is the generation of another state.

original: srog la sogs pa dang bral bar gyur ba ji ltar yin /üîΩre zhig gnas skabs gzhan ni de med pa ma rtogs pa dmigs pa ma yin la /üîΩgang gi tshe bral ba kho na bral @185a * //
analyzed: srog la sogs pa dang bral bar gyur ba ji ltar yin / re zhig gnas skabs gzhan ni de med pa ma rtogs pa dmigs pa ma yin la / gang gi tshe bral ba kho na bral @185a * //
translated: If that were so, then when the body is in that state, how could it be devoid of life force and so on?üîΩThe generation of another state is not observed to be the absence of that state.

original: ba'i rgyu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ba'i rgyu ni ma yin no //
translated: When there is mere absence, it is not the cause of absence.

original: de bstan pa ni 'di la dbye ba 'di tsam ste /
analyzed: de bstan pa ni 'di la dbye ba 'di tsam ste /
translated: The teaching of this is just this much:üîΩThe body is stable,

original: lus la brtan po nyid yin ba'i //üîΩtshad yod de dang bral ba yin //
analyzed: lus la brtan po nyid yin ba'i // tshad yod de dang bral ba yin //
translated: but it is not permanent,

original: rgyu mtshan shes pa ma yin no //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan shes pa ma yin no // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: and it is not known as the reason.

original: dmigs bya ma yin pa'i gnas skabs gzhan ni brtag par 'os pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dmigs bya ma yin pa'i gnas skabs gzhan ni brtag par 'os pa ma yin te /
translated: The other state of being not an object of observation is not suitable to be examined,

original: dmigs bya lus la dmigs bya ma yin pa'i gnas skabs mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs bya lus la dmigs bya ma yin pa'i gnas skabs mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not logical that the body, which is an object of observation, would be in a state of not being an object of observation.

original: gzugs la sogs pa la ni me dang phrad pa bzhin du 'di'i rgyu gzhan du rtogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa la ni me dang phrad pa bzhin du 'di'i rgyu gzhan du rtogs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not understood that its cause is different, like the cause of form, etc.,

original: rdzas ma zhig na de'i yon tan gzhig par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzas ma zhig na de'i yon tan gzhig par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because when the substance is not destroyed, its qualities cannot be destroyed.

original: nus na ni yon tan gzhan skyed par mi nus te /
analyzed: nus na ni yon tan gzhan skyed par mi nus te /
translated: If it could, it could not generate other qualities.

original: de gnyi ga yang lus la dmigs pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de gnyi ga yang lus la dmigs pa ma yin la /
translated: Both of those are not objects of observation of the body.

original: yon tan ni rdzas zhig pa las sam rdzas gzhan gyi gnod pas 'jig par nye bar 'gro ba ma yin no //
analyzed: yon tan ni rdzas zhig pa las sam rdzas gzhan gyi gnod pas 'jig par nye bar 'gro ba ma yin no //
translated: And qualities do not approach destruction from the destruction of the substance or from the harm of another substance.

original: de'i phyir gtugs pas zhig par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gtugs pas zhig par byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is destroyed by the exhaustion of its cause.

original: re zhig thams cad kyi 'chi ba la ni de gnyis mthong ba ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig thams cad kyi 'chi ba la ni de gnyis mthong ba ma yin te /
translated: For a while, those two are not seen in the death of all.

original: ma nyams pa'i lus las srog la sogs pa bral ba yin te /
analyzed: ma nyams pa'i lus las srog la sogs pa bral ba yin te /
translated: Life force and so on are separated from the body that has not been damaged.

original: rang dang gzhan gyi mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir 'dod pa dang sdang ba dang 'bad pa dang dge ba dang sdug bsngal gyi shes pa rnams ni lus kyi ma yin te /
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir 'dod pa dang sdang ba dang 'bad pa dang dge ba dang sdug bsngal gyi shes pa rnams ni lus kyi ma yin te /
translated: Knowledge of desire, anger, exertion, virtue and pain are not of the body because they are not directly perceptible to oneself or others.

original: gzugs la sogs pa de'i chos rnams gzhan gyi dbang po rnams kyis mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa de'i chos rnams gzhan gyi dbang po rnams kyis mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because form and so on, which are its qualities, are not apprehended by the sense faculties of others.

original: / bde ba la sogs pa ni de ma thag pa yin pa'i phyir rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: / bde ba la sogs pa ni de ma thag pa yin pa'i phyir rtogs pa yin te /
translated: Pleasure and so on are understood because they are its immediate result.

original: rtag tu rab tu dga' ba'i rang bzhin can yin pa la sogs pa'i rtags las go ba yin no //üîΩlus la ni de rnams kyi dmigs pa longs spyod pa'i gnas 'di yin ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag tu rab tu dga' ba'i rang bzhin can yin pa la sogs pa'i rtags las go ba yin no // lus la ni de rnams kyi dmigs pa longs spyod pa'i gnas 'di yin ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They are understood from the evidence of the body's nature, which is always delighted and so on.üîΩThe body is the basis for the enjoyment of those objects.

original: de rnams gang gi yin pa de'i longs spyod kyi gnas ni lus dang yon tan nyid kyang yin te /
analyzed: de rnams gang gi yin pa de'i longs spyod kyi gnas ni lus dang yon tan nyid kyang yin te /
translated: The body is the basis for the enjoyment of those objects that belong to them.

original: de rnams kyi spyi dang khyad par dang ldan pa nyid yin na ro la sogs pa bzhin du mig gi mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩyon tan rnams kyang yon tan gyi rten du bya ba ma yin pa go bar byed pa yin gyi lus la sogs pa ni gnas ma yin te /
analyzed: de rnams kyi spyi dang khyad par dang ldan pa nyid yin na ro la sogs pa bzhin du mig gi mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir ro // yon tan rnams kyang yon tan gyi rten du bya ba ma yin pa go bar byed pa yin gyi lus la sogs pa ni gnas ma yin te /
translated: If it were endowed with the general and specific qualities, it would not be the perception of the eye, like taste, etc.üîΩThe qualities are not the basis of the qualities, but the body, etc. are the basis of the qualities, because they are the cause of the qualities.

original: de'i yon tan dang chos dang chos can mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i yon tan dang chos dang chos can mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The qualities and the body, etc. are not similar, because the qualities and the attributes of the body are not similar.

original: gnas skabs kyi dgag pa la yang lhag pa cig shos rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir 'dod pa la sogs pa rnams las bdag grub pa yin no //
analyzed: gnas skabs kyi dgag pa la yang lhag pa cig shos rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir 'dod pa la sogs pa rnams las bdag grub pa yin no //
translated: And because the other, the remainder, is understood in the negation of the state, the self is established from desire, etc.

original: yon tan nyid yin pa'i phyir bde ba la sogs pa ni ro la sogs pa bzhin du brten pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: yon tan nyid yin pa'i phyir bde ba la sogs pa ni ro la sogs pa bzhin du brten pa nyid yin la /
translated: Because of being a quality, pleasure, etc. are the basis, like taste, etc.

original: @185b gang la brten pa de yang bdag yin no zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: @185b gang la brten pa de yang bdag yin no zhes zer ba la /
translated: And that which is the basis is the self.

original: de'i lan du brten pa nyid du dmigs pa'i rgyu mtshan ni yon tan nyid yin te /
analyzed: de'i lan du brten pa nyid du dmigs pa'i rgyu mtshan ni yon tan nyid yin te /
translated: The reason for the perception of the basis is the quality.

original: rang gi ngo bo dmigs pa ni rgyu mtshan ma yin te thal ches pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo dmigs pa ni rgyu mtshan ma yin te thal ches pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The object of the intrinsic nature is not the reason, because that would be an overextension.

original: mig gis sam gzhan gyis kyang nye bar dmigs pa la ni bye brag ci yang med do //
analyzed: mig gis sam gzhan gyis kyang nye bar dmigs pa la ni bye brag ci yang med do //
translated: There is no difference at all whether the eye or something else is the object of perception.

original: bde ba can zhes bya ba dang dbyig pa can zhes bya ba'i shes pa'i rgyu mtshan ni de dang 'brel pa yin gyi yon tan nyid ni rgyu mtshan ma yin pa'i phyir dang / yon tan rnams ni gzhan dbang yin pa'i phyir yon tan dang ldan ba rjes su dpag par bya ba yin pa ni /
analyzed: bde ba can zhes bya ba dang dbyig pa can zhes bya ba'i shes pa'i rgyu mtshan ni de dang 'brel pa yin gyi yon tan nyid ni rgyu mtshan ma yin pa'i phyir dang / yon tan rnams ni gzhan dbang yin pa'i phyir yon tan dang ldan ba rjes su dpag par bya ba yin pa ni /
translated: The reason for the cognition called ‚Äúhappy‚Äù or ‚Äúunhappy‚Äù is the connection with that, but the quality itself is not the reason, because the qualities are dependent, and the possessor of the qualities is to be inferred.

original: yon tan nyid du grub na'o //
analyzed: yon tan nyid du grub na'o //
translated: But that is established only if the quality itself is established.

original: de'i phyir de ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni /
translated: Therefore,

original: bde ba la sogs pa rnams la ma grub po //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa rnams la ma grub po //
translated: that is not established for the proponents of happiness, etc.

original: srog can dang bde ba can dang shes pa can la sogs pa bde ba la sogs pa dang 'brel pa can ni lus las gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: srog can dang bde ba can dang shes pa can la sogs pa bde ba la sogs pa dang 'brel pa can ni lus las gzhan ma yin no //
translated: The possessor of happiness, etc., which is connected with happiness, etc., is not different from the body.

original: nga ni bde ba can no zhes bya ba ni gzhan yin no zhe na /
analyzed: nga ni bde ba can no zhes bya ba ni gzhan yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the statement ‚ÄúI am happy‚Äù refers to something else,üîΩthen that is not established.

original: ma yin te nga 'gro zhes bya ba ni lus yin par rtogs pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: ma yin te nga 'gro zhes bya ba ni lus yin par rtogs pa'i phyir ro /
translated: But that is not so, because it is understood that ‚ÄúI go‚Äù is the body.

original: bdag gi lus bya ba yang bdag gi bdag nyid de gnas skabs ni de'i rgyu mtshan yin no //
analyzed: bdag gi lus bya ba yang bdag gi bdag nyid de gnas skabs ni de'i rgyu mtshan yin no //
translated: And the activity of the body is the self‚Äôs own nature, and the state is the reason for that.

original: shes pa ni shes bya re re la tha dad pa yin la /
analyzed: shes pa ni shes bya re re la tha dad pa yin la /
translated: Consciousness is different for each object of consciousness.üîΩAnd the state of the self, which is not different, is the object of the expression ‚ÄúI see.‚Äù

original: tha mi dad pa'i bdag gi gnas skabs yin zhes rgol ba dang ma mthong ba'i dbye ba yang shes pa'i rgyu can yin zhes bya ba'i tshigs las yin la /
analyzed: tha mi dad pa'i bdag gi gnas skabs yin zhes rgol ba dang ma mthong ba'i dbye ba yang shes pa'i rgyu can yin zhes bya ba'i tshigs las yin la /
translated: And the distinction of the seen and the unseen is based on consciousness.

original: de bzhin du bong tshod dang gdong dang dbang po la sogs pa'i tshogs pa ni bdag yin zhes bya bar lta ba la ni de'i lus zhes bya bar 'gyur ba kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du bong tshod dang gdong dang dbang po la sogs pa'i tshogs pa ni bdag yin zhes bya bar lta ba la ni de'i lus zhes bya bar 'gyur ba kho na yin gyi /
translated: In the same way, the view that the collection of size, face, sense faculties, and so on is the self is just the view that the body is the self.

original: 'khrul pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'khrul pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: But it is not even a mistake,

original: gzhan la bdag ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan la bdag ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the self is not established as other.

original: gzhan gyis mthong ba yin na dran pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan gyis mthong ba yin na dran pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir /
translated: If it were seen by another, memory would not be established.

original: dran pa po nye bar dmigs pa yin no zhes bya bar yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: dran pa po nye bar dmigs pa yin no zhes bya bar yang mi rigs te /
translated: It is not tenable to say that the self is perceived by the one who remembers.

original: nye bar dmigs pa tsam gyi 'bras bu nyid ni dran pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nye bar dmigs pa tsam gyi 'bras bu nyid ni dran pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Memory is the result of mere apprehension.

original: de tsam gyis 'bras bu nyid ni 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: de tsam gyis 'bras bu nyid ni 'dod pa yin no //
translated: This is the result that is accepted.

original: dmigs pa la mi brten par dran pa kho nas 'dod pa 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: dmigs pa la mi brten par dran pa kho nas 'dod pa 'jug pa yin te /
translated: Memory alone, without depending on the object, engages the object that is accepted.

original: dmigs pa mtshungs pa 'di'i byed pa por nges pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dmigs pa mtshungs pa 'di'i byed pa por nges pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not certain that the object is its agent,

original: nye bar dmigs pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas dran pa'i bdag nyid du mtshungs par 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: nye bar dmigs pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas dran pa'i bdag nyid du mtshungs par 'dod pa yin no //
translated: because memory is accepted as similar to it, following the apprehension.

original: des na byed pa po yod pa yin te /
analyzed: des na byed pa po yod pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, the agent exists.

original: de ni don gnyis par brjod pa yin no //üîΩnye bar dmigs pa de yang shu kra dang rakta la sogs pa 'byung ba'i 'bras bu ni de yon tan yin nam /
analyzed: de ni don gnyis par brjod pa yin no // nye bar dmigs pa de yang shu kra dang rakta la sogs pa 'byung ba'i 'bras bu ni de yon tan yin nam /
translated: This is the second topic.

original: rang dbang yang rung ste @186a * //
analyzed: rang dbang yang rung ste @186a * //
translated: Is that apprehension the result of the production of semen, blood, etc., or is it a quality of them, or is it independent?

original: thal ches pa ma yin no //
analyzed: thal ches pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not excessive.

original: 'byung ba rnams nyid rang bzhin kho nas gcig la gcig nyid kyis tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir gcig gi ngo bo nyid la yongs su 'gyur ba'i khyad par gyis /
analyzed: 'byung ba rnams nyid rang bzhin kho nas gcig la gcig nyid kyis tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir gcig gi ngo bo nyid la yongs su 'gyur ba'i khyad par gyis /
translated: The elements themselves are different from each other by their very nature, and therefore, the mind is not a transformation of the nature of one of them.üîΩThe mind is the transformation of the nature of all the elements.üîΩThe mind is the transformation of the nature of all the elements, because the mind is the transformation of the nature of all the elements, and because the mind is the transformation of the nature of all the elements.

original: de rnams las sems pa can du 'gyur ba yin la /
analyzed: de rnams las sems pa can du 'gyur ba yin la /
translated: The mind is the transformation of the nature of all the elements, because the mind is the transformation of the nature of all the elements, and because the mind is the transformation of the nature of all the elements.üîΩThe mind is the transformation of the nature of all the elements, because the mind is the transformation of the nature of all the elements, and because the mind is the transformation of the nature of all the elements.

original: yongs su gyur pa'i dbye ba las nus pa dang mngon par gsal ba dang rjes su 'dzin pa gang yin pa de rnams kho na las 'byung ba'i blo yin gyi /üîΩblo gzhan sngon du 'gro ba can ni ma yin no //üîΩ'byung ba'i bskyed bya ba yang dbang po dang bcas pa'i 'byung ba'i bskyed bya ma yin nam /
analyzed: yongs su gyur pa'i dbye ba las nus pa dang mngon par gsal ba dang rjes su 'dzin pa gang yin pa de rnams kho na las 'byung ba'i blo yin gyi / blo gzhan sngon du 'gro ba can ni ma yin no // 'byung ba'i bskyed bya ba yang dbang po dang bcas pa'i 'byung ba'i bskyed bya ma yin nam /
translated: The mind is the transformation of the nature of all the elements, because the mind is the transformation of the nature of all the elements, and because the mind is the transformation of the nature of all the elements.üîΩThe mind is the transformation of the nature of all the elements, because the mind is the transformation of the nature of all the elements, and because the mind is the transformation of the nature of all the elements.üîΩThe mind is the transformation of the nature of all the elements, because the mind is the transformation of the nature of all the elements, and because the mind is the transformation of the nature of all the elements.

original: gzhan ni bskyed bya ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni bskyed bya ma yin no //
translated: The mind is the transformation of the nature of all the elements, because the mind is the transformation of the nature of all the elements, and because the mind is the transformation of the nature of all the elements.

original: de lta yin na nur nur po la sogs pa rnams la de med pa'i phyir mi 'byung ngo //üîΩmed na mngal du 'phel bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin na nur nur po la sogs pa rnams la de med pa'i phyir mi 'byung ngo // med na mngal du 'phel bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The mind is the transformation of the nature of all the elements, because the mind is the transformation of the nature of all the elements, and because the mind is the transformation of the nature of all the elements.üîΩThe mind is the transformation of the nature of all the elements, because the mind is the transformation of the nature of all the elements, and because the mind is the transformation of the nature of all the elements.

original: 'on te dbang po med par yang nges sems pa can tsam du skye ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on te dbang po med par yang nges sems pa can tsam du skye ba yin no //
translated: The mind is the transformation of the nature of all the elements, because the mind is the transformation of the nature of all the elements, and because the mind is the transformation of the nature of all the elements.üîΩThe mind is the transformation of the nature of all the elements, because the mind is the transformation of the nature of all the elements, and because the mind is the transformation of the nature

original: yin na yang gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin te /
analyzed: yin na yang gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin te /
translated: But it is the entityness of form and so on,

original: dbang po la gzugs 'dzin par so sor nges pa yin zhes brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po la gzugs 'dzin par so sor nges pa yin zhes brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is said that the eye is the apprehender of form and so on.

original: ma yin te sems tsam ni sems rtsam rtsom par byed pa ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te sems tsam ni sems rtsam rtsom par byed pa ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because mind only is not seen to be the creator of mind only.

original: gnyid stug pos non pa dang brgyal ba la sogs pa'i dus su yang sems pa can rnam par chad pas bdag ni sems dang mi ldan par rab tu gnyid log pa yin no zhes dran pa yin te /
analyzed: gnyid stug pos non pa dang brgyal ba la sogs pa'i dus su yang sems pa can rnam par chad pas bdag ni sems dang mi ldan par rab tu gnyid log pa yin no zhes dran pa yin te /
translated: When one is overcome by deep sleep or fainting and so on, one remembers, ‚ÄúI slept without mind,‚Äù because the mind is interrupted.

original: gnyid log par rtsom pa'i sems kyis de'i dus kyi rang gi ngo bo rig pas dus phyi ma la dngos po mi rig pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gnyid log par rtsom pa'i sems kyis de'i dus kyi rang gi ngo bo rig pas dus phyi ma la dngos po mi rig pa'i phyir /
translated: The mind that begins to sleep is aware of its own nature at that time, but it is not aware of things at a later time.

original: gzugs la sogs pa rtogs pa kho na blo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rtogs pa kho na blo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the cognition of form and so on that is the mind.

original: gzhan du na blo gzhan las skyes pa 'byung ba dang sems pa can ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na blo gzhan las skyes pa 'byung ba dang sems pa can ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would follow that the mind that arises from another mind would not be a mind.

original: nur nur po la sogs pa rnams la rnam shes yod do zhes bya ba de yang gya tshom du smra ba yin te /
analyzed: nur nur po la sogs pa rnams la rnam shes yod do zhes bya ba de yang gya tshom du smra ba yin te /
translated: It is also mere speculation to say that the embryo in the mother‚Äôs womb, the kalala and so on, has consciousness.

original: dbang po ma 'dod pa'i phyir de la don rtogs pa med pa yin la /
analyzed: dbang po ma 'dod pa'i phyir de la don rtogs pa med pa yin la /
translated: Because the sense faculties are not complete, the object is not cognized.

original: don rtogs pa las gzhan pa'i ngo bo ni /
analyzed: don rtogs pa las gzhan pa'i ngo bo ni /
translated: And apart from the cognition of the object,

original: shes pa yin par mi rigs so //üîΩdes na brgyal sogs na yang 'di //
analyzed: shes pa yin par mi rigs so // des na brgyal sogs na yang 'di //
translated: it is not logical that there is consciousness.üîΩTherefore, it is not tenable

original: yod pa nyid du mi 'thad do //
analyzed: yod pa nyid du mi 'thad do //
translated: that it exists even when one is unconscious.

original: 'di la smras pa ma dang pa'i sems las nur nur po la sogs pa'i lus su rim gyis yongs su gyur ba las sems nye bar dmigs bzhin ba na de kho na bzhin du khas blang bar 'os pa yin gyi /üîΩsems gzhan nam bdag ni ma yin te tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di la smras pa ma dang pa'i sems las nur nur po la sogs pa'i lus su rim gyis yongs su gyur ba las sems nye bar dmigs bzhin ba na de kho na bzhin du khas blang bar 'os pa yin gyi / sems gzhan nam bdag ni ma yin te tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, some say: The body of the kalala and so on gradually transforms from the nonmanifest mind. Since the mind is observed to be present, it is appropriate to accept that it is just like that.üîΩBut it is not another mind or the self, because there is no valid knowledge to establish it.

original: bdag go @186b zhes kyang rig pa'i dran pa yin gyi 'di nyid kho na rig pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag go @186b zhes kyang rig pa'i dran pa yin gyi 'di nyid kho na rig pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The memory that thinks ‚ÄúI saw it‚Äù is a memory of the mind, not a memory of the self.

original: rta'i zhes rnam par rtog pa na ba glang mthong na 'gal ba dang rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid dag tu mi srid pa'i phyir ro //üîΩnur nur po la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na rig pa med na khyed kyi ji ltar de dmigs pa yin zhe na yang de nyid dmigs pa yod pa yin te /
analyzed: rta'i zhes rnam par rtog pa na ba glang mthong na 'gal ba dang rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid dag tu mi srid pa'i phyir ro // nur nur po la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na rig pa med na khyed kyi ji ltar de dmigs pa yin zhe na yang de nyid dmigs pa yod pa yin te /
translated: If one thinks of a horse, and sees an ox, there is no possibility of non-erroneous thought.

original: de kho na las skye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na las skye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If there is no consciousness in the state of the kalala, etc., how can it be perceived by you? It is perceived because it arises from that very state.

original: de yang snga rol la na yod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de yang snga rol la na yod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If it exists prior to that, then it is without a body.

original: yang lus med pa la bdag go zhes pa yod par gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di la ni tshad ma gang yang med do //
analyzed: yang lus med pa la bdag go zhes pa yod par gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di la ni tshad ma gang yang med do //
translated: But there is no evidence at all for the existence of a self without a body.

original: byung bar gyur pa rnams kyi sems pa can la rang dbang yin na /
analyzed: byung bar gyur pa rnams kyi sems pa can la rang dbang yin na /
translated: If the self is the experiencer of what has come into existence,

original: phan tshun yan lag can dang yan lag can nyid kyis mi dbye bar mi 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: phan tshun yan lag can dang yan lag can nyid kyis mi dbye bar mi 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: then it is not differentiated by the mutual difference of the body, is it?

original: sems pa can ni gcig kho na yin gyi cig shos ma yin pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sems pa can ni gcig kho na yin gyi cig shos ma yin pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The experiencer is only one, not another,

original: bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no difference.

original: sems pa can nyid la ni thams cad kyi phan tshun 'brel pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sems pa can nyid la ni thams cad kyi phan tshun 'brel pa ma yin te /
translated: But it is not the case that all mental states are related to each other.

original: sems pa can gcig dang 'brel pa las gzhan gang yang rung ba'i yan lag yin par ni 'gal ba yin no //üîΩ'di la zer ba ni byung bar gyur pa'i khyad par ram /
analyzed: sems pa can gcig dang 'brel pa las gzhan gang yang rung ba'i yan lag yin par ni 'gal ba yin no // 'di la zer ba ni byung bar gyur pa'i khyad par ram /
translated: It is contradictory for any one mental state to be a part of another mental state.

original: de yongs su gyur pa'i khyad par yang sems pa can las yin no //üîΩ'di ni bdag gi lus so zhes bya ba la sogs pa la tha mi dad pa 'di'i shes pa'i bdag tu shes pa ni /
analyzed: de yongs su gyur pa'i khyad par yang sems pa can las yin no // 'di ni bdag gi lus so zhes bya ba la sogs pa la tha mi dad pa 'di'i shes pa'i bdag tu shes pa ni /
translated: Here, the difference that has arisen or the difference that has come about is due to a mental state.

original: rang la dmigs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: rang la dmigs pa ma yin nam /
translated: In the case of ‚ÄúThis is my body,‚Äù etc., is the cognition of self not the cognition of this as not different?

original: bdag gi bdag nyid ces bya ba ni sgra gcan gyi mgo bo zhes bya ba bzhin du brtags pa pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag gi bdag nyid ces bya ba ni sgra gcan gyi mgo bo zhes bya ba bzhin du brtags pa pa yin no //
translated: The expression ‚Äúof the nature of self‚Äù is a mere designation, like the head of RƒÅhu.

original: bdag gzhan la dmigs pa yin na yang thams cad du ldog pa grub pa ma yin no //üîΩ'dis ni / bdag tu 'dzin pa'i rnam shes ni /üîΩrang nyid bdag tu 'thad pa yin //
analyzed: bdag gzhan la dmigs pa yin na yang thams cad du ldog pa grub pa ma yin no // 'dis ni / bdag tu 'dzin pa'i rnam shes ni / rang nyid bdag tu 'thad pa yin //
translated: Even if the self is the object of the cognition of self, it is not established that it is the object of all cognitions.üîΩThis shows that the cognition of self is not tenable as the self.

original: zhes bya ba bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba bstan pa yin no //
translated: The cognition of self is not tenable as the self.

original: re zhig de ltar /
analyzed: re zhig de ltar /
translated: In this way,

original: bdag tu shes pa'i rnam shes nyid //
analyzed: bdag tu shes pa'i rnam shes nyid //
translated: the consciousness that knows the self

original: ces bya ba'i lan blan pa yin no //
analyzed: ces bya ba'i lan blan pa yin no //
translated: is the answer to the question.

original: gang gi tshe yang rig pa dang ldan pa'i rig pa gcig nyid rnam par 'jog par byed pa skyes pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe yang rig pa dang ldan pa'i rig pa gcig nyid rnam par 'jog par byed pa skyes pa de'i tshe /
translated: When the consciousness that is aware of itself arises,

original: bdag lkog tu ma gyur pa kho na yin gyi gzung bya ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag lkog tu ma gyur pa kho na yin gyi gzung bya ni ma yin no //
translated: the self is not hidden, but the object is.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said,

original: lkog tu gyur min pa mngon sum yin /üîΩzhes smos te /üîΩji ltar rig pa ni rig pa gzhan la mi ltos pas lkog tu ma gyur pa yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: lkog tu gyur min pa mngon sum yin / zhes smos te / ji ltar rig pa ni rig pa gzhan la mi ltos pas lkog tu ma gyur pa yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: ‚ÄúThe nonhidden is directly perceived.‚ÄùüîΩJust as awareness is not hidden because it does not depend on another awareness,

original: shes pa la gzhan mi ltos pas bdag mngon sum yin te /
analyzed: shes pa la gzhan mi ltos pas bdag mngon sum yin te /
translated: in the same way, consciousness is directly perceived because it does not depend on another consciousness.

original: de bstan pa ni @187a * //
analyzed: de bstan pa ni @187a * //
translated: This is what is being taught:

original: rang nyid rig byar grub pa yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang nyid rig byar grub pa yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is established as self-awareness.‚Äù

original: bdag shes pa 'di ni bdag mthong bar 'gyur ba yin no zhes nye bar dgod pa yin te /
analyzed: bdag shes pa 'di ni bdag mthong bar 'gyur ba yin no zhes nye bar dgod pa yin te /
translated: This is the answer to the question, ‚ÄúWhen this consciousness knows the self, it sees the self.‚Äù

original: bdag bdag ces ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag bdag ces ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the self that says, ‚ÄúI am.‚Äù

original: sngon por nyams su myong ba yod na gsum car lkog tu ma gyur pa yin gyi bdag nyams su myong ba la ni shes pa gzhan cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sngon por nyams su myong ba yod na gsum car lkog tu ma gyur pa yin gyi bdag nyams su myong ba la ni shes pa gzhan cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If there is an experience of blue, all three are not hidden. But when the self is experienced, there is not the slightest other cognition.üîΩWhen the self‚Äôs cognition is not produced, all three experiences of objects are not hidden. At that time, how is it in the context of the yogi, in death, fainting, and so on?

original: gang gi tshe bdag gi shes pa yang ma skyes na don nyams su myong ba gsum char yang lkog tu ma gyur ba yin pa de'i tshe rnal 'byor pa'i gnas skabs dang / shi ba dang brgyal ba la sogs pa rnams la de ji ltar yin zhe na yang bden te gang gi tshe sngar mthong ba ngo shes pa'i stobs kyis bdag rtag pa yin pa de'i tshe don nyams su myong ba med kyang bdag shes pa yod na 'gyur baüîΩkho na yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe bdag gi shes pa yang ma skyes na don nyams su myong ba gsum char yang lkog tu ma gyur ba yin pa de'i tshe rnal 'byor pa'i gnas skabs dang / shi ba dang brgyal ba la sogs pa rnams la de ji ltar yin zhe na yang bden te gang gi tshe sngar mthong ba ngo shes pa'i stobs kyis bdag rtag pa yin pa de'i tshe don nyams su myong ba med kyang bdag shes pa yod na 'gyur ba kho na yin no //
translated: It is true, but when the self is permanent by the power of recognizing what was seen before, at that time, even though there is no experience of objects, if there is self-cognition, it is so.

original: gnas skabs 'di res 'ga' gnyid ma log pa la yang yod pa yin te /
analyzed: gnas skabs 'di res 'ga' gnyid ma log pa la yang yod pa yin te /
translated: This state sometimes exists even when not asleep.

original: don rig pa ma yin zhing bdag tu 'dzin pa ma yin la ;
analyzed: don rig pa ma yin zhing bdag tu 'dzin pa ma yin la ;
translated: It is not the awareness of an object, nor is it the apprehension of a self.

original: gnyid sdug pos non pa yang ma yin par yang ngo //
analyzed: gnyid sdug pos non pa yang ma yin par yang ngo //
translated: Nor is it that he is overcome by deep sleep.

original: de lta na yang bdag ni rang nyid gsal ba yin te /
analyzed: de lta na yang bdag ni rang nyid gsal ba yin te /
translated: Even so, the self is itself manifest.

original: de 'di ni tshangs pa'i gnas skabs yin gyi de la ni byed pa po nyid dam za ba po nyid du rtogs pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: de 'di ni tshangs pa'i gnas skabs yin gyi de la ni byed pa po nyid dam za ba po nyid du rtogs pa yang ma yin la /
translated: This is the state of Brahman, and there is no conception of it as an agent or an experiencer.

original: de dag tsam ni zhing shes pa'i gnas skabs byed pa po nyid la sogs pa mi bden pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag tsam ni zhing shes pa'i gnas skabs byed pa po nyid la sogs pa mi bden pa yang ma yin te /
translated: And it is not that these states of consciousness of the field are unreal as an agent and so on,

original: bya ba rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir bya ba med na tshangs pa'i gnas skabs la med pa yin gyi mi bden pa'i phyir med pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bya ba rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir bya ba med na tshangs pa'i gnas skabs la med pa yin gyi mi bden pa'i phyir med pa ni ma yin te /
translated: because the activity is the reason. If there were no activity, there would be no state of Brahman, but it is not that it does not exist because of unreality,

original: gnod pa can med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnod pa can med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no contradiction.

original: de ni de bzhin du /
analyzed: de ni de bzhin du /
translated: That is just so.

original: res 'ga' bdag tu shes pas dmigs //
analyzed: res 'ga' bdag tu shes pas dmigs //
translated: Sometimes it is perceived by the knowledge of the self.

original: res 'ga' don rig pa po nyid kyis lkog tu ma gyur pa yin zhing res 'ga' don nyams su myong ba dang bdag tu shes pa la yang ma ltos par rtag par bdag nyid kyi rang gi ngo la gnas pa kho na yin zhes bya ba'i gnas skabs
analyzed: res 'ga' don rig pa po nyid kyis lkog tu ma gyur pa yin zhing res 'ga' don nyams su myong ba dang bdag tu shes pa la yang ma ltos par rtag par bdag nyid kyi rang gi ngo la gnas pa kho na yin zhes bya ba'i gnas skabs
translated: Sometimes the object is not hidden from the one who knows the object, and sometimes, without depending on the experience of the object and the cognition of the self, the object always exists in its own state.

original: gsum char bdag gi yin no //
analyzed: gsum char bdag gi yin no //
translated: These are the three states that belong to the self.

original: de yang gnas skabs gsum pa 'di ni lus kyi gnas skabs la mi dogs pa'i phyir 'grel pa mdzad pa la sogs pas ma spros te /
analyzed: de yang gnas skabs gsum pa 'di ni lus kyi gnas skabs la mi dogs pa'i phyir 'grel pa mdzad pa la sogs pas ma spros te /
translated: Since the third state is not doubted in the context of the body, the author of the commentary does not elaborate on it,

original: las dang 'brel pa mi shes pa rnam gyi blo'i dbye ba skye bar byed pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i rigs pas so //
analyzed: las dang 'brel pa mi shes pa rnam gyi blo'i dbye ba skye bar byed pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i rigs pas so //
translated: because it is reasonable that the distinction of the mind that does not know the connection with action is not produced.

original: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: This is taught:

original: nyin zhag gzhan la mthong ba rnams la nyin @187b zhag phyi ma la bdag 'di ltar mthong bar gyur to zhes bya bar 'gyur ba 'di la bdag ces bya ba'i dngos po ni sngon po'o zhes sngon po la sogs pa rnams kyi mthong ba po brjod pa yin
analyzed: nyin zhag gzhan la mthong ba rnams la nyin @187b zhag phyi ma la bdag 'di ltar mthong bar gyur to zhes bya bar 'gyur ba 'di la bdag ces bya ba'i dngos po ni sngon po'o zhes sngon po la sogs pa rnams kyi mthong ba po brjod pa yin
translated: In this case, the thing called ‚ÄúI‚Äù is said to be the seer of blue and so on,

original: gyi / lus sam dbang po ni ma yin la /
analyzed: gyi / lus sam dbang po ni ma yin la /
translated: but not the body or the sense faculties.üîΩAnd in the same way, it is illogical to think in terms of the body and the sense faculties being the same or different.

original: de bzhin du bsdu ba dang dbye ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa mi rigs pas bdag gi lus sam dbang po zhes tha dad par snang ba ni bdag gi lus sam zhes bya ba bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du bsdu ba dang dbye ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa mi rigs pas bdag gi lus sam dbang po zhes tha dad par snang ba ni bdag gi lus sam zhes bya ba bzhin du /
translated: The body and the sense faculties appear to be different, just as the body and the self appear to be different,

original: gnas skabs kyi dbye ba'i rgyu mtshan nyid la mi brten pa'i phyir ro //üîΩshes pa ni bdag gi gnas skabs ni bdag ces bya ba yin pa de bzhin du lus kyi gnas skabs gzhan gyi ngo bo ni lus yin zhes bya bar rigs te /
analyzed: gnas skabs kyi dbye ba'i rgyu mtshan nyid la mi brten pa'i phyir ro // shes pa ni bdag gi gnas skabs ni bdag ces bya ba yin pa de bzhin du lus kyi gnas skabs gzhan gyi ngo bo ni lus yin zhes bya bar rigs te /
translated: but this is not because they are based on different causes, such as the body‚Äôs being in different states.üîΩJust as the state of the self is called the self, in the same way, the state of the body is called the body.

original: ji skad du bdag gi zhes bya ba'i don gtso bo 'dis /
analyzed: ji skad du bdag gi zhes bya ba'i don gtso bo 'dis /
translated: The meaning of the word ‚Äúmine‚Äù is the same as the meaning of the word ‚Äúself.‚Äù

original: bdag la gzhan du shes pa min //
analyzed: bdag la gzhan du shes pa min //
translated: But it is not the case that the self is known as other.

original: des 'di dbye ba'i rgyur 'gyur ro //üîΩzhes smos so //
analyzed: des 'di dbye ba'i rgyur 'gyur ro // zhes smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is the cause of the division.

original: bdag gi bdag ni de lta ma yin no zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: bdag gi bdag ni de lta ma yin no zhes zer ba ni /
translated: The self is not like that.

original: dbye ba shes pa'i rgyu can yin //üîΩzhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dbye ba shes pa'i rgyu can yin // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is the cause of the knowledge of the division.üîΩThe self is not the seer.üîΩThe self is not the hearer.üîΩThe self is not the feeler.üîΩThe self is not the cognizer.üîΩThe self is not the knower.

original: shes pa nyid mthong ba po yang ma yin la /üîΩkhar rtsang dang deng gi dus kyi dbye ba la yang 'di mthong bar 'gyur ba yin no zhes tha mi dad par snang ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: shes pa nyid mthong ba po yang ma yin la / khar rtsang dang deng gi dus kyi dbye ba la yang 'di mthong bar 'gyur ba yin no zhes tha mi dad par snang ba'i phyir te /
translated: The self is not the one who sees.üîΩThe self is not the one who hears.üîΩThe self is not the one who feels.üîΩThe self is not the one who cognizes.

original: bdag nyid 'di ni mngon shes gyur //
analyzed: bdag nyid 'di ni mngon shes gyur //
translated: The self is not the one who knows.üîΩThe self is not the one who remembers.üîΩThe self is not the one who creates.üîΩThe self is not the one who destroys.üîΩThe self is not the one who abandons.üîΩThe self is not the one who takes up.

original: da lta 'ang bdag rig byed yin pa'i //üîΩskad cig de ni shes pa'i yul //
analyzed: da lta 'ang bdag rig byed yin pa'i // skad cig de ni shes pa'i yul //
translated: The self is not the one who grieves.üîΩThe self is not the one who laments.üîΩThe self is not the one who torments.üîΩThe self is not the one who becomes weary.üîΩThe self is not the one who becomes agitated.üîΩThe self is not the one who becomes angry.üîΩThe self is not the one who becomes pleased.

original: gang yin dpyad par bya yin //üîΩsngar 'jug pa yi yul la ni //
analyzed: gang yin dpyad par bya yin // sngar 'jug pa yi yul la ni //
translated: The self is not the one who becomes frightened.üîΩThe self is not the one who becomes terrified.üîΩThe self is not the one who becomes confused.

original: shes gyur yin par srid pa yin //
analyzed: shes gyur yin par srid pa yin //
translated: The self is not the one who becomes deluded.üîΩThe self is not the one who becomes proud.

original: de ltar 'di med pa gang las //
analyzed: de ltar 'di med pa gang las //
translated: The self is not the one who becomes arrogant.üîΩThe self is not the one who becomes jealous.üîΩThe self is not the one who becomes stingy.üîΩThe self is not the one who becomes greedy.üîΩThe self is not the one who becomes lustful.üîΩThe self is not the one who becomes angry.

original: shes zhes bya 'di mi bden 'gyur //
analyzed: shes zhes bya 'di mi bden 'gyur //
translated: The self is not the one who becomes deluded.üîΩThe self is not the one who becomes proud.üîΩThe self is not the one who becomes arrogant.üîΩThe self is not the one who becomes jealous.üîΩThe self is not the one who becomes stingy.üîΩThe self is not the one who becomes greedy.

original: da ltar ba yi gzung bya gang //üîΩshes zhes bya ba 'thad pa yin //
analyzed: da ltar ba yi gzung bya gang // shes zhes bya ba 'thad pa yin //
translated: The self is not the one who becomes lustful.üîΩThe self is not the one who becomes angry.

original: de phyir shes gyur bden min te //
analyzed: de phyir shes gyur bden min te //
translated: The self is not the one who becomes deluded.üîΩThe self is not the one who becomes proud.üîΩThe self is not the

original: gang las shes gyur 'di min phyir //
analyzed: gang las shes gyur 'di min phyir //
translated: Because it is not known from that.

original: rgyun ma gtogs pa'i rgyud gcig yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: rgyun ma gtogs pa'i rgyud gcig yod pa ma yin la /
translated: Apart from the continuum, there is no single self.

original: shes pa nyid dang 'dra ba nyid kyang bdag tu shes pa'i yul ma yin te /
analyzed: shes pa nyid dang 'dra ba nyid kyang bdag tu shes pa'i yul ma yin te /
translated: And the consciousness itself, which is similar to the body, is not the object of the cognition of self,

original: gzhan la yang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan la yang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that it would be the object of the cognition of self of all other sentient beings.

original: 'on te shes po nyid 'dra na //
analyzed: 'on te shes po nyid 'dra na //
translated: If it were similar to the cognition,

original: lus gzhan rnams la 'ang der 'gyur te //
analyzed: lus gzhan rnams la 'ang der 'gyur te //
translated: then it would be the object of the cognition of self of other bodies.

original: de la thams cad kyis shes na //
analyzed: de la thams cad kyis shes na //
translated: If it were the object of the cognition of self of all,

original: bdag go zhes kyang dran par 'gyur //
analyzed: bdag go zhes kyang dran par 'gyur //
translated: then it would be remembered as the self.

original: 'on te tha dad pa nyid yin na rgyud gcig la yang snga ma dang phyi ma dag tha dad pa nyid kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'on te tha dad pa nyid yin na rgyud gcig la yang snga ma dang phyi ma dag tha dad pa nyid kho na yin no //
translated: But if it were different, then even in a single continuum the former and latter would be different.

original: rgyud gcig la ni skyes pa yang //
analyzed: rgyud gcig la ni skyes pa yang //
translated: Even though it arises in a single continuum,

original: skad cig la de zhes blor 'gyur //
analyzed: skad cig la de zhes blor 'gyur //
translated: the thought ‚ÄúI‚Äù occurs in regard to the body.

original: ji ltar lus gzhan shes pa bzhin //
analyzed: ji ltar lus gzhan shes pa bzhin //
translated: Just as it is in regard to another‚Äôs body,

original: bum sogs phyi la 'ang gnas @188a * //
analyzed: bum sogs phyi la 'ang gnas @188a * //
translated: it would be the same in regard to external things such as pots.

original: pa na'o // skad cig gzhan re re la shes pa'am shes byar dmigs nas nyams su myong ba snga ma snga ma'i bag chags kyi dbang gis bdag ces bya ba'am /
analyzed: pa na'o // skad cig gzhan re re la shes pa'am shes byar dmigs nas nyams su myong ba snga ma snga ma'i bag chags kyi dbang gis bdag ces bya ba'am /
translated: The self is the name given to the object of knowledge or the object of consciousness that is perceived in each moment, due to the power of the latent impressions of the previous experience.

original: 'di zhes bya ba'i snga ma dang phyi ma'i shes pa dang shes bya dag gcig pa nyid du nges par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba'i snga ma dang phyi ma'i shes pa dang shes bya dag gcig pa nyid du nges par byed pa yin te /
translated: The previous and subsequent consciousnesses and objects of knowledge are ascertained to be the same,

original: sna tshogs pa nyid du ma mtshon pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar rtogs pa ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: sna tshogs pa nyid du ma mtshon pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar rtogs pa ni mi rigs te /
translated: because they are not perceived to be different.

original: skad cig re re la shes pa'am shes bya dag tha dad par nyams su myong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig re re la shes pa'am shes bya dag tha dad par nyams su myong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is illogical, because the consciousness or object of knowledge is experienced as different in each moment.

original: 'di nyid kyi phyir mthong ba la yang mthong ba yin na /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi phyir mthong ba la yang mthong ba yin na /
translated: For this very reason, if it is said that what is seen is seen by the self,

original: tha dad pa'i shes pa nyams su myong bar byed pa ni bag chags yin no//
analyzed: tha dad pa'i shes pa nyams su myong bar byed pa ni bag chags yin no//
translated: the experience of different consciousnesses is due to latent impressions.

original: de nyid kyis na yul de la sngar mthong ba ngo shes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyis na yul de la sngar mthong ba ngo shes pa ma yin te /
translated: For this very reason, what is seen is not recognized as seen before,

original: yul gang yin pa nyams su myong ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yul gang yin pa nyams su myong ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because the object is not experienced.

original: bag chags ni 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan yin la /
analyzed: bag chags ni 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan yin la /
translated: Habit-energy is the cause of the appearance of error.

original: shes pa po la ni sngar mthong ba ngo shes pa la yang bag chags byed pa por 'os pa ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa po la ni sngar mthong ba ngo shes pa la yang bag chags byed pa por 'os pa ma yin no //
translated: But it is not right to say that the experiencer, who recognizes what he has seen before, is the one who creates the habit-energy.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not so.

original: de min la de zhes shes pa //
analyzed: de min la de zhes shes pa //
translated: The cognition of that as this

original: 'di ni 'khrul pa'i rgyu yin te //üîΩbdag ces ba nyid sngon 'gro ba'i //
analyzed: 'di ni 'khrul pa'i rgyu yin te // bdag ces ba nyid sngon 'gro ba'i //
translated: is the cause of error.üîΩThe cause of the habit-energy of experience

original: nyams su myong bag chags rgyu yin la //üîΩde yang bag chags kyi rgyu yin zhes bya ba de ltar bdag ces pa'i shes pa rnams sam /
analyzed: nyams su myong bag chags rgyu yin la // de yang bag chags kyi rgyu yin zhes bya ba de ltar bdag ces pa'i shes pa rnams sam /
translated: is the prior cognition of self.üîΩAnd that is the cause of habit-energy.

original: thog ma med pa'i bag chags kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid yin no//
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i bag chags kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid yin no//
translated: Thus, the cognitions of self are the cause and effect of beginningless habit-energy.

original: bdag ces bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa la sngon po'i rnam par rtog pa bzhin du nyams su myong ba dbang byed pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: bdag ces bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa la sngon po'i rnam par rtog pa bzhin du nyams su myong ba dbang byed pa ma yin nam /
translated: Is not experience the dominant condition of the cognition of self, just as it is of the cognition of blue?

original: dbang byed pa ma yin na gtso bo la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa bzhin du bag chags tsam 'byung ba nyid kyis rigs pa ma yin pa nyid du thal par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang byed pa ma yin na gtso bo la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa bzhin du bag chags tsam 'byung ba nyid kyis rigs pa ma yin pa nyid du thal par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is not the controller, then it would follow, absurdly, that it would be like the concepts of pradhƒÅna and so on, which are mere imprints.

original: bdag gi bdag ces bya pa'i shes pa la yang bdag ces bya ba dang tha dad pa yang shes pa'i rgyu can yin zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag gi bdag ces bya pa'i shes pa la yang bdag ces bya ba dang tha dad pa yang shes pa'i rgyu can yin zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThe consciousness that thinks ‚ÄòI am‚Äô is also caused by the consciousness that thinks ‚ÄòI‚Äô‚Äù shows that the consciousness that thinks ‚ÄúI am‚Äù is also caused by the consciousness that thinks ‚ÄúI.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir rang rig pa'i shes pa yin na bdag go zhes bya ba 'byung ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang rig pa'i shes pa yin na bdag go zhes bya ba 'byung ba yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, when there is reflexive awareness, the thought ‚ÄúI am‚Äù arises.

original: sngon po la sogs pa rig pa'i gzhan rig yin pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa rig pa'i gzhan rig yin pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: It does not arise in the case of the awareness of blue and so on.

original: de'i phyir bdag go zhes pa'i shes pa ni rang rig pa'i bya ba'i rjes su 'brang ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag go zhes pa'i shes pa ni rang rig pa'i bya ba'i rjes su 'brang ba yin no //
translated: Therefore the thought ‚ÄúI am‚Äù is a consequence of reflexive awareness.

original: de'i skye mched nyid kyis nye bar 'brel ba yin la /
analyzed: de'i skye mched nyid kyis nye bar 'brel ba yin la /
translated: It is related to the self by being its very domain.

original: lus dang dbang po'i sgrub byed nyid kyis rang rig pa ma yin pa la bdag go zhes nye bar btags pa yin no //
analyzed: lus dang dbang po'i sgrub byed nyid kyis rang rig pa ma yin pa la bdag go zhes nye bar btags pa yin no //
translated: The self is imputed to that which is not reflexive awareness by virtue of its being the basis of the body and the sense faculties.

original: bdag gi lus zhes bya ba ni @188b bzlog pa ste gtso bo yin te /
analyzed: bdag gi lus zhes bya ba ni @188b bzlog pa ste gtso bo yin te /
translated: The so-called ‚Äúmy body‚Äù is the opposite, i.e., the principal.

original: rang rig pa dang cig shos kyis phye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang rig pa dang cig shos kyis phye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is distinguished by self-awareness and the other.

original: bdag gi shes pa zhes bya ba yang shes pa'i rgyun yin te de skad cig dang 'brel pa can de yin par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag gi shes pa zhes bya ba yang shes pa'i rgyun yin te de skad cig dang 'brel pa can de yin par brjod pa yin no //
translated: The so-called ‚Äúmy consciousness‚Äù is the stream of consciousness, which is said to be connected with the moment.

original: bdag ni 'di mthong bar gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba yang mthong ba'i gzhi la bdag ces pa nye bar bkod pa yin gyi gzhi gzhan la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag ni 'di mthong bar gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba yang mthong ba'i gzhi la bdag ces pa nye bar bkod pa yin gyi gzhi gzhan la ni ma yin no //
translated: And when it is said, ‚ÄúI see this,‚Äù the word ‚ÄúI‚Äù is applied to the basis of seeing, not to another basis.

original: snang ba la ni snang ba kho na byed pa po yin gyi /
analyzed: snang ba la ni snang ba kho na byed pa po yin gyi /
translated: In the case of seeing, only seeing is the agent,

original: gzhan ni ma yin no //üîΩde'i phyir mthong ba'i bdag nyid kho na bdag yin gyi 'das pa dang da ltar ba'i dus kyi rjes su 'gro ba'i gcig pu yin par ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin no // de'i phyir mthong ba'i bdag nyid kho na bdag yin gyi 'das pa dang da ltar ba'i dus kyi rjes su 'gro ba'i gcig pu yin par ni mi rigs te /
translated: not another.

original: skad cig re re la snang pa dang mthong ba dag tha dad par nyams su myong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig re re la snang pa dang mthong ba dag tha dad par nyams su myong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, only the nature of seeing is the self, not the one that is related to the past and present, because the seeing and the seer are experienced as different in each moment.

original: de bdag go de 'di'i zhes dbye ba med par yang rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de bdag go de 'di'i zhes dbye ba med par yang rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: and ‚Äúthat is the self‚Äù and ‚Äúthis is its‚Äù are not distinguished.

original: bden te 'di dbye ba med par mngon par rgyal ba yin te /
analyzed: bden te 'di dbye ba med par mngon par rgyal ba yin te /
translated: It is true that this is not distinguished, but it is not known.

original: chang dang phyi rol du yang dmigs pa dang ma dmigs par dbye ba ma yin pa'i phyir dang 'dra ba gzhan 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: chang dang phyi rol du yang dmigs pa dang ma dmigs par dbye ba ma yin pa'i phyir dang 'dra ba gzhan 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: Because it is not distinguished as being observed or not observed externally, and because another similar one arises.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags bslad pas zhes bstan pa ni rtag tu yod pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags bslad pas zhes bstan pa ni rtag tu yod pa ste /
translated: The statement ‚Äúby the contamination of the latent impressions of conceptualization‚Äù teaches that it is always present.

original: dmigs pa'i nye bar dmigs pa zhes bya ba 'dis rang rig pa'i shes par bya ba'i rjes su 'jug pa ni /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i nye bar dmigs pa zhes bya ba 'dis rang rig pa'i shes par bya ba'i rjes su 'jug pa ni /
translated: The statement ‚Äúthe object of the observation of the object of observation‚Äù teaches that the object of self-awareness is the object of the consciousness that engages it.

original: bdag go zhes pa'i shes pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag go zhes pa'i shes pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: The statement ‚Äúthe self‚Äù teaches the consciousness.

original: de'i tshe yang shes pa thams cad du yod na de'i thams cad du 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe yang shes pa thams cad du yod na de'i thams cad du 'byung ba yin no //
translated: If it exists in all consciousnesses, it would occur in all of them.

original: de'i phyir de nyid da ltar yang rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid da ltar yang rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because it engages in that way even now,

original: de yod par ni sngar gyi bdag kho na yin no zhes dogs pa dang srid par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de yod par ni sngar gyi bdag kho na yin no zhes dogs pa dang srid par byed pa yin no //
translated: it is suspected that it is the self of the past.

original: des te de lta bu'i rnam pa des bslus pa ni skad cig gi bde pas nyams su myong ba yang mchog tu mi 'dzin te thams cad du 'byung ba'i shes pa la ji srid shes pa yod par de'i bya ba de'i bya ba dmigs nas sngar gyi yang
analyzed: des te de lta bu'i rnam pa des bslus pa ni skad cig gi bde pas nyams su myong ba yang mchog tu mi 'dzin te thams cad du 'byung ba'i shes pa la ji srid shes pa yod par de'i bya ba de'i bya ba dmigs nas sngar gyi yang
translated: And by that, i.e., by that kind of deception, he does not hold as supreme the experience of momentary pleasure, because he has perceived the activity of that cognition which occurs everywhere, for as long as cognition exists.

original: bdag kho na yin no zhes 'khrul pas de nyid srid par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdag kho na yin no zhes 'khrul pas de nyid srid par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: he makes that very thing exist in the world, thinking, ‚ÄúIt is just I myself.‚Äù

original: de kho na skad cig re re la mthong ba'i dbye ba la snang ba'i dbye ba nyams su myong ba yin yang 'dra ba gzhan byung ba de 'di kho na yin no zhes 'khrul pas tha dad par mi 'dzin to zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de kho na skad cig re re la mthong ba'i dbye ba la snang ba'i dbye ba nyams su myong ba yin yang 'dra ba gzhan byung ba de 'di kho na yin no zhes 'khrul pas tha dad par mi 'dzin to zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Although he experiences the appearance of the division of seeing reality moment by moment, he does not apprehend the difference, thinking, ‚ÄúThis is just that,‚Äù because of the confusion that another similar thing has arisen. The meaning is as before.

original: mthong ba de nyid snang ba yang yin par 'khrul pas bdag ni 'di mthong bar gyur te zhes rlo ma sems par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba de nyid snang ba yang yin par 'khrul pas bdag ni 'di mthong bar gyur te zhes rlo ma sems par bstan pa yin no //
translated: He shows that he does not think, ‚ÄúI see this,‚Äù because of the confusion that that very seeing is also the appearance.

original: yang na bdag ces @189a * //
analyzed: yang na bdag ces @189a * //
translated: Or, ‚ÄúI‚Äù is a mere designation for the continuum of aggregates.

original: bya ba'i shes pa 'di lus la sogs pa 'dus pa nye bar dmigs bzhin par 'byung ba yin na de la dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: bya ba'i shes pa 'di lus la sogs pa 'dus pa nye bar dmigs bzhin par 'byung ba yin na de la dmigs pa yin no //
translated: The cognition of action arises while the body and so on are being observed, so it observes them.

original: de ltar yang don rig pa gzhan sgrub pa ma yin pa ni bdag gi ngo bor brjod do //
analyzed: de ltar yang don rig pa gzhan sgrub pa ma yin pa ni bdag gi ngo bor brjod do //
translated: Thus, the cognition of objects is not established as anything else, and it is said to be the nature of the self.

original: de yang skad cig re re la gzhan dang gzhan yin te /
analyzed: de yang skad cig re re la gzhan dang gzhan yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is different from moment to moment,

original: brgyal ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na ldog pa yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: brgyal ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na ldog pa yin pa'i phyir //
translated: because it ceases in states such as fainting.

original: 'dzin par byed pa yod pa las rig pa ma yin pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dzin par byed pa yod pa las rig pa ma yin pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not that there is no cognition because there is a self,

original: lkog tu ma gyur pa nyid du khas len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lkog tu ma gyur pa nyid du khas len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is accepted that it is not hidden.

original: brgyal ba dang bral ba na lus 'ba' zhig kho na las 'byung bar dmigs pa yin te /
analyzed: brgyal ba dang bral ba na lus 'ba' zhig kho na las 'byung bar dmigs pa yin te /
translated: When one is free from fainting, it is observed that the body alone arises.

original: rig pa ma yin pa'i bdag nam mkha' dang mtshungs par gyur nas gnas pa yin par ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: rig pa ma yin pa'i bdag nam mkha' dang mtshungs par gyur nas gnas pa yin par ni mi rigs te /
translated: It is not reasonable that the noncognitive self remains like space,

original: bdag ni gsal zhing 'bar ba nyid yin zhes zer ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: bdag ni gsal zhing 'bar ba nyid yin zhes zer ba'i phyir te /
translated: because it is said that the self is luminous and radiant.

original: bdag ni 'bar ba yang dag par gsal ba yin pa'i phyir de kho na rig pa yin te /
analyzed: bdag ni 'bar ba yang dag par gsal ba yin pa'i phyir de kho na rig pa yin te /
translated: Since the self is the true illuminator of the blazing fire, it is the knower of reality.

original: rtogs par byed pa nyid kyis 'brel pa yin la /
analyzed: rtogs par byed pa nyid kyis 'brel pa yin la /
translated: It is related to the fire by the relation of the knower.

original: de yi ngo bo gtso yang lus la bdag / ces pa 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de yi ngo bo gtso yang lus la bdag / ces pa 'byung ba yin no //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThe self is the principal one in the body‚Äù is made in this context.

original: 'brel pa'i rgyu mtshan can tha mi dad pa'i blo 'khrul pa yin la /
analyzed: 'brel pa'i rgyu mtshan can tha mi dad pa'i blo 'khrul pa yin la /
translated: The cognition of the nondifference of the self and the body is a deluded cognition, having as its basis the relation of the self to the body.

original: 'dus pa nyid la dmigs pa'i phyir gtso bo yin no //
analyzed: 'dus pa nyid la dmigs pa'i phyir gtso bo yin no //
translated: The self is the principal one in the body because it is the object of the cognition of the body.üîΩThe word ‚Äúmy‚Äù is used in the sense of the self, or in the sense of the body, or in the sense of the self in relation to the body.

original: bdag gi zhes bya ba ni rig pa'i bdag nyid la'am 'dus pa la ltos nas tha dad pa yin du zin kyang de bzhin du bdag grub pa ni ma yin la /
analyzed: bdag gi zhes bya ba ni rig pa'i bdag nyid la'am 'dus pa la ltos nas tha dad pa yin du zin kyang de bzhin du bdag grub pa ni ma yin la /
translated: Even though there is a difference in the sense of the word ‚Äúmy,‚Äù the self is not established in the same way.

original: bdag ces bya ba rig pa las gzhan bdag gi gnas skabs gsum dmigs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag ces bya ba rig pa las gzhan bdag gi gnas skabs gsum dmigs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The self is not perceived in the three states of waking, dreaming, and deep sleep, which are different from the self.

original: 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the self and the three states are mutually exclusive.

original: skad cig par yang rig pa ni gcig nyid du rjes su 'brel pa'i don byed pa la mngon sum du dmigs pa yin te /
analyzed: skad cig par yang rig pa ni gcig nyid du rjes su 'brel pa'i don byed pa la mngon sum du dmigs pa yin te /
translated: The self is perceived as the one that is related to the cognition that is momentary, and as the one that is directly perceived as the experiencer of the object.

original: ba lang khro bo mthong ba na khu yu la ba glang nyid du rjes su sbyor ba bzhin du rnam par 'jog par byed pa yin gyi rang gi ngo bo la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ba lang khro bo mthong ba na khu yu la ba glang nyid du rjes su sbyor ba bzhin du rnam par 'jog par byed pa yin gyi rang gi ngo bo la ni ma yin te /
translated: Just as when one sees a fierce bull, one applies the term ‚Äúbull‚Äù to a cow, so too, one posits the self in dependence on the aggregates, but not in terms of its own nature.

original: mngon gsum dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon gsum dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it contradicts direct perception.

original: skyes pa nas brtsams nas 'chi ba'i bar du rjes su 'jug pas bdag gcig pu yin yang /
analyzed: skyes pa nas brtsams nas 'chi ba'i bar du rjes su 'jug pas bdag gcig pu yin yang /
translated: Although the self is one, it is said to be the support of the arising of the aggregates, beginning with birth and ending with death.

original: snga rol du dang phyis kyang de yod pa la ni tshad ma cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: snga rol du dang phyis kyang de yod pa la ni tshad ma cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But there is not the slightest valid cognition of its existence prior to or subsequent to the aggregates.

original: skye ba dran pa la sogs pa mthong ba yin na de nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: skye ba dran pa la sogs pa mthong ba yin na de nyid yin gyi /
translated: If one sees the memory of birth and so on, that is the self.

original: de bzhin du gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not like that in any other way.

original: smras pa bdag ces bya ba 'dis de 'dzin pa ni yi ge ga la sogs pa bzhin du yul ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: smras pa bdag ces bya ba 'dis de 'dzin pa ni yi ge ga la sogs pa bzhin du yul ma nges pa yin no //
translated: Objection: This so-called self is apprehended like the letters ga, etc., and its object is not ascertained.

original: de'i phyir khyab bdag dang / dus nges pa med pa nyid kyis brtag pa yin no//
analyzed: de'i phyir khyab bdag dang / dus nges pa med pa nyid kyis brtag pa yin no//
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that it is the pervasive lord, because it is not ascertained in time.

original: @189b ji skad du /
analyzed: @189b ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: ma bcad pa yin yod pa can //
analyzed: ma bcad pa yin yod pa can //
translated: It is not cut, and it exists.

original: dngos gang yul dang dus dag las /
analyzed: dngos gang yul dang dus dag las /
translated: Any entity that is not

original: de bzhin du yod pa yin no zhe de dag tsam du bstan par nus kyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du yod pa yin no zhe de dag tsam du bstan par nus kyi /
translated: In the same way, it is possible to teach that the self exists in the mere sense of being a nominal designation.

original: skyes pa dang 'jig pa zhes ni ma yin no //
analyzed: skyes pa dang 'jig pa zhes ni ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, it is possible to indicate that something exists, but it is not possible to indicate that it is produced or destroyed.

original: mtho ris 'dod pas spyin sreg gis shig ces bya'i /
analyzed: mtho ris 'dod pas spyin sreg gis shig ces bya'i /
translated: One should offer oblations with the desire for heaven,

original: rgyu ni 'jig rten pha rol gyi 'bras bu dang 'brel pa can du 'phangs pa yin la /
analyzed: rgyu ni 'jig rten pha rol gyi 'bras bu dang 'brel pa can du 'phangs pa yin la /
translated: but the cause is projected as being related to a result in another world.

original: de bzhin du rnyings pa med pa zhes bya ba ni ma rnyings pa'o zhes don du smra ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnyings pa med pa zhes bya ba ni ma rnyings pa'o zhes don du smra ba yin no //
translated: In the same way, ‚Äúwithout aging‚Äù means ‚Äúwithout having aged.‚Äù

original: bdag gi gzugs lta bu'i lus kyi chos sam /
analyzed: bdag gi gzugs lta bu'i lus kyi chos sam /
translated: The self is not a property of the body, like the form of the body,

original: cha shas can ni ma yin te /
analyzed: cha shas can ni ma yin te /
translated: nor is it a whole composed of parts,

original: de ltar ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not perceived in that way.

original: de'i phyir de zhig pa yin na yang nam mkha' bzhin du 'jig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de zhig pa yin na yang nam mkha' bzhin du 'jig pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, even if it were destroyed, it would not be destroyed, like space.

original: ba lang dang rta zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa nges pa can ma yin par snang ba yang nges pa can mthong ba'i stobs kyis 'byung ba yin gyi /
analyzed: ba lang dang rta zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa nges pa can ma yin par snang ba yang nges pa can mthong ba'i stobs kyis 'byung ba yin gyi /
translated: The appearance of a definite conceptual thought such as ‚Äúcow‚Äù or ‚Äúhorse‚Äù occurs by the power of seeing something definite,

original: de lta bu ma yin pa'i phyir khyab bdag ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu ma yin pa'i phyir khyab bdag ni ma yin no //
translated: but the self is not like that, because it is not a pervader.

original: de lta na yul sna tshogs pa la de la nges pa'i sgra dmigs pa ni rjes su 'brel pa las rtag pa nyid du shes par gyur gyi khyab bdag nyid du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yul sna tshogs pa la de la nges pa'i sgra dmigs pa ni rjes su 'brel pa las rtag pa nyid du shes par gyur gyi khyab bdag nyid du ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the observation of a sound that is ascertained with respect to a variety of objects is known to be permanent by way of its continuity, but not by way of its pervasiveness.

original: bum pa la sogs pa mthong ba bzhin du yi ge ga la sogs pa mthong ba yul nges pa can kho na yin te /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa mthong ba bzhin du yi ge ga la sogs pa mthong ba yul nges pa can kho na yin te /
translated: Like the observation of a pot, etc., the observation of the letters ga, etc., is ascertained with respect to a particular object.

original: cha shas med pa nyid kyis 'jig par byed pa med pa'i phyir rjes su 'brel bas rtag pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: cha shas med pa nyid kyis 'jig par byed pa med pa'i phyir rjes su 'brel bas rtag pa nyid yin na /
translated: If it is permanent by way of its continuity because it is indestructible by reason of its partlessness,

original: khyab bdag nyid yin no ;
analyzed: khyab bdag nyid yin no ;
translated: then it is pervasive.

original: / yul nges pa can yang ji ltar yang gsal byed 'khrul pa las byung ba 'khrul pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: / yul nges pa can yang ji ltar yang gsal byed 'khrul pa las byung ba 'khrul pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is ascertained with respect to an object, then how is it that the manifestor of the letters is mistaken, since it arises from a mistake?

original: cha shas dang bcas pa'i thob pa la sogs pa yod na 'jig pa yin zhes bya ba ma mthong ba'i phyir 'di ci las shes /
analyzed: cha shas dang bcas pa'i thob pa la sogs pa yod na 'jig pa yin zhes bya ba ma mthong ba'i phyir 'di ci las shes /
translated: Since it is not seen that destruction exists when there is a part, etc., how is this known?

original: cha shas med pa la yang khyad par med do //
analyzed: cha shas med pa la yang khyad par med do //
translated: There is no difference in the partless.

original: gyo mo ro zhe na /
analyzed: gyo mo ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is the destruction of the pot,

original: 'di la yang de dang bral ba'i yul yod do //
analyzed: 'di la yang de dang bral ba'i yul yod do //
translated: then in this case, too, the object is devoid of that.

original: yul ni ma nges pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: yul ni ma nges pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But the object is not ascertained.

original: gyo bo la yang bum pa la rtsom pa ma yin pa can bzhin du yin pa'i phyir khyad par mthong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gyo bo la yang bum pa la rtsom pa ma yin pa can bzhin du yin pa'i phyir khyad par mthong ba ma yin no //
translated: But it is not seen to be different, because it is like the non-beginning of a pot in a crooked place.

original: sngar mthong ba ngo shes pa yang de dang gcig par 'dzin par don byed pa'i rgyu mtshan yin par brjod do //
analyzed: sngar mthong ba ngo shes pa yang de dang gcig par 'dzin par don byed pa'i rgyu mtshan yin par brjod do //
translated: And the recognition of what was seen before is said to be the reason for the function of apprehending it as the same.

original: 'dis ni lkog tu ma gyur pa rig par dmigs nas bdag ces bya ba 'byung bas yul nges pa can la sogs pa dang / bdag med pa ma yin par lung dang 'brel pa can gyi lung las brtag pa la sogs pa rigs pa yang bshad pa yin la /
analyzed: 'dis ni lkog tu ma gyur pa rig par dmigs nas bdag ces bya ba 'byung bas yul nges pa can la sogs pa dang / bdag med pa ma yin par lung dang 'brel pa can gyi lung las brtag pa la sogs pa rigs pa yang bshad pa yin la /
translated: By this, it is explained that the scriptures related to the ascertainment of the object and so on, and the reasoning related to the investigation and so on of the non-existence of self, are based on the observation of the known non-secret self.

original: skyes bus byas pa ma yin pa nyid la yang @190a * //üîΩbstan pa yin no //
analyzed: skyes bus byas pa ma yin pa nyid la yang @190a * // bstan pa yin no //
translated: And it is shown that it is not created by a person.

original: de ni de bzhin du lkog tu ma gyur pa rig pa por nas /
analyzed: de ni de bzhin du lkog tu ma gyur pa rig pa por nas /
translated: And that is the known non-secret self.

original: bdag tu byed pa'i yul gzhan ston pa yin zhes pa'i thabs las byung ba gzhan 'phen ba'i gnas skabs gzhan yin gyi /
analyzed: bdag tu byed pa'i yul gzhan ston pa yin zhes pa'i thabs las byung ba gzhan 'phen ba'i gnas skabs gzhan yin gyi /
translated: It is the other occasion of the other means of knowledge that shows the other object of the self-maker.

original: gal te thabs nyid 'geg par byed na thabs med na thabs las byung ba grub par mi nus pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te thabs nyid 'geg par byed na thabs med na thabs las byung ba grub par mi nus pa ni ma yin te /
translated: If the method itself is blocked, it is not the case that without the method, the arising of the result is impossible.

original: de thabs yongs su 'dor bar byed pa ni ma yin no bdag tu shes pa kho na /
analyzed: de thabs yongs su 'dor bar byed pa ni ma yin no bdag tu shes pa kho na /
translated: It is not that the method is completely abandoned.

original: bdag rig pa bdag ma yin nam /
analyzed: bdag rig pa bdag ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt the self-knowing consciousness the self?

original: 'di las nyid yod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di las nyid yod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that it exists from this,

original: mngon sum yin pa'i phyir rang rig par bya ba de yod ces bya ba'i tshig las so //
analyzed: mngon sum yin pa'i phyir rang rig par bya ba de yod ces bya ba'i tshig las so //
translated: because of the statement ‚ÄúIt exists as the object of self-knowing awareness.‚Äù

original: de ni gzhan kyis mthong bar mi nus te /
analyzed: de ni gzhan kyis mthong bar mi nus te /
translated: It cannot be seen by another.

original: bdag gis mthong ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: bdag gis mthong ba yin no zhe na /
translated: It is seen by the self.

original: ma yin te 'di ni bum pa bzhin du las nyid khas len pa'i phyir dang / byed pa po nyid mngon sum yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te 'di ni bum pa bzhin du las nyid khas len pa'i phyir dang / byed pa po nyid mngon sum yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because it is accepted as an object of action like a pot, and because the agent itself is directly perceived.

original: bdag tu shes pa'i shes bya ni //
analyzed: bdag tu shes pa'i shes bya ni //
translated: The object of the cognition of the self

original: rang nyid bdag tu 'thad pa yin //
analyzed: rang nyid bdag tu 'thad pa yin //
translated: is itself tenable as the self.

original: zhes bya ba yang /
analyzed: zhes bya ba yang /
translated: This is also said:

original: 'di shes pa yang yin la bum pa la sogs pa rig pa can yang yin pa'i phyir rig pa'o //
analyzed: 'di shes pa yang yin la bum pa la sogs pa rig pa can yang yin pa'i phyir rig pa'o //
translated: It is cognition and it is the knower of pots and so on, and therefore it is awareness.

original: de ni de lta bu'i bdag tu 'thad pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni de lta bu'i bdag tu 'thad pa yin no //
translated: That is the way the self is tenable.

original: de sus shes she na /
analyzed: de sus shes she na /
translated: Who knows that?

original: bdag rang nyid kyi shes bya yin te /
