analyzed: bdag rang nyid kyi shes bya yin te /
translated: The self is the object of its own knowledge.

original: rang rig par bya ba bdag gi mngon sum yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang rig par bya ba bdag gi mngon sum yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúthe self is the direct perception of the reflexive‚Äù is that.

original: gang zhig dang po yin pa las kyi shes pa ni phyi rol du gtso bo yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig dang po yin pa las kyi shes pa ni phyi rol du gtso bo yin te /
translated: The first, the knowledge of the agent, is the external principle.

original: ji ltar yang 'di la sgro 'dogs pa'i yul du rnam par gnas pa yin la /
analyzed: ji ltar yang 'di la sgro 'dogs pa'i yul du rnam par gnas pa yin la /
translated: In what way is it established as the object of superimposition?

original: de 'di dang mngon par 'brel bas 'di las byed pa po dam pa yin te /
analyzed: de 'di dang mngon par 'brel bas 'di las byed pa po dam pa yin te /
translated: Since it is connected with this, it is the supreme agent in this.

original: rang nyid rang gis shes zhes bya ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: rang nyid rang gis shes zhes bya ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúitself‚Äù is reflexive.

original: gzhan du na dam pa zhes bstan par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan du na dam pa zhes bstan par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Otherwise, it would not be taught as ‚Äúsupreme.‚Äù

original: phyi rol gyi las byed pa po nyid dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa nyid 'di ni dam pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi las byed pa po nyid dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa nyid 'di ni dam pa nyid yin no //
translated: The fact that it is not the same as the external agent is the supreme characteristic.

original: de ltar yang shes pa po las gzhan pa'i yul yang der mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar yang shes pa po las gzhan pa'i yul yang der mi 'gyur te /
translated: In that case, the object that is different from the knower would not be that.

original: rang bzhin gyis shes pa po yin pa'i phyir 'di'i las nyid gzhan rang bzhin gyis yod pa ma yin pa ni brtags pa'i dngos po las gzhan zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis shes pa po yin pa'i phyir 'di'i las nyid gzhan rang bzhin gyis yod pa ma yin pa ni brtags pa'i dngos po las gzhan zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because it is an intrinsically existent cognizer, its object does not exist intrinsically as other. This is the meaning of ‚Äúother than the imagined thing.‚Äù

original: shes pa por ci las 'gyur ba yin zhe na yang /
analyzed: shes pa por ci las 'gyur ba yin zhe na yang /
translated: How does it become a cognizer?üîΩMoreover,

original: yang ; bdag tu shes pa'i rnam shes ni //
analyzed: yang ; bdag tu shes pa'i rnam shes ni //
translated: Consciousness is known as the self.

original: thams cad nyid du shes par bya //üîΩzhes smos pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad nyid du shes par bya // zhes smos pa'o //
translated: It is known in all cases.

original: thams cad ces smos pas shes pa po gzung bar yin no zhe na /
analyzed: thams cad ces smos pas shes pa po gzung bar yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is said that ‚Äúall‚Äù refers to the cognizer,

original: ma yin te mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: no, because that is impossible.

original: de'i @190b phyir gzhan thams cad kho na zhes bya ba yang mi 'gal pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i @190b phyir gzhan thams cad kho na zhes bya ba yang mi 'gal pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, it is not contradictory to say that ‚Äúall other‚Äù is just that.

original: shes par bya ba zhes bya ba ni khyad par yin gyi bdag 'di shes par bya ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: shes par bya ba zhes bya ba ni khyad par yin gyi bdag 'di shes par bya ba ni ma yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúThat which is to be known‚Äù is a qualifier, but this self is not that which is to be known,

original: shes pa po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is a cognizer.

original: bdag 'di zhas bya ba'i shes pa de yang bdag 'di shes par 'gyur zhes rjes su sbyor bzhin pa'i rnam par shes pas 'byed pa yin la /
analyzed: bdag 'di zhas bya ba'i shes pa de yang bdag 'di shes par 'gyur zhes rjes su sbyor bzhin pa'i rnam par shes pas 'byed pa yin la /
translated: The consciousness called ‚Äúself‚Äù is distinguished by the consciousness that is engaged in the thought ‚ÄúI know this self.‚Äù

original: rnam shes 'di sngar mthong ba ni ma yin te /üîΩgang gis dran par byed pa'am //
analyzed: rnam shes 'di sngar mthong ba ni ma yin te / gang gis dran par byed pa'am //
translated: This consciousness is not the one that previously saw,üîΩbecause of what would it be a memory?

original: rjes su sbyor bar byed par 'gyur //
analyzed: rjes su sbyor bar byed par 'gyur //
translated: Or what would it be engaged in?

original: dran dang sngar mthong ngo shes dag / bag chags dbang gis byung ba nyid //üîΩshes pa po yi yul gzhan la //
analyzed: dran dang sngar mthong ngo shes dag / bag chags dbang gis byung ba nyid // shes pa po yi yul gzhan la //
translated: Memory and the recognition of what was previously seen arise due to the power of residual impressions.

original: sngar mthong ngo shes rnyed par dka' //
analyzed: sngar mthong ngo shes rnyed par dka' //
translated: It is difficult to find the recognition of what was previously seen in the object of the knower.

original: de lta yin na rtar rnam par rtog par byed pa na ba glang mthong ba ji ltar yin /
analyzed: de lta yin na rtar rnam par rtog par byed pa na ba glang mthong ba ji ltar yin /
translated: If that were the case, how could the thought ‚ÄúI am a horse‚Äù arise when one sees an ox?

original: bdag tu shes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag tu shes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no recognition of self.

original: rtog pa 'di rnams so sor mi rigs pa kho na skye ba dang 'jig pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rtog pa 'di rnams so sor mi rigs pa kho na skye ba dang 'jig pa ni ma yin no //
translated: These thoughts do not arise individually, but they do arise.

original: rtag pa'i phyir yod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rtag pa'i phyir yod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: It exists because it is permanent.

original: ma yin te shes pa las gzhan ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te shes pa las gzhan ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because nothing other than consciousness is perceived.

original: bdag shes par gyur pa yin no zhes bdag tu shes pa'i shes pa po nyid rjes su sbyor ba de la yang yin no zhe na /
analyzed: bdag shes par gyur pa yin no zhes bdag tu shes pa'i shes pa po nyid rjes su sbyor ba de la yang yin no zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúI am the one who knows,‚Äù the one who is engaged in the cognition of self is not the one who knows.

original: ma yin te shes pa las gzhan pa'i ma dmigs pas gnod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te shes pa las gzhan pa'i ma dmigs pas gnod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because it is undermined by the fact that nothing other than cognition is observed.

original: shes pa nyid bdag ni ma yin te /
analyzed: shes pa nyid bdag ni ma yin te /
translated: Cognition itself is not the self,

original: khas mi len pa'i phyir dang / rang rig pa nyid kyis lkog tu gyur pa nyid khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khas mi len pa'i phyir dang / rang rig pa nyid kyis lkog tu gyur pa nyid khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not accepted and because it is not accepted that it is hidden from itself.

original: ka ba la yang de rig pa las gzhan du 'dzin pa por nyams su myong ba ma yin la /
analyzed: ka ba la yang de rig pa las gzhan du 'dzin pa por nyams su myong ba ma yin la /
translated: It is not experienced as the apprehender that is other than the cognition of a pillar.

original: de ltar rtog pa yin na mthong ba nyams pa dang ma mthong ba'i rtog pa dang / rig pa 'gal bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar rtog pa yin na mthong ba nyams pa dang ma mthong ba'i rtog pa dang / rig pa 'gal bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were conceived in that way, it would be contradictory to conceive of the hidden and the manifest as cognition.

original: 'on te ka ba la sogs pa'i ngo bos dmigs bya med pa nyid du brjod pa yin na /
analyzed: 'on te ka ba la sogs pa'i ngo bos dmigs bya med pa nyid du brjod pa yin na /
translated: But if it is said that the object of perception does not exist by the nature of a pillar, etc.,

original: rig par mthong ba'i phyir de dang 'gal bar yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rig par mthong ba'i phyir de dang 'gal bar yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then it follows that it would be contradictory to that, because it is seen as cognition.

original: ka ba rig pa'i bdag nyid can gyi rnam shes ni rig pa ma yin pa'i bdag nyid dmigs bya med pa nyid de rig pa dang 'gal ba kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ka ba rig pa'i bdag nyid can gyi rnam shes ni rig pa ma yin pa'i bdag nyid dmigs bya med pa nyid de rig pa dang 'gal ba kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The consciousness that is the nature of the pillar would be the object of observation that is not the nature of awareness, and it would be only contradictory to awareness.

original: shes pa nyid shes pa po yin par ni bden mod kyi /
analyzed: shes pa nyid shes pa po yin par ni bden mod kyi /
translated: It is true that consciousness itself is the knower,

original: 'ba' zhig po ni rtag pa yin te /
analyzed: 'ba' zhig po ni rtag pa yin te /
translated: but it is singular and permanent.

original: de'i phyir bdag tu byed ba'i yul yang bdag tu 'gyur ro //üîΩka ba'i shes pa po nyid ka bar nyams su myong ba'i sgo nas de zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag tu byed ba'i yul yang bdag tu 'gyur ro // ka ba'i shes pa po nyid ka bar nyams su myong ba'i sgo nas de zhes bya ba'am /
translated: Therefore, the object that is made into the self would also be the self.üîΩThe knower of the consciousness of the pillar, by way of the experience of the pillar, is called ‚Äúthat‚Äù or ‚Äúpillar.‚Äù

original: ka ba zhes bya bar ji ltar rnam par rtog par byed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ka ba zhes bya bar ji ltar rnam par rtog par byed pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as it is imagined,

original: shes pa po nyid kyis @191a * //
analyzed: shes pa po nyid kyis @191a * //
translated: the knower itself

original: nyams su myong ba las bdag go ces 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba las bdag go ces 'jug pa yin te /
translated: experiences the self, and it engages in the self.

original: ji ltar goms pa'i las yin gyi /
analyzed: ji ltar goms pa'i las yin gyi /
translated: It is the action of being accustomed to that,

original: nyams su myong ba med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but it is not without experience.

original: des 'on te shes pa po nyid 'dra na /
analyzed: des 'on te shes pa po nyid 'dra na /
translated: If the knower itself is similar,

original: lus gzhan rnams la'ang der 'gyur te /
analyzed: lus gzhan rnams la'ang der 'gyur te /
translated: it would be that for other bodies as well.

original: de la thams cad kyis shes na //
analyzed: de la thams cad kyis shes na //
translated: If it is known by all,üîΩthen it would be the self of all.

original: bdag po zhes kyang dran par 'gyur //
analyzed: bdag po zhes kyang dran par 'gyur //
translated: and also as the owner.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis gsal ba yin no //
translated: This is the clarification.

original: shes pa po nyid la sogs pa 'dra ba la sogs pa bdag tu byed pa'i rgyu mtshan ma yin te /
analyzed: shes pa po nyid la sogs pa 'dra ba la sogs pa bdag tu byed pa'i rgyu mtshan ma yin te /
translated: The reason for positing the self as the cognizer, etc., is not the similarity of the cognizer, etc.,üîΩbut rather the reason is the awareness of the self.

original: 'on kyang bdag rig pa rgyu mtshan yin 'on te bdag shes pa por gyur pa zhes bya bas snga ma dang phyi ma'i shes pa po pa por gyur pa zhes bya bas snga ma'i shes pa po dag cha gcig pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang bdag rig pa rgyu mtshan yin 'on te bdag shes pa por gyur pa zhes bya bas snga ma dang phyi ma'i shes pa po pa por gyur pa zhes bya bas snga ma'i shes pa po dag cha gcig pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If the self is the cognizer, then the cognizer in the prior moment and the cognizer in the subsequent moment are identical.

original: de gcig pa nyid yin na bum pa'i shes pa'i dus su de'i gyo mo shes par gyur la /
analyzed: de gcig pa nyid yin na bum pa'i shes pa'i dus su de'i gyo mo shes par gyur la /
translated: If they are identical, then when there is awareness of a pot, there is awareness of its shards.

original: de shes pa'i dus su yang bum pa shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de shes pa'i dus su yang bum pa shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: And when there is awareness of its shards, there is awareness of the pot.üîΩIf you say that there is no error because the single awareness is in different states,

original: shes pa gcig nyid kyang gnas skabs tha dad pa'i phyir skyon med do zhe na de lta yin na nyams su myong ba tha dad pa ni gnas skabs tha dad pas rjes su byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: shes pa gcig nyid kyang gnas skabs tha dad pa'i phyir skyon med do zhe na de lta yin na nyams su myong ba tha dad pa ni gnas skabs tha dad pas rjes su byed pa yin gyi /
translated: then if that were so, the different experiences would be subsequent to the different states.

original: de gcig pa nyid rjes su byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de gcig pa nyid rjes su byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: And if the collection were different, it would not be tenable that the aggregates are the self.

original: de'i gnas skabs yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i gnas skabs yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the self is the state of the aggregates,üîΩthat is not so, because the state is not different from the aggregates.üîΩAnd if the state were different, it would not be tenable that the aggregates are the self.üîΩIf you say that the self is the shape of the aggregates,üîΩthat is not so, because the shape is not different from the aggregates.

original: ma yin te de las 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: ma yin te de las 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir la /
translated: And if the shape were different, it would not be tenable that the aggregates are the self.üîΩIf you say that the self is the possession of the aggregates,üîΩthat is not so, because possession is not different from the aggregates.

original: 'gyur ba yin na yang gnas skabs kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gyur ba yin na yang gnas skabs kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: And if possession were different, it would not be tenable that the aggregates are the self.

original: snga ma'i gnas skabs su shi ba phyis yod par ngo shes pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: snga ma'i gnas skabs su shi ba phyis yod par ngo shes pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the self is the support of the aggregates,üîΩthat is not so, because the support is not different from the aggregates.

original: bden te / bregs pa'i skra dang sen mo la sogs pa bzhin du shi ba yang ngo shes pa ni 'khrul pa yin no //üîΩgnod pa can med na ji ltar 'khrul pa yin /
analyzed: bden te / bregs pa'i skra dang sen mo la sogs pa bzhin du shi ba yang ngo shes pa ni 'khrul pa yin no // gnod pa can med na ji ltar 'khrul pa yin /
translated: And if the support were different, it would not be tenable that the aggregates are the self.üîΩIf you say that the self is the one who experiences the aggregates,üîΩthat is not so, because the experiencer is not different from the aggregates.

original: shi ba nyid du shes pa kho na gnod pa can yin no //
analyzed: shi ba nyid du shes pa kho na gnod pa can yin no //
translated: And if the experiencer were different, it would not be tenable that the aggregates are the self.

original: 'dis ni gcig pu byed pa po dang za ba po nyid du bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni gcig pu byed pa po dang za ba po nyid du bshad pa yin no //
translated: If you say that the self is the one who appropriates the aggregates,üîΩthat is not so, because the appropriator is not different from the aggregates.üîΩAnd if the appropriator were different, it would not be tenable that the aggregates are the self.üîΩIf you say that the self is the one who perceives the aggregates,üîΩthat is not so, because the perceiver is not different from the aggregates.

original: gnas skabs tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa dag gis byed pa dang / za ba dag gis tha dad pa'am tha mi dad pa yin gyi gnas skabs thams cad pa'am /
analyzed: gnas skabs tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa dag gis byed pa dang / za ba dag gis tha dad pa'am tha mi dad pa yin gyi gnas skabs thams cad pa'am /
translated: And if the perceiver were different, it would not be tenable that the aggregates are the self.üîΩIf you say that the self is the one who is liberated,

original: nam mkha'i ni ma yin te //
analyzed: nam mkha'i ni ma yin te //
translated: that is not so, because the liberated one is not different from the aggregates.üîΩAnd if the liberated one were different, it would not be tenable that the aggregates are the self.üîΩIf you say that the self is the one who sees, hears, smells, tastes, touches, and cognizes

original: de dag la gnas skabs thams cad pa ni rgyu yin gyi nam mkha'i ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di su'i rigs pa yin /
analyzed: de dag la gnas skabs thams cad pa ni rgyu yin gyi nam mkha'i ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di su'i rigs pa yin /
translated: But whose reasoning is it that the universal cause is the cause of all states, but that space is not?

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: tshangs pa shes bas /
analyzed: tshangs pa shes bas /
translated: Brahma said:

original: ji ltar dngos de rgyu yin pa //
analyzed: ji ltar dngos de rgyu yin pa //
translated: ‚ÄúJust as a thing is a cause,

original: de ltar de nyid gang gi tshe //üîΩrgyu min de ni gang gi rgyur //üîΩ'dod la rgyu ma yin mi 'dod //
analyzed: de ltar de nyid gang gi tshe // rgyu min de ni gang gi rgyur // 'dod la rgyu ma yin mi 'dod //
translated: in just that way it is a non-cause.üîΩWhat is not a cause is not a cause.üîΩWhat is a cause is not a non-cause.‚Äù

original: ces gang smras ba'o //
analyzed: ces gang smras ba'o //
translated: And:

original: 'jig rten pa yang gnas skabs kho na yin par smra ba ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa yang gnas skabs kho na yin par smra ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúThe world also speaks of a universal state,

original: gnas skabs gzhan las byung ba'i bdag gi dge ba dang mi dge ba'i 'bras bu yin no zhes shes nas kyang 'gro ba rnams 'jug @191b pa dang 'dor ba yang mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: gnas skabs gzhan las byung ba'i bdag gi dge ba dang mi dge ba'i 'bras bu yin no zhes shes nas kyang 'gro ba rnams 'jug @191b pa dang 'dor ba yang mthong ba yin no //
translated: and we see that people engage in and desist from actions after understanding that the results of virtuous and nonvirtuous actions arise from a different state.

original: gang yang sems pa can dang yod pa'i rdzas nyid ni gnas skabs tha dad kyang dbye ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang yang sems pa can dang yod pa'i rdzas nyid ni gnas skabs tha dad kyang dbye ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: And because a sentient being and a substantial existent are not different in different states,

original: gnas skabs thams cad par 'gyur ba yin la /
analyzed: gnas skabs thams cad par 'gyur ba yin la /
translated: they are universal.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs kyang mi rnams 'gro yang rung ba na /üîΩbdag gi sems pa can gyi rdzas yod pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo grol ba ma yin no zhes bya ba gang yin pa de yang snga ma dang phyi ma'i gnas skabs tha dad pa la /
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs kyang mi rnams 'gro yang rung ba na / bdag gi sems pa can gyi rdzas yod pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo grol ba ma yin no zhes bya ba gang yin pa de yang snga ma dang phyi ma'i gnas skabs tha dad pa la /
translated: Also, the situation of happiness, suffering, and so on is not liberated from the nature of the existence of a self-sufficient substantial existent.

original: de mi dad pa'i sems pa can la sogs pa'i bye brag las mi rigs so //
analyzed: de mi dad pa'i sems pa can la sogs pa'i bye brag las mi rigs so //
translated: That is illogical because of the difference between the earlier and later situations.

original: 'dis ni tha dad pa la yang rgyu nyid du bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni tha dad pa la yang rgyu nyid du bstan pa yin te /
translated: This also demonstrates that difference is the cause.

original: gnas skabs rnams kyi med pa la sogs pa bzhin du /
analyzed: gnas skabs rnams kyi med pa la sogs pa bzhin du /
translated: It is like the nonexistence of situations.

original: rgyu nyid du brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu nyid du brjod pa yin no //
translated: It is stated that difference is the cause.

original: 'on te gnas skabs nyid snga ma dang phyi ma'i dus rjes su sbyor bar byed pa yin na /
analyzed: 'on te gnas skabs nyid snga ma dang phyi ma'i dus rjes su sbyor bar byed pa yin na /
translated: But if the situation itself connects the earlier and later times,

original: de'i tshe 'di med pa yin na ji ltar rjes su sbyor bar byed /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'di med pa yin na ji ltar rjes su sbyor bar byed /
translated: then if it does not exist, how could it connect them?

original: shi ba la rjes su sbyor bar byed pa yin na /
analyzed: shi ba la rjes su sbyor bar byed pa yin na /
translated: If it connects them after it has died,

original: bregs pa'i skra la rjes su sbyor ba bzhin du 'khrul pa yin no //
analyzed: bregs pa'i skra la rjes su sbyor ba bzhin du 'khrul pa yin no //
translated: It is a mistake to apply the term ‚Äúhair‚Äù to the hair that has been cut.

original: nang dang phyi yang skad cig re re la tha dad pa yin na de nyid la rjes su sbyor ba ni 'khrul pa yin na ji ltar 'jug pa yin /
analyzed: nang dang phyi yang skad cig re re la tha dad pa yin na de nyid la rjes su sbyor ba ni 'khrul pa yin na ji ltar 'jug pa yin /
translated: If the inner and outer are different in each instant, it is a mistake to apply the term ‚Äúself‚Äù to the self of the previous instant.

original: rab tu grub pa nyid med na tha snyad thams cad mi 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: rab tu grub pa nyid med na tha snyad thams cad mi 'dod pa yin te /
translated: If there is no real establishment, then all conventions are unacceptable.

original: ther zug tu gnas pa'i rtag pa gcig pu 'dod pa dang / 'brel pa can mthong ba dang snang bzhin pa ni tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan du 'dod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ther zug tu gnas pa'i rtag pa gcig pu 'dod pa dang / 'brel pa can mthong ba dang snang bzhin pa ni tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan du 'dod pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not maintained that a single, permanent, and unchanging thing is the basis of convention, nor is it maintained that the related object that is seen and appears is the basis of convention.

original: rgyun ni rgyu mtshan yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rgyun ni rgyu mtshan yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the continuum is the basis of convention,

original: rgyun yin yang de ni snga ma nyid kyis rjes su sbyor ba med na ji ltar tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan yin /
analyzed: rgyun yin yang de ni snga ma nyid kyis rjes su sbyor ba med na ji ltar tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan yin /
translated: then even though the continuum is the basis of convention, since the previous one does not continue into the later ones, how can it be the basis of convention?

original: bdag dang 'di zhes bya ba yang rjes su sbyor ba yin na tha snyad kyi yan lag yin par ni bden te /
analyzed: bdag dang 'di zhes bya ba yang rjes su sbyor ba yin na tha snyad kyi yan lag yin par ni bden te /
translated: If the self and ‚Äúthis‚Äù are applied to the continuum, then it is true that they are parts of convention.

original: de gcig pu 'dzin pa skyed par byed pa 'ba' zhig ni de mi byed par rnam par gcod par byed pa'i ngo bos yin la /
analyzed: de gcig pu 'dzin pa skyed par byed pa 'ba' zhig ni de mi byed par rnam par gcod par byed pa'i ngo bos yin la /
translated: It is not that it is the cause of the generation of the apprehension of a single thing, but it is the cause of the elimination of the apprehension of a single thing.

original: des na 'dzin bzhin pa ni tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan yin par ni /
analyzed: des na 'dzin bzhin pa ni tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan yin par ni /
translated: Thus, the cause of the conventional is that which is being apprehended,üîΩas is indicated by the following:

original: de mthong ba ni mthong rnams la //
analyzed: de mthong ba ni mthong rnams la //
translated: The seeing of that is seen

original: rig pa'i nus pas byung ba yin //üîΩdran las byung ba 'dod pa las //
analyzed: rig pa'i nus pas byung ba yin // dran las byung ba 'dod pa las //
translated: by the power of awareness.üîΩThe conventional is engaged

original: tha snyad 'jug par 'gyur ba yin //üîΩzhes bya bas bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: tha snyad 'jug par 'gyur ba yin // zhes bya bas bstan pa yin no //
translated: through the assertion that it arises from memory.

original: 'dis ni bdag ces te gcig tu 'dzin par nges pa ni byed pa po dang za ba por 'gyur gyi cig shos ni ma yin no zhes rnam par dbye ba las /
analyzed: 'dis ni bdag ces te gcig tu 'dzin par nges pa ni byed pa po dang za ba por 'gyur gyi cig shos ni ma yin no zhes rnam par dbye ba las /
translated: This indicates that the ascertainment that apprehends the self as a single thing would be the agent and the experiencer, but the other is not.

original: las byas pa yin na byed pa po zhig pa yin la /üîΩbyas pa'i las kyi byed pa po med na 'bras bu ster ba'i phyir ma byas @192a * //
analyzed: las byas pa yin na byed pa po zhig pa yin la / byas pa'i las kyi byed pa po med na 'bras bu ster ba'i phyir ma byas @192a * //
translated: If the action is performed, the agent would disintegrate.üîΩIf the agent of the performed action does not exist, the experiencer of the result of the unperformed action would come to possess the result.

original: pa'i las la za ba po 'bras bu dang ldan pa 'ongs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i skyon bsal ba yin la /
analyzed: pa'i las la za ba po 'bras bu dang ldan pa 'ongs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i skyon bsal ba yin la /
translated: This is the refutation of that error.

original: byas pa'i las la ni 'ga' yang zhig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: byas pa'i las la ni 'ga' yang zhig pa ma yin te /
translated: No action that has been performed is ever destroyed,

original: bdag tu shes pa'i yul sems kyi rgyud mi 'chad pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag tu shes pa'i yul sems kyi rgyud mi 'chad pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the object of the cognition of self is a phenomenon that is not interrupted.

original: gnyid log pa dang brgyal ba la sogs pa'i dus na tshang pa yang skye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gnyid log pa dang brgyal ba la sogs pa'i dus na tshang pa yang skye ba'i phyir /
translated: And because the self is produced again at the time of waking up from sleep or fainting, etc.

original: za ba po'i gzhan nyid ni bdag tu mi byed pa'i yul 'bras bu yin na ni 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: za ba po'i gzhan nyid ni bdag tu mi byed pa'i yul 'bras bu yin na ni 'gyur gyi /
translated: If the self were the effect of an object that is different from the self, then the self would be produced.

original: snga ma dang phyi ma'i sems kyi skad cig dag la ni de yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma'i sems kyi skad cig dag la ni de yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it does not exist in the moments of the earlier and later mind.

original: skad cig ma tha dad pa'i skyon yod do zhe na ni /üîΩgnas skabs tha dad pa yin yang gnas skabs pa ni ma yin no nam mkha' bzhin du byed pa po'am /üîΩza ba po ni gnas skabs kyi sgo nas de nyid byed pa ni ma yin la /
analyzed: skad cig ma tha dad pa'i skyon yod do zhe na ni / gnas skabs tha dad pa yin yang gnas skabs pa ni ma yin no nam mkha' bzhin du byed pa po'am / za ba po ni gnas skabs kyi sgo nas de nyid byed pa ni ma yin la /
translated: If you say that there is the fault of the difference of moment,üîΩthen, although there is a difference of state, there is no difference of the person, just as space is not a creator or an experiencer because of the difference of state.üîΩThe person is not the creator or the experiencer because of the difference of state.

original: byed pa po dang za ba po nyid dag skyes bu'i gnas skabs la brten pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: byed pa po dang za ba po nyid dag skyes bu'i gnas skabs la brten pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The person is not the creator or the experiencer that is based on the states of the person.

original: de'i gnas skabs dang ldan pa de nyid kyi phyir byed pa po kho na 'bras bu thob pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i gnas skabs dang ldan pa de nyid kyi phyir byed pa po kho na 'bras bu thob pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if the agent is the one who possesses that state, then the agent alone obtains the result.

original: 'di la gnas skabs tha dad pa'i rjes su byed pa'i 'bras bu ni gnas skabs can las 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di la gnas skabs tha dad pa'i rjes su byed pa'i 'bras bu ni gnas skabs can las 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: The result that is produced by the state is not produced by the one who possesses the state, because the result is not different from the state.

original: gzhan du na nam mkha' las kyang 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du na nam mkha' las kyang 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Otherwise, it would follow that the result would be produced from space.

original: de'i gnas skabs yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i gnas skabs yin no zhe na /
translated: But if the state is the one who possesses the state,

original: khyad par med na nam mkha' las kyang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyad par med na nam mkha' las kyang 'gyur ro //
translated: then if there is no difference, it would follow that the result would be produced from space.

original: de dang gcig par tha snyad 'dogs pa'i rgyu mtshan ni gnas skabs can yin gyi nam mkha' ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de dang gcig par tha snyad 'dogs pa'i rgyu mtshan ni gnas skabs can yin gyi nam mkha' ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: The reason for designating the state and the one who possesses the state as the same is that the one who possesses the state is the state, but space is not.

original: bden mod kyi de gcig tu 'dzin pa kho na de mi byed par rnam par gcod pa'i rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir ji ltar byed pa po nyid yin /
analyzed: bden mod kyi de gcig tu 'dzin pa kho na de mi byed par rnam par gcod pa'i rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir ji ltar byed pa po nyid yin /
translated: That is true, but if the one who possesses the state is not the agent because it does not perform the action of obtaining the result, then how can it be the agent?

original: de gcig tu tha snyad 'dogs pa grub pa la gnas skabs can ni grub pa la nye bar gnas pa yin na /
analyzed: de gcig tu tha snyad 'dogs pa grub pa la gnas skabs can ni grub pa la nye bar gnas pa yin na /
translated: If the one who possesses the state is the agent, then the one who possesses the state is established as the agent.

original: dgos pa med pa ci'i phyir skyong ba yin /
analyzed: dgos pa med pa ci'i phyir skyong ba yin /
translated: Why would one maintain that which is purposeless?

original: de'i phyir 'bras bu dang rgyu nyid du ma rgyud gcig tu byas pa zhig par smra ba ni sna tshogs pa nyid ma bor na /üîΩde'i skyon yang ma bor ba gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'bras bu dang rgyu nyid du ma rgyud gcig tu byas pa zhig par smra ba ni sna tshogs pa nyid ma bor na / de'i skyon yang ma bor ba gsal ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the assertion that the effect and the cause are made into one continuum is clear, without abandoning the fault of the diversity.

original: rgyud gzhan gyis byas pa'i 'bras bu de las gzhan pas zos pa yin na /
analyzed: rgyud gzhan gyis byas pa'i 'bras bu de las gzhan pas zos pa yin na /
translated: If the effect produced by another continuum is consumed by another,

original: byas pa zhig pa la sogs par 'gyur gyi de nyid kyi yin na ni zhig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: byas pa zhig pa la sogs par 'gyur gyi de nyid kyi yin na ni zhig pa ma yin no //
translated: then it would be destroyed by the one who produced it, and so on, but if it is the same one, then it is not destroyed.

original: 'bras bu dang rgyu'i rgyun gyi yul la de nyid kyi tha snyad 'di 'jig rten du mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang rgyu'i rgyun gyi yul la de nyid kyi tha snyad 'di 'jig rten du mthong ba yin no //
translated: In the domain of the continuum of the effect and the cause, the convention of the same one is seen in the world.

original: de'i phyir rgyu la sogs pa yod pa las byed pa dang za ba la sogs pa ma nges pa yin par @192b smra ba po ni klan ka btsal bya ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu la sogs pa yod pa las byed pa dang za ba la sogs pa ma nges pa yin par @192b smra ba po ni klan ka btsal bya ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the one who asserts that the agent and the experiencer are not ascertained from the existence of the cause and so on is not to be faulted.

original: de'i phyir / 'jig rten pa rol khas len kyang //
analyzed: de'i phyir / 'jig rten pa rol khas len kyang //
translated: Therefore, although the worldly perspective is accepted,

original: rnam rig tsam nyid bdag smra bas //
analyzed: rnam rig tsam nyid bdag smra bas //
translated: the mere cognition is said to be the self.

original: shes rnams skad cig pa nyid phyir //
analyzed: shes rnams skad cig pa nyid phyir //
translated: Because the cognitions are momentary,

original: byed po za po gzhan nyid 'gyur //
analyzed: byed po za po gzhan nyid 'gyur //
translated: The agent and the experiencer would be different.

original: zhes bya ba ni mi bden pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mi bden pa yin no //
translated: This is not true.

original: gang gi phyir de kho na nyid rig pa po rnams skad cig ma'i dbye ba la dpyod par byed pa yin gyi 'jig rten ni rgyu med pa'i phyir /üîΩrnam par dpyod par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de kho na nyid rig pa po rnams skad cig ma'i dbye ba la dpyod par byed pa yin gyi 'jig rten ni rgyu med pa'i phyir / rnam par dpyod par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Because those who know reality analyze the divisions of moments, but the world does not analyze because it is causeless.

original: stobs dang stobs ma yin pa la sogs pa grub pa'i don du de kho na nyid shes pa rnams /
analyzed: stobs dang stobs ma yin pa la sogs pa grub pa'i don du de kho na nyid shes pa rnams /
translated: Those who know reality for the sake of establishing power, impotence, and so on,

original: rnam par dpyod par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: rnam par dpyod par byed pa yin la /
translated: analyze.

original: 'jig rten ni de mngon sum gyis mthong yang dgos pa med pa'i phyir dang ; 'dra ba gzhan byung ba'i phyir //üîΩdon byed pa don du ni gnyer ba ni 'di'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten ni de mngon sum gyis mthong yang dgos pa med pa'i phyir dang ; 'dra ba gzhan byung ba'i phyir // don byed pa don du ni gnyer ba ni 'di'o //
translated: The world sees it directly, but because there is no need and because another similar one arises,

original: bdag go zhes de ltar nges par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag go zhes de ltar nges par byed pa yin no //
translated: it is for the sake of the purpose of performing an action that it is ascertained as ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du nges pa dang ldan pa yang 'jug pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du nges pa dang ldan pa yang 'jug pa kho na yin no //
translated: In the same way, one who possesses that ascertainment engages.

original: de'i phyir bdag med par smra ba'i phyogs pa ni //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag med par smra ba'i phyogs pa ni //
translated: Therefore, the position of the proponents of selflessness is

original: bdag shi'i 'og tu 'bras bdag gir //
analyzed: bdag shi'i 'og tu 'bras bdag gir //
translated: that after death, the self is not the experiencer of the fruits of action.

original: mi 'gyur na yang gzhan gyir 'gyur //
analyzed: mi 'gyur na yang gzhan gyir 'gyur //
translated: If it does not change, it becomes something else.

original: zhes ni sngar nyid shes pa yin //
analyzed: zhes ni sngar nyid shes pa yin //
translated: This has been known already.

original: de phyir 'jug par mi 'gyur yin //
analyzed: de phyir 'jug par mi 'gyur yin //
translated: Therefore, it does not enter.

original: zhes bya ba ni ngan par smra ba yin te //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ngan par smra ba yin te //
translated: This is a bad statement.üîΩThe Omniscient One, who knows all that is to be known, has no fault whatsoever.

original: rig par bya ba thams cad mkhyen pa ni nyes pa ma lus pa zad pa ni gzhan ni sdug bsngal btsal bar bzhed pa kho nas 'jug pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rig par bya ba thams cad mkhyen pa ni nyes pa ma lus pa zad pa ni gzhan ni sdug bsngal btsal bar bzhed pa kho nas 'jug pa'i phyir /
translated: The other, who is desirous of finding suffering, enters only because he believes in a world beyond.

original: sems 'jig rten pha rol pa yin pa'i phyogs la thams cad kha na ma tho ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: sems 'jig rten pha rol pa yin pa'i phyogs la thams cad kha na ma tho ba med pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, in the position that the mind is a world beyond, there is no fault.

original: sems de nyid kho na 'ba' zhig skye ba'i dang por lus tsam las sam /
analyzed: sems de nyid kho na 'ba' zhig skye ba'i dang por lus tsam las sam /
translated: Only that very mind, which is born first, arises from the body alone,

original: pha'i sems las byung bar mthong ba yin gyi skye ba snga ma'i sems las ma yin zhing /
analyzed: pha'i sems las byung bar mthong ba yin gyi skye ba snga ma'i sems las ma yin zhing /
translated: or from the father‚Äôs mind, but not from the mind of a previous birth.

original: 'chi ba'i sems bzhin du 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i sems gzhan yang ma yin no snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: 'chi ba'i sems bzhin du 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i sems gzhan yang ma yin no snyam du sems pa la /
translated: And it is not another mind that arises like the mind at death.

original: skye ba yongs su len pa na //
analyzed: skye ba yongs su len pa na //
translated: When it takes rebirth,

original: 'byung rngub dbang po blo dag ni //
analyzed: 'byung rngub dbang po blo dag ni //
translated: the breath, the sense faculties, and the mind

original: rang gi rigs la ltos med can //
analyzed: rang gi rigs la ltos med can //
translated: It is not dependent on any other type.üîΩ

original: lus nyid 'ba' zhig las skye min //
analyzed: lus nyid 'ba' zhig las skye min //
translated: It is not produced from the body alone,

original: ha cang thal phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ha cang thal phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: because that is absurd.üîΩThe breath, mind, and sense faculties are also stable, mobile, etc.,

original: dbugs 'byung ba la sogs pa dang sems dang dbang po rnams kyang brtan pa nyid dang / g-yo ba po nyid la sogs pa'i goms pas de lta de lta bur 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: dbugs 'byung ba la sogs pa dang sems dang dbang po rnams kyang brtan pa nyid dang / g-yo ba po nyid la sogs pa'i goms pas de lta de lta bur 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: because they are habituated in that way.

original: dang po skye ba la yang de bzhin de rnams su snang ba yin gyi pha la sogs pa ni de ltar goms pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dang po skye ba la yang de bzhin de rnams su snang ba yin gyi pha la sogs pa ni de ltar goms pa ma yin te /
translated: At first, when they are born, they appear in that way, but fathers, etc., are not habituated in that way,

original: glen pa'i bu yang mkhas par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: glen pa'i bu yang mkhas par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because even the son of a fool is seen to be wise.

original: de'i skye ba 'di la goms pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i skye ba 'di la goms pa yang ma yin no //
translated: They are not habituated in this life either.

original: mes po'i goms pa las byung ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: mes po'i goms pa las byung ba yin no zhe na /
translated: They arise from the habit of their ancestors.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,

original: @193a * // byis pa rang nyid goms pa bzhin du mtshams sbyor ba 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @193a * // byis pa rang nyid goms pa bzhin du mtshams sbyor ba 'gyur ro //
translated: because the connection is like the habit of the child itself.

original: rang gi goms pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi goms pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not a habit of its own.

original: mngal na 'dug pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal mang pos brjed pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngal na 'dug pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal mang pos brjed pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is possible that the many sufferings of being in the womb and so on are forgotten.

original: grub pa'i dngos po ni goms pas phogs byung ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: grub pa'i dngos po ni goms pas phogs byung ba ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt the established entity produced by practice?

original: brtan po dang g-yo ba po yang grub pa yin te /
analyzed: brtan po dang g-yo ba po yang grub pa yin te /
translated: The stable and the moving are also established.

original: goms pa gzhan kho na las bye brag thams cad de las byung ba nyid shes pa'i phyir bye brag med pa'i dngos po tsam ni lus las dang por grub pa yin la /
analyzed: goms pa gzhan kho na las bye brag thams cad de las byung ba nyid shes pa'i phyir bye brag med pa'i dngos po tsam ni lus las dang por grub pa yin la /
translated: Because all differences arise from another practice, the mere entity without difference is first established from the body.

original: goms pas ni khyad par du gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: goms pas ni khyad par du gyur pa yin te /
translated: Through practice, there is a difference.

original: glen pa yang goms pa las mkhas par 'gyur ro zhen /
analyzed: glen pa yang goms pa las mkhas par 'gyur ro zhen /
translated: Even the foolish become wise through practice.

original: ma yin te glen pa rnams kyi ni goms pa dman pa las byung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te glen pa rnams kyi ni goms pa dman pa las byung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because the practice of the foolish arises from inferiority.

original: ji ltar bum pa rdza mkhan las byung ba la med kyang phrang pa las khyad par yin la /
analyzed: ji ltar bum pa rdza mkhan las byung ba la med kyang phrang pa las khyad par yin la /
translated: Just as a pot arises from a potter, even though it does not exist, it is different from a straw mat.

original: de bzhin du lus las byung ba la goms pa las khyad par du 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: de bzhin du lus las byung ba la goms pa las khyad par du 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: In the same way, even though it does not exist in the body, it becomes different through practice.

original: 'on te me dang phrad pa las bum pa gzhan kho na yin na /
analyzed: 'on te me dang phrad pa las bum pa gzhan kho na yin na /
translated: But if the pot is different from the contact with fire,

original: dbang po la sogs pa goms pa las kyang gzhan kho na yin par mtshungs so //
analyzed: dbang po la sogs pa goms pa las kyang gzhan kho na yin par mtshungs so //
translated: then it is the same as the contact with the sense faculty, etc.

original: mtshungs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mtshungs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not the same.

original: me dang phrad pa'i snga rol gyi rdzas mkhan gyi bskyed bya'i bum pa ni gzhan kho nar mthong ba yin la /
analyzed: me dang phrad pa'i snga rol gyi rdzas mkhan gyi bskyed bya'i bum pa ni gzhan kho nar mthong ba yin la /
translated: The pot that is to be produced by the potter prior to the contact with fire is seen to be different.

original: 'di la ni goms pa'i snga rol du de'i bskyed bya ma yin pa ni de'i khyad par ma yin la dngos po tsam ni nye bar dmigs pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di la ni goms pa'i snga rol du de'i bskyed bya ma yin pa ni de'i khyad par ma yin la dngos po tsam ni nye bar dmigs pa yang ma yin no //
translated: But in this case, prior to the contact with the sense faculty, etc., that which is not to be produced by it is not its specific object, and a mere entity is not even observed.

original: rjes su dpog par byed do zhe na /
analyzed: rjes su dpog par byed do zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is inferred,

original: de ltar yin na goms pa kho na mthong ba la rjes su dpog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar yin na goms pa kho na mthong ba la rjes su dpog par 'gyur te /
translated: then in that case, only the contact with the sense faculty, etc. would be inferred in the seeing,

original: ma mthong ba la rjes su dpog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma mthong ba la rjes su dpog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no inference in the nonseeing.

original: autpala'i rtsa ba ni ba lang gi lci ba las skye ba dang / autpala'i rtsa ba las kyang skye bar mthong la /
analyzed: autpala'i rtsa ba ni ba lang gi lci ba las skye ba dang / autpala'i rtsa ba las kyang skye bar mthong la /
translated: The root of the lotus is seen to be produced from cow dung and also from the root of the lotus.

original: de bzhin du lus las skyes pa ni goms pa las kyang 'di skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyir 'di skye ba yin no zhes rjes su dpog par mi rigs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du lus las skyes pa ni goms pa las kyang 'di skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyir 'di skye ba yin no zhes rjes su dpog par mi rigs so //
translated: In the same way, it is not reasonable to infer that this is produced from the body because this is produced from habituation.

original: gang gi phyir ba lang gi lci ba las skye ba'i autpala'i rtsa ba dang / me las du ba ni rgyun gyi 'jug pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ba lang gi lci ba las skye ba'i autpala'i rtsa ba dang / me las du ba ni rgyun gyi 'jug pa yin gyi /
translated: Because the root of the utpala that is produced from cow dung and smoke from fire are the continuation of the stream.

original: 'di la ni skye ba'i dang po la goms pa las ma byung ba'i khyad bar gang yang med do //
analyzed: 'di la ni skye ba'i dang po la goms pa las ma byung ba'i khyad bar gang yang med do //
translated: But there is no difference at all in the first production of this from habituation.üîΩJust as smoke is the product of fire, fire is also the product of smoke.

original: du ba'i bskyed bya'i du ba bzhin du me la yang du ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di la yang goms pa'i bskyed bya'i khyad par bzhin du khyad par yin no zhe na /
analyzed: du ba'i bskyed bya'i du ba bzhin du me la yang du ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di la yang goms pa'i bskyed bya'i khyad par bzhin du khyad par yin no zhe na /
translated: In this case, it is a difference like the difference in the product of habituation.

original: de lta yin na du ba las du ba'i bskyed bya dang 'dra ba'i me rjes su dpog par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: de lta yin na du ba las du ba'i bskyed bya dang 'dra ba'i me rjes su dpog par mi 'gyur la /
translated: If that were the case, fire would not be inferred from smoke, like the product of smoke.

original: de dang 'dra ba las de'i rjes su dpog pa ma nyams @193b pa yin no //
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba las de'i rjes su dpog pa ma nyams @193b pa yin no //
translated: But the non-deficiency of the inference from that is like that.

original: de'i bskyed bya'i yang rtsa ba yang me yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i bskyed bya'i yang rtsa ba yang me yin no zhe na /
translated: The root of that is also fire.

original: 'di la yang goms pa'i bskyed bya'i khyad par 'dra ba'i rtsa ba goms pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di la yang goms pa'i bskyed bya'i khyad par 'dra ba'i rtsa ba goms pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: And in this case, the root of the similarity of the specific effect of the repeated action is the repetition itself.

original: rjes su dpag pa ma nyams pa yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ma nyams pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the inference is not vitiated.

original: goms pa'i bskyed bya'i khyad par ni khyad par gzhan gyi rgyun byed pa yin pa ni me'i bskyed bya'i du ba las du ba gzhan lta bu'o //
analyzed: goms pa'i bskyed bya'i khyad par ni khyad par gzhan gyi rgyun byed pa yin pa ni me'i bskyed bya'i du ba las du ba gzhan lta bu'o //
translated: The specific effect of the repeated action is the production of a different effect, as in the case of the smoke produced from fire, which is different from the smoke produced from cow dung.

original: de'i rgyun 'jug par byed pa tsam goms pa ni ma yin la /
analyzed: de'i rgyun 'jug par byed pa tsam goms pa ni ma yin la /
translated: The repetition is not merely the cause of the continuation of the effect.

original: nur nur po la sogs pa'i lus kyi bskyed bya nyid ni khyad par de ma yin te /
analyzed: nur nur po la sogs pa'i lus kyi bskyed bya nyid ni khyad par de ma yin te /
translated: The body of the embryo, etc. is not the specific effect of the body of the fetus, etc.

original: du ba yang ri bo tsam gyi bskyed byar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: du ba yang ri bo tsam gyi bskyed byar 'gyur ro //
translated: For, if it were, then smoke produced from fire would be the effect of a mountain.

original: ri bo'i bskyed bya nyid yin na /
analyzed: ri bo'i bskyed bya nyid yin na /
translated: If a mountain were the cause of the body of the fetus, etc.

original: thams cad du thams cad la yang 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: thams cad du thams cad la yang 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: then everything would be the cause of everything.

original: 'di la yang 'byung ba'i bskyed bya nyid yin na /
analyzed: 'di la yang 'byung ba'i bskyed bya nyid yin na /
translated: And in this case, if the elements were the cause of the body of the fetus, etc.

original: bong ba la sogs pa la yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bong ba la sogs pa la yang 'gyur ro //
translated: then clods of earth, etc. would also be the cause.

original: bye brag can rnams kyi ni sems pa can yin gyi bong ba la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bye brag can rnams kyi ni sems pa can yin gyi bong ba la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But only sentient beings are the cause of sentient beings, not clods of earth, etc.

original: yongs su gyur pa'i khyad par yang nges par byed pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: yongs su gyur pa'i khyad par yang nges par byed pa yin no zhe na /
translated: and the special transformation of the seed is also ascertained.

original: shi ba la 'di thams cad yod pa'i phyir phal ches pa las thar pa ma yin no //
analyzed: shi ba la 'di thams cad yod pa'i phyir phal ches pa las thar pa ma yin no //
translated: But since all of this exists at death, the seed is not liberated from the majority of its effects.

original: goms pa'i bskyed bya nyid yin yang shi ba la cis mi 'gyur /
analyzed: goms pa'i bskyed bya nyid yin yang shi ba la cis mi 'gyur /
translated: Why does it not occur at death, even though it is produced by cultivation?

original: gnas pa 'phen par byed pa'i las zad pa'i phyir ro zhes 'chad par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gnas pa 'phen par byed pa'i las zad pa'i phyir ro zhes 'chad par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Because the action that projects the life span is exhausted.

original: las kyi nus pa sna tshogs pa nyid bzhin du 'byung ba'i nus pa sna tshogs pa nyid du brtag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: las kyi nus pa sna tshogs pa nyid bzhin du 'byung ba'i nus pa sna tshogs pa nyid du brtag pa ma yin te /
translated: The potency of the elements is not considered to be as varied as the potency of action,

original: 'byung ba rnams ni dpag tu yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba rnams ni dpag tu yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the elements are limited in number.

original: sa nyid la sogs las skye ba 'di'i lus la dbang po la sogs rtag pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: sa nyid la sogs las skye ba 'di'i lus la dbang po la sogs rtag pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If the elements such as earth are the cause of the sense faculties, etc., of this life, they are permanent.

original: ma mthong ba'i nus pa de nyid las yin pa'i phyir log par rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ma mthong ba'i nus pa de nyid las yin pa'i phyir log par rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: But since the potency of the elements is not seen, it is not a mistaken conception.

original: skye ba snga ma'i lus las skye ba 'di'i lus la dbang po la sogs pa ji ltar 'pho ba yin /
analyzed: skye ba snga ma'i lus las skye ba 'di'i lus la dbang po la sogs pa ji ltar 'pho ba yin /
translated: How is it that the sense faculties, etc., of this life are transferred from the body of the previous life?

original: sprul gyi dug gi nus pa 'pho ba kho na bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: sprul gyi dug gi nus pa 'pho ba kho na bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: It should be seen just like the transference of the potency of the poison of a snake.

original: sngags la sogs pa'i stobs kyis dug gzhan du 'pho ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: sngags la sogs pa'i stobs kyis dug gzhan du 'pho ba ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt it that poison is transferred to another place by the power of a mantra, etc.?

original: las kyi stobs kyis 'di la yang dbang po la sogs pa gzhan du 'pho ba yin par mtshungs so //
analyzed: las kyi stobs kyis 'di la yang dbang po la sogs pa gzhan du 'pho ba yin par mtshungs so //
translated: By the power of karma, the transference of the sense faculties, etc., is the same.

original: gang gi tshe dbang po la sogs pa 'pho ba de nyid kyi tshe sems kyang yin te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe dbang po la sogs pa 'pho ba de nyid kyi tshe sems kyang yin te /
translated: When the sense faculties, etc., are transferred, at that time the mind is also.

original: tshogs pa gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshogs pa gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are in the same collection.

original: de'i phyir nur nur po la sogs pa rnams la rnam shes yod ces bya ba 'di yang gya tshom yin par mthun ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir nur nur po la sogs pa rnams la rnam shes yod ces bya ba 'di yang gya tshom yin par mthun ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is also a mere guess to say that the consciousness exists in the kalala, etc.

original: de'i tshe ni dbang po las skyes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe ni dbang po las skyes pa ma yin te /
translated: At that time, it is not born from the sense faculties,

original: rang yod pa'i dus su byung ba ni de las 'byung ba'i phyir ro//
analyzed: rang yod pa'i dus su byung ba ni de las 'byung ba'i phyir ro//
translated: because it arises at the time of its own existence.

original: @194a * // bdag go zhes bya ba byung ba ni dbang po dang bde ba la sogs pa nga rgyal dang bcas pa kho nar mthong la de kho na bzhin du rgyu zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: @194a * // bdag go zhes bya ba byung ba ni dbang po dang bde ba la sogs pa nga rgyal dang bcas pa kho nar mthong la de kho na bzhin du rgyu zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase ‚ÄúI am‚Äù is seen to occur only in relation to the faculties and pleasure, etc., which are accompanied by the conceit ‚ÄúI am.‚Äù The meaning of the phrase ‚Äúin the same way‚Äù is that the self is the cause of the body.

original: rang dbang yod na lus med pa'i phyir nam mkha' bzhin du ji ltar sems kun rgyu ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: rang dbang yod na lus med pa'i phyir nam mkha' bzhin du ji ltar sems kun rgyu ba yin zhe na /
translated: If the self is independent, how can it move the mind, which is like space and has no body?üîΩThe self is dependent on the body, just as a king is dependent on his retinue.

original: rgyal po'i bsnyen bkur bzhin du re ba la gzhan dbang yin pa'i phyir rlung gis bskyod bzhin pa'i me /
analyzed: rgyal po'i bsnyen bkur bzhin du re ba la gzhan dbang yin pa'i phyir rlung gis bskyod bzhin pa'i me /
translated: The self is like a fire that is moved by the wind.

original: gzhan du 'gro ba yod srid kyi //
analyzed: gzhan du 'gro ba yod srid kyi //
translated: It is possible for the fire to move to another place,

original: blo ni rgyur gyur lus nyid las //
analyzed: blo ni rgyur gyur lus nyid las //
translated: but the mind, which is the cause of the body,

original: 'gas kyang skyod par byed pa min //
analyzed: 'gas kyang skyod par byed pa min //
translated: cannot be moved by anything.üîΩThe self does not exist,

original: lus med phyir na 'di rang nyid //
analyzed: lus med phyir na 'di rang nyid //
translated: because it has no body.

original: 'phags nas 'gro ba 'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'phags nas 'gro ba 'ang ma yin no //
translated: It does not move from one place to another.

original: zhes bya ba 'di ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di ma grub pa yin no //
translated: This is not established.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: As it is said:

original: bdag la chags pa dang ldan pa /üîΩsems can gzhan gyis bkri min pa //
analyzed: bdag la chags pa dang ldan pa / sems can gzhan gyis bkri min pa //
translated: Those who are attached to the selfüîΩcannot be led to understandüîΩthat pleasure and pain are obtained and lost

original: bde sdug dor 'thob 'dod pas na //
analyzed: bde sdug dor 'thob 'dod pas na //
translated: through other sentient beings.

original: dman pa'i gnas ni yongs su len //
analyzed: dman pa'i gnas ni yongs su len //
translated: He takes up the lowly state.

original: zhes 'chad par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: zhes 'chad par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: This will be explained.

original: ji ltar yang sad pa'i lus la dbang po la sogs pa rmi lam rmi ba'i lus la kun du rgyu bar mthong ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji ltar yang sad pa'i lus la dbang po la sogs pa rmi lam rmi ba'i lus la kun du rgyu bar mthong ba lta bu'o //
translated: Just as in the waking state, the sense faculties, etc., of the body are seen to move about in the body of one who is dreaming.

original: de las kyang sad pa'i lus la'o //
analyzed: de las kyang sad pa'i lus la'o //
translated: And from that, in the body of the waking state.

original: de bzhin du skye ba snga ma'i lus las srid pa bar ma do'i lus la'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du skye ba snga ma'i lus las srid pa bar ma do'i lus la'o //
translated: In the same way, from the body of the previous birth, in the body of the intermediate state.üîΩAnd from that, in this body.

original: de las kyang lus 'di la yin pa'i phyir gnod par byed pa la lan gdab par dka' ba cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: de las kyang lus 'di la yin pa'i phyir gnod par byed pa la lan gdab par dka' ba cung zad kyang med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no difficulty in retaliating against the one who does harm.

original: de ni rmi lam rmi ba'i lus la ni mi bden pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de ni rmi lam rmi ba'i lus la ni mi bden pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But the body in a dream is not real!

original: ma yin te so sor snang ba la mi bden pa nyid du mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te so sor snang ba la mi bden pa nyid du mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because unreality is not possible in the individual appearances.

original: phyi rol gyi mi bden pa nyid ni sad pa la yang mtshungs so //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi mi bden pa nyid ni sad pa la yang mtshungs so //
translated: The unreality of the external is the same in the waking state.

original: gnod pa can med pa ci las yin zhe na /
analyzed: gnod pa can med pa ci las yin zhe na /
translated: But how can there be no harm-doer?

original: gnod pa zhes bya ba yang so sor snang ba tsam nyid du nges pa phyi rol ma yin pa'i so sor snang ba'i rgyu mtshan du brjod pa la /
analyzed: gnod pa zhes bya ba yang so sor snang ba tsam nyid du nges pa phyi rol ma yin pa'i so sor snang ba'i rgyu mtshan du brjod pa la /
translated: Also, what is called ‚Äúharm‚Äù is ascertained as merely individual appearances.

original: phyi rol tu zhen pa'i gnod pa nyid ni bag chags brtan po nyid dang / brtan po ma yin pa nyid bdag gis kha cig tu 'byung la /
analyzed: phyi rol tu zhen pa'i gnod pa nyid ni bag chags brtan po nyid dang / brtan po ma yin pa nyid bdag gis kha cig tu 'byung la /
translated: The harm of clinging to external objects is the stability or instability of latent tendencies.

original: gzhan la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rnam par dbye ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhan la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rnam par dbye ba yin no //
translated: The difference is that sometimes they arise for some and not for others.

original: de'i phyir dang por skyes pa la dbang po la sogs pa ni skye ba snga ma'i lus las 'ongs pa yin na /
analyzed: de'i phyir dang por skyes pa la dbang po la sogs pa ni skye ba snga ma'i lus las 'ongs pa yin na /
translated: Therefore, if the sense faculties and so on of one who has just been born come from the body of a previous life,üîΩhow do they come?

original: ji ltar 'ongs pa yin zhes bya ba ltos pa la ma mthong ba'i rtog pa la ni tshad ma med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar 'ongs pa yin zhes bya ba ltos pa la ma mthong ba'i rtog pa la ni tshad ma med pa'i phyir /
translated: Since there is no valid knowledge for the conception of one who does not see dependence,

original: mthong ba'i rmi lam rmi ba'i lus bzhin du srid pa bar ma do'i lus las zhes smra ba na /
analyzed: mthong ba'i rmi lam rmi ba'i lus bzhin du srid pa bar ma do'i lus las zhes smra ba na /
translated: it is said that the body of the intermediate existence comes from the body of a dream that is seen.

original: snyan dngags mkhan gyis byas pa'i lus la rtsom pa dang 'jig pa'i rgyu med na /
analyzed: snyan dngags mkhan gyis byas pa'i lus la rtsom pa dang 'jig pa'i rgyu med na /
translated: If the body created by a poet has no cause of composition and destruction,

original: ji ltar skye ba 'am 'jig pa yin zhing ji ltar yang ma mthong ba yin zhes bya ba'i @194b rgol ba 'di ci las yin /
analyzed: ji ltar skye ba 'am 'jig pa yin zhing ji ltar yang ma mthong ba yin zhes bya ba'i @194b rgol ba 'di ci las yin /
translated: What is the point of this objection: ‚ÄúHow can it be produced or destroyed, and how can it not be seen?‚Äù

original: bab chol du skye zhing de yang bab cho la kho nar 'jig pa yin la /
analyzed: bab chol du skye zhing de yang bab cho la kho nar 'jig pa yin la /
translated: It is produced by chance and destroyed by chance.

original: phra ba'i ngo bo la sogs pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba de ni nye bar rtog pa tsam nyid /
analyzed: phra ba'i ngo bo la sogs pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba de ni nye bar rtog pa tsam nyid /
translated: The statement ‚Äúit has a subtle nature, etc.‚Äù is mere speculation.

original: shes pa'i rgyu ba yod pa yang //
analyzed: shes pa'i rgyu ba yod pa yang //
translated: The activity of consciousness exists.

original: de la tshad ma can min 'gyur //
analyzed: de la tshad ma can min 'gyur //
translated: It would not be a valid cognition.

original: de yi lus gzhan rnams la ni //
analyzed: de yi lus gzhan rnams la ni //
translated: In the case of other bodies,

original: slar yang rnam g-yeng rtog pa yin //
analyzed: slar yang rnam g-yeng rtog pa yin //
translated: it is again a conceptual distraction.

original: zhes bya ba de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba de ni mi rigs te /
translated: This is unreasonable.

original: 'di 'dra ba nyid ni rmi lam gyis lus la yang mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di 'dra ba nyid ni rmi lam gyis lus la yang mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because this is seen in the body in a dream.

original: sbyor ba dang / dngos gzhi dang / rjes kyi rnams la shes pa gzhan dang gzhan ma yin nam /
analyzed: sbyor ba dang / dngos gzhi dang / rjes kyi rnams la shes pa gzhan dang gzhan ma yin nam /
translated: In the preparation, the actual basis, and the conclusion, are there not different consciousnesses?

original: de la yang gnas par 'dod pa gcig med na 'bras bu 'byung ba ni rigs kyi rtog pa lta bu yin te /
analyzed: de la yang gnas par 'dod pa gcig med na 'bras bu 'byung ba ni rigs kyi rtog pa lta bu yin te /
translated: And if one of them does not exist, it is reasonable that the result arises, like a conceptual thought.

original: bu dang tsha bo la sogs pa 'gyur bar bya ba'i rigs dang 'dra ba'i byed pa po nyid kho na sgrub par dka' ba yin te /
analyzed: bu dang tsha bo la sogs pa 'gyur bar bya ba'i rigs dang 'dra ba'i byed pa po nyid kho na sgrub par dka' ba yin te /
translated: The agent is just like a son or grandson who is to be made to do something.

original: dus yun ring por las rnams la skye bar 'dod pa'i shes pa stong phrag rnams la de ni rigs dang 'dra ba lta bu yin no //
analyzed: dus yun ring por las rnams la skye bar 'dod pa'i shes pa stong phrag rnams la de ni rigs dang 'dra ba lta bu yin no //
translated: For a long time, the thousands of cognitions that desire to arise in regard to objects are like a son or grandson.

original: 'di la smras pa'i rigs dang 'dra ba bzhin du nyin gcig gi shes pa'i yul nyid kyis dbye ba mi rtogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di la smras pa'i rigs dang 'dra ba bzhin du nyin gcig gi shes pa'i yul nyid kyis dbye ba mi rtogs pa'i phyir /
translated: Here, the response is that just like a son or grandson, the object of a single day‚Äôs cognition is not understood through differentiation.

original: dka' ba nyid yin pas dam pa'i don la nges par rtogs pa yang 'bras bu nyid shes pa mi dgos pa'i phyir dang 'bras bu nyid kyi shes pa 'jig rten ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dka' ba nyid yin pas dam pa'i don la nges par rtogs pa yang 'bras bu nyid shes pa mi dgos pa'i phyir dang 'bras bu nyid kyi shes pa 'jig rten ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Since it is difficult, the ascertainment of the ultimate is also the result. There is no need for the cognition of the result itself, because the cognition of the result itself is mundane.

original: mthong ba yang rim gyis 'byung ba dus gcig la ma tshogs pa dar sha dang po 'u rna m'a sa la sogs pa'i yi ge rnams sam /
analyzed: mthong ba yang rim gyis 'byung ba dus gcig la ma tshogs pa dar sha dang po 'u rna m'a sa la sogs pa'i yi ge rnams sam /
translated: Also, seeing arises gradually, not simultaneously. The letters da, ra, ≈õa, and so on are not simultaneously assembled in the first moment of seeing the word dar≈õana.

original: bsgor ba'i cha shas la sogs pa'i rang gi dus tsam la yod pa rnams /
analyzed: bsgor ba'i cha shas la sogs pa'i rang gi dus tsam la yod pa rnams /
translated: Those that exist at the time of their own parts and so on are called momentary.üîΩ

original: don gcig tu byed pa'i byed pa po nyid mthong ba yin gyi /
analyzed: don gcig tu byed pa'i byed pa po nyid mthong ba yin gyi /
translated: The parts of the wheel and so on that exist at the time of the wheel itself are seen to be the very agent that unifies the single object.

original: rigs dang 'dra ba lta bu rtogs pa ni ma yin no //üîΩde bzhin du dbang po la sogs pa rnams 'jig rten pha rol nyid du brjod pa ni /
analyzed: rigs dang 'dra ba lta bu rtogs pa ni ma yin no // de bzhin du dbang po la sogs pa rnams 'jig rten pha rol nyid du brjod pa ni /
translated: But it is not that they are realized to be similar to a class.

original: sems 'jig rten pha rol po nyid yin pa'i dpe don nam /
analyzed: sems 'jig rten pha rol po nyid yin pa'i dpe don nam /
translated: Likewise, the statement that the sense faculties and so on are the world beyond is an analogy for the mind being the world beyond.

original: bdag tu byed pa'i sems 'jig rten pha rol po'i yul bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag tu byed pa'i sems 'jig rten pha rol po'i yul bstan pa yin no //
translated: Or it is a teaching that the mind that acts as the self is the object of the world beyond.

original: gang gi tshe ri mo dang glur blang bar bya ba la sogs pa bzhin du dbang po'i shes pa yang goms pa'i bskyed bya ni de'i bskyed bya'i khyad par yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi tshe ri mo dang glur blang bar bya ba la sogs pa bzhin du dbang po'i shes pa yang goms pa'i bskyed bya ni de'i bskyed bya'i khyad par yin pa'i phyir /
translated: When the sense consciousnesses are also produced by habituation, like paintings and songs, they are the specific product of that.

original: 'jig rten pha rol por brjod pa de'i tshe yang /
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol por brjod pa de'i tshe yang /
translated: Therefore, they are said to be the world beyond.

original: goms pa las byung ba'i rjes su 'jug pa can gyi dbang po yin gyi /
analyzed: goms pa las byung ba'i rjes su 'jug pa can gyi dbang po yin gyi /
translated: At that time, the sense faculties are engaged in what arises from habituation.

original: de med na de bzhin du 'byung ba yang ri mo la sogs pa'i shes par 'gyur ba ma yin no //üîΩji ltar @195a * //üîΩdbang po de'i ngo bo ma yin pa'i 'byung ba tsam las kyang 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: de med na de bzhin du 'byung ba yang ri mo la sogs pa'i shes par 'gyur ba ma yin no // ji ltar @195a * // dbang po de'i ngo bo ma yin pa'i 'byung ba tsam las kyang 'byung ba yin te /
translated: It is not the mere elements, which are not of the nature of sense-faculty, that are the cause of the arising of the consciousness.üîΩThe sense-faculties, nose, tongue, eye, skin and ear, are derived from the elements, because of the statement of function.üîΩAnd, because of the statement of function, the sense-faculty is the cause of the arising of the consciousness.üîΩThe sense-faculty is not the cause of the arising of the consciousness, because of the statement of function.

original: sna dang lce dang mig dang bags pa dang rnab la sogs pa dbang pa rnams ni 'byung ba rnams las bya ba'i tshig las so //üîΩgoms pas kyang khyad par du byed pa la de bzhin du sems pa yang 'gyur ro snyam du dogs pa bzlog pa'i don du dbang po ni 'jig rten pha rol nyid du mngon par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: sna dang lce dang mig dang bags pa dang rnab la sogs pa dbang pa rnams ni 'byung ba rnams las bya ba'i tshig las so // goms pas kyang khyad par du byed pa la de bzhin du sems pa yang 'gyur ro snyam du dogs pa bzlog pa'i don du dbang po ni 'jig rten pha rol nyid du mngon par brjod pa yin no //
translated: The sense-faculty is not the cause of the arising of the consciousness, because of the statement of function.üîΩThe sense-faculty is not the cause of the arising of the consciousness, because of the statement of function.üîΩThe sense-faculty is not the cause of the arising of the consciousness, because of the statement of function.üîΩThe sense-faculty is not the cause of the arising of the consciousness, because of the statement of function.üîΩThe sense-faculty is not the cause of the arising of the consciousness, because of the statement of function.üîΩThe sense-faculty is not the cause of the arising of the consciousness, because of the statement of function.üîΩThe sense-faculty is not the cause of the arising of the consciousness, because of the statement of function.üîΩThe sense-faculty is not the cause of the arising of the consciousness, because of the statement of function.üîΩThe sense-faculty is not the cause of the arising of the consciousness, because of the statement of function.üîΩThe sense-faculty is not the cause of the arising of the consciousness, because of the statement of function.üîΩThe sense-faculty is not the cause of the arising of the consciousness, because of the statement of function.üîΩThe sense-faculty is not the cause of the arising of the consciousness, because of the statement of function.üîΩThe sense-faculty is not the cause of the arising of the consciousness, because of the statement of function.üîΩThe sense-faculty is not the cause of the arising of the consciousness, because of the statement of function.

original: dbang po 'jig rten pha rol pa ma yin zhing 'byung ba'i bskyed bya yang ma yin du zin kyang gang gis dper mi 'gyur /
analyzed: dbang po 'jig rten pha rol pa ma yin zhing 'byung ba'i bskyed bya yang ma yin du zin kyang gang gis dper mi 'gyur /
translated: The sense-faculty is not the cause of the arising of the consciousness, because of the statement of function.üîΩThe sense-faculty is not the cause of the arising of the consciousness, because of

original: 'on kyang ji skad bstan pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes par 'gyur ba'i 'gyur ba can yin pa'i phyir de'i bskyed bya yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang ji skad bstan pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes par 'gyur ba'i 'gyur ba can yin pa'i phyir de'i bskyed bya yin no //
translated: But it is the product of the mind consciousness as taught, because it is the transformation of that.

original: de ltar na sems ni de 'dra ba'i sems goms pa'i bskyed bya yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na sems ni de 'dra ba'i sems goms pa'i bskyed bya yin te /
translated: Thus the mind is the product of the mind that is habituated to that.

original: de'i khyad par gyi khyad par can yin pa'i phyir dbang po lta bu'o //
analyzed: de'i khyad par gyi khyad par can yin pa'i phyir dbang po lta bu'o //
translated: It is like a sense faculty, because it is the special cause of that.üîΩTherefore, it is the refutation of those who deny the existence of other worlds.

original: de'i phyir 'jig rten pha rol la skur ba 'debs pa la gnod pa yin no / yang na dbang po'i rgyu nyid kyis nur nur po la sogs pa la'am /üîΩskye ba snga ma'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa yin par rtogs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig rten pha rol la skur ba 'debs pa la gnod pa yin no / yang na dbang po'i rgyu nyid kyis nur nur po la sogs pa la'am / skye ba snga ma'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa yin par rtogs pa yin gyi /
translated: Or, it is understood that the embryonic body of kalala, etc., is the cause of the sense faculties,üîΩbut it is not the cause of the mind consciousness of the previous birth.

original: 'byung ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'byung ba ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the cause of the mind consciousness of the previous birth,üîΩbecause it is not seen.

original: ma mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i dgongs pas 'chad par 'gyur ba ni //
analyzed: ma mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i dgongs pas 'chad par 'gyur ba ni //
translated: The meaning of this is explained in the following verse:

original: 'di 'gyur na ni de dag kyang //
analyzed: 'di 'gyur na ni de dag kyang //
translated: If it transforms, then that

original: 'gyur bdag tu mthong ba yin //
analyzed: 'gyur bdag tu mthong ba yin //
translated: would be seen as the self.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i 'gyur bas 'gyur bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i 'gyur bas 'gyur bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is the transformation of the mind consciousness, it is the object of the mind consciousness.

original: de'i 'bras bu dbang po rnams yin la /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu dbang po rnams yin la /
translated: The result of that is the faculties.

original: de kho nar rtogs par byed pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de kho nar rtogs par byed pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is the cause of the realization of reality.

original: bdag ces bya ba'i blo ni de'i bskyed bya rnam shes kyis rtogs pa'i dbang po rnams su nges par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: bdag ces bya ba'i blo ni de'i bskyed bya rnam shes kyis rtogs pa'i dbang po rnams su nges par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: The cognition called ‚Äúself‚Äù is the cause of the consciousness that is its effect, and it is the cause of the faculties that are its effect.

original: ma rtogs pa ni ma yin nam /
analyzed: ma rtogs pa ni ma yin nam /
translated: But is it not the case that the self is not realized by the faculties?

original: ma mthong ba'i sngon po la 'di sngon po'o zhes nges pa ni ma yin no ;üîΩ/'on te dbang po las skyes pa'i shes pa rnams la bdag go zhes nges par byed pa de lta na yang rim gyis dbang po bskyed bya nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //üîΩ'on te yid kyi rnam par shes tsam ni nye bar rtogs pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa can yin na /
analyzed: ma mthong ba'i sngon po la 'di sngon po'o zhes nges pa ni ma yin no ; /'on te dbang po las skyes pa'i shes pa rnams la bdag go zhes nges par byed pa de lta na yang rim gyis dbang po bskyed bya nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro // 'on te yid kyi rnam par shes tsam ni nye bar rtogs pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa can yin na /
translated: One does not ascertain that a blue object is blue before seeing it.üîΩBut if the self is ascertained by the consciousnesses that arise from the faculties, then it follows that the faculties are the self‚Äôs effect.üîΩBut if the self is ascertained by the mental consciousness alone, which has the aspect of ascertainment, then the self is the mental consciousness‚Äôs cause.

original: de yang ji ltar dbang pos mthong ba'i rjes su 'brang ba ni rim gyis dbang po las skye ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: de yang ji ltar dbang pos mthong ba'i rjes su 'brang ba ni rim gyis dbang po las skye ba kho na yin no //
translated: But if the mental consciousness is the self, then it follows that the self is the effect of the faculties, because the mental consciousness arises in dependence on the faculties, just as it does in dependence on the immediately preceding condition.

original: 'on te bdag ces bya ba'i shes pa bdag nyid kho nar nges par byed pa yin gyi dbang po dang de'i bskyed bya'i shes pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on te bdag ces bya ba'i shes pa bdag nyid kho nar nges par byed pa yin gyi dbang po dang de'i bskyed bya'i shes pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Or else, the cognition called ‚Äúself‚Äù is ascertained as just itself, and it is not the sense faculty or the cognition produced by it.

original: ji skad du ma bor pa'i bdag nyid la 'dir 'gyur gyi gzhan la ni ma yin no zhes smos pa ni /
analyzed: ji skad du ma bor pa'i bdag nyid la 'dir 'gyur gyi gzhan la ni ma yin no zhes smos pa ni /
translated: As it is said, ‚ÄúHere it is in the nature of not being lost, but not in another.‚Äù

original: bdag nyid la son pa'i @195b bdag la yod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdag nyid la son pa'i @195b bdag la yod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it exists in the self that has arrived at itself.

original: gzhan yang 'dir dbang po'i shes pa bstan pa ni ka ba'i rig pa po yin gyi gzhan gyi ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'dir dbang po'i shes pa bstan pa ni ka ba'i rig pa po yin gyi gzhan gyi ni ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, here the cognition of the sense faculty is the knower of the pillar, but not of another.

original: mngon sum dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it contradicts direct perception.

original: dbang po las skyes pa de yang de'i 'og tu bdag go zhes 'byung ba yin la /
analyzed: dbang po las skyes pa de yang de'i 'og tu bdag go zhes 'byung ba yin la /
translated: That which is produced from the sense faculty is subsequently called ‚Äúself.‚Äù

original: de'i rang rig pa'i bya ba'i rjes su 'brang ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i rang rig pa'i bya ba'i rjes su 'brang ba yin no //
translated: It follows the action of self-awareness.

original: de ltar yang /üîΩgcig dmigs pa ni nyams myong las //
analyzed: de ltar yang / gcig dmigs pa ni nyams myong las //
translated: As it is said:üîΩThe experience of one thing is not

original: 'di zhes nyams su myong ba min //üîΩzhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes nyams su myong ba min //üîΩzhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThis is experienced.‚Äù

original: dmigs pa nyams su myong ba ni bdag nyid kyis rtogs pa la de bzhin du nges pa'i yul yin gyi /
analyzed: dmigs pa nyams su myong ba ni bdag nyid kyis rtogs pa la de bzhin du nges pa'i yul yin gyi /
translated: The experience of the object is the object that is ascertained as just that by oneself.

original: rang gi bdag nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid ni ma yin te /
