translated: But it is not one‚Äôs own nature,

original: de la rtog pa med pa'i phyir dang / phyi rol la yang rnam par rtog pa'i phyir dang / bdag ni sngon po shes pa yin no zhes rig pa dang gzhi mthun pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de la rtog pa med pa'i phyir dang / phyi rol la yang rnam par rtog pa'i phyir dang / bdag ni sngon po shes pa yin no zhes rig pa dang gzhi mthun pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is not conceptual, because it is conceptual with regard to external objects, and because it is the common locus of the cognition ‚ÄúI am the cognition of blue‚Äù and the cognition of blue.

original: gzhan rig par byed pa ni bya ba yin la de'i byed pa po ni rkyen gyi brjod bya bdag go zhes bya ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan rig par byed pa ni bya ba yin la de'i byed pa po ni rkyen gyi brjod bya bdag go zhes bya ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the object of the expression ‚ÄúI‚Äù is the agent of the action of the cognition of another,

original: sngon po rig pa kho na de la byed pa po yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin la /
analyzed: sngon po rig pa kho na de la byed pa po yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin la /
translated: then the agent of the cognition of blue is just that, and not another.

original: de'i yang nyams su myong ba yin na sngon por shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i yang nyams su myong ba yin na sngon por shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: And if that is experienced, it becomes the cognition of blue.

original: de'i phyir de ni de la byed pa po nyid kyi bdag go zhes 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni de la byed pa po nyid kyi bdag go zhes 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, that is the self that is the agent in that.

original: de'i phyir yang ji ltar yid kyi rnam shes goms pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'i khyad par can dbang po'i bskyed bya yin gyi rang gi rigs kyi bskyed bya ni ma yin no ;
analyzed: de'i phyir yang ji ltar yid kyi rnam shes goms pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'i khyad par can dbang po'i bskyed bya yin gyi rang gi rigs kyi bskyed bya ni ma yin no ;
translated: Therefore, just as the special sense faculty that is the effect of mental consciousness is the effect of mental consciousness, it is not the effect of its own type.

original: / de bzhin du de'i rjes su 'brang ba'i khyad par can gyi dbang po yang 'byung ba'i bskyed bya yin gyi /
analyzed: / de bzhin du de'i rjes su 'brang ba'i khyad par can gyi dbang po yang 'byung ba'i bskyed bya yin gyi /
translated: Similarly, the special sense faculty that is the effect of mental consciousness is the effect of the primary elements,

original: dbang po gzhan gyi bskyed byar 'gyur ba ni ma yin la /
analyzed: dbang po gzhan gyi bskyed byar 'gyur ba ni ma yin la /
translated: but it is not the effect of other sense faculties.

original: dbang po rnams yid kyi bskyed bya nyid yin pas kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang po rnams yid kyi bskyed bya nyid yin pas kyang ma yin no //
translated: And it is not the effect of mental faculty because the sense faculties are the effect of mental consciousness.

original: de rnams las de'i shes pa yin pa las bdag gzhan dbang po grub pa yin no snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: de rnams las de'i shes pa yin pa las bdag gzhan dbang po grub pa yin no snyam du sems pa la /
translated: If you think that the mental faculty is established as other than the sense faculties because it is the consciousness of those sense faculties,üîΩthen it is said:

original: dbang rnams re re la gnod kyang //
analyzed: dbang rnams re re la gnod kyang //
translated: Even if each sense faculty is impaired,

original: yid blo la gnod yod ma yin //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: yid blo la gnod yod ma yin //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
translated: the mental faculty is not impaired.

original: dbang po rnams ni yid kyi bskyed bya nyid du bsgrub pas 'di 'gyur na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas skye ba phyi ma la sgrub byed gzhan bstan pa yin no //üîΩre re la zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gong du bstan pa'i sgrub byed la goms pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'i khyad par nyid /
analyzed: dbang po rnams ni yid kyi bskyed bya nyid du bsgrub pas 'di 'gyur na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas skye ba phyi ma la sgrub byed gzhan bstan pa yin no // re re la zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gong du bstan pa'i sgrub byed la goms pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'i khyad par nyid /
translated: Since the faculties are established as being produced by the mind, the phrase ‚Äúif this changes‚Äù and so on indicates another proof for the next birth.

original: rang gi rigs sgrub pa la ma nges pa yin par dogs pa bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: rang gi rigs sgrub pa la ma nges pa yin par dogs pa bsal ba yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúeach of these‚Äù and so on clarifies the uncertainty of the proof of one‚Äôs own kind, which is a special consequence of the proof taught above.

original: de ltar thos pa dang bsam pa la sogs pa'i shes pa dpyod pa dang sel ba dang nye bar rtogs pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo rnam pa du @196a * //üîΩma yid tsam las byung ba ni dbang po'i bya ba ma lus pa bsdus pa las yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar thos pa dang bsam pa la sogs pa'i shes pa dpyod pa dang sel ba dang nye bar rtogs pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo rnam pa du @196a * // ma yid tsam las byung ba ni dbang po'i bya ba ma lus pa bsdus pa las yin gyi /
translated: Thus, the many forms of knowledge, such as hearing, reflection, and so on, which have the nature of analysis, exclusion, and comprehension, and so on, arise from the mind alone.üîΩThey are not due to the inclusion of the activity of the sense faculties.

original: bya ba byed pa'i dbang po dang ldan pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bya ba byed pa'i dbang po dang ldan pa ni ma yin no //
translated: They are not due to possessing faculties that perform their own function.

original: yid kyi rgyal srid byed pa ni dbang po'i bya ba la mi gnod pa ma yin te //
analyzed: yid kyi rgyal srid byed pa ni dbang po'i bya ba la mi gnod pa ma yin te //
translated: The performance of the mental kingdom does not harm the activity of the sense faculties.

original: ji skad du mig gnyis btsums nas re zhig soms dang zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: ji skad du mig gnyis btsums nas re zhig soms dang zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: As it is said, Close your eyes and think for a while.

original: gang yang gang gi bya ba phul du byung ba yin na 'grib par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gang yang gang gi bya ba phul du byung ba yin na 'grib par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Moreover, if the activity of something is preeminent, it is diminished.

original: de'i 'bras bu ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not its effect,

original: tsha ba dang bska ba la sogs pa'i nye bar sbyor bas bad kan lta bu'o //
analyzed: tsha ba dang bska ba la sogs pa'i nye bar sbyor bas bad kan lta bu'o //
translated: just as phlegm is diminished by the application of heat, astringents, and so on.

original: 'grib par 'gyur ba yang dbang po'i bya ba phul du byung ba yin na /
analyzed: 'grib par 'gyur ba yang dbang po'i bya ba phul du byung ba yin na /
translated: If the activity of the sense faculties is preeminent,

original: yid kyis shes pa bdag gir byed pa dang bcas pa yang /üîΩrang rig pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid kyis shes pa bdag gir byed pa dang bcas pa yang / rang rig pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then mental consciousness, which is associated with self-awareness,üîΩis also diminished.

original: de nyid kyi phyir yid kyi blo bdag ces bya ba de lta bu'i bdag nyid kyi rtog pa'i ngo bo zhes bshad pa la 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir yid kyi blo bdag ces bya ba de lta bu'i bdag nyid kyi rtog pa'i ngo bo zhes bshad pa la 'gal ba med do //
translated: For this very reason, there is no contradiction in explaining that the mind of the mental faculty, which is called the self, is the nature of the conception of such a self.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: nga rgyal dang bcas yid yin na /
analyzed: nga rgyal dang bcas yid yin na /
translated: If the mind is associated with pride,

original: skye ba'i rgyun ni zhi mi 'gyur //üîΩzhes smos pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba'i rgyun ni zhi mi 'gyur // zhes smos pa'o //
translated: The stream of birth will not be pacified.

original: gzhan yang yid kyi rnam par shes pa la brten pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
analyzed: gzhan yang yid kyi rnam par shes pa la brten pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
translated: Moreover, it is said that the mental faculty is based on the mental consciousness, and so on.

original: dbang po rnams ni yid kyi bskyed bya yin pa nyid kyis de'i thabs ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: dbang po rnams ni yid kyi bskyed bya yin pa nyid kyis de'i thabs ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: The faculties are not the means of generating the mental faculty, because they are generated by the mental faculty.

original: sgrub pa gzhan gyi yul nyid brjod pa yin no //üîΩyang na re zhig yid kyi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas yid kyi goms pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'i khyad par ni dbang po las skyes pa ma yin pa nyid du brjod pa yin na /
analyzed: sgrub pa gzhan gyi yul nyid brjod pa yin no // yang na re zhig yid kyi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas yid kyi goms pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'i khyad par ni dbang po las skyes pa ma yin pa nyid du brjod pa yin na /
translated: Thus the mental faculty is the object of another means of knowledge.üîΩOr, if the mental faculty is the means of generating the mental faculty, then the mental faculty is not generated by the mental faculty, because it is not tenable that the mental faculty is the object of the mental faculty.üîΩOr, if the mental faculty is the means of generating the mental faculty, then the mental faculty is not generated by the mental faculty, because it is not tenable that the mental faculty is the object of the mental faculty.üîΩOr, if the mental faculty is the means of generating the mental faculty, then the mental faculty is not generated by the mental faculty, because it is not tenable that the mental faculty is the object of the mental faculty.

original: dbang po rnams rang gi rigs kyi rjes su dpag pa la ma nges pa nyid du lan bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: dbang po rnams rang gi rigs kyi rjes su dpag pa la ma nges pa nyid du lan bstan pa yin no //
translated: Or, if the mental faculty is the means of generating the mental faculty, then the mental faculty is not generated by the mental faculty, because it is not tenable that the mental faculty is the object of the mental faculty.

original: bdag blo de ltar yin gzhan ni //üîΩde rig pa yi 'gro ba shes /
analyzed: bdag blo de ltar yin gzhan ni // de rig pa yi 'gro ba shes /
translated: Or, if the mental faculty is the means of generating the mental faculty, then the mental faculty is not generated by the mental faculty, because it is not tenable that the mental faculty is the object of the mental faculty.

original: 'di de bzhin du yin nam min //üîΩde la bdag 'dra ga la dbang //üîΩbyed pa po dang za ba'i zhes pa ni sems pa'i ngo bo las byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di de bzhin du yin nam min // de la bdag 'dra ga la dbang // byed pa po dang za ba'i zhes pa ni sems pa'i ngo bo las byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Or, if the mental faculty is the means of generating the mental faculty, then the mental faculty is not generated by the mental faculty, because it is not tenable that the mental faculty is the object of the mental faculty.üîΩOr, if the mental faculty is the means of generating the mental faculty, then the mental faculty is not generated by the mental faculty, because it is not tenable that the mental faculty is the object of the mental faculty.üîΩOr, if the mental faculty is the means of generating the mental faculty, then the mental faculty is not generated by the mental faculty, because it is not tenable that the mental faculty is the object of the mental faculty.üîΩOr, if the mental faculty is the means of generating the mental faculty, then the mental faculty is not generated by the mental faculty, because it is not tenable that the mental faculty is the object of the mental faculty.

original: bsams nas ni lus med pa nam mkha' lta bur byed pa med pa'i phyir ji ltar byed pa yin /
analyzed: bsams nas ni lus med pa nam mkha' lta bur byed pa med pa'i phyir ji ltar byed pa yin /
translated: Or, if the mental faculty is the means of generating the mental faculty, then the mental faculty is not generated by the mental faculty, because it is not tenable that the mental faculty is the object of the mental faculty.üîΩOr, if the mental faculty is the means of generating the mental faculty, then

original: sems pa'i las dang bsams pa yang las yin zhes bya ba ni grub mtha' yin pa'i phyir shes pa ste /
analyzed: sems pa'i las dang bsams pa yang las yin zhes bya ba ni grub mtha' yin pa'i phyir shes pa ste /
translated: The assertion that mental karma and intention are karma is a philosophical tenet.

original: sems pa byin gyis brlabs pa las 'byung ba yongs su bskyod pa byung ba ni shes pa kho na yin la /
analyzed: sems pa byin gyis brlabs pa las 'byung ba yongs su bskyod pa byung ba ni shes pa kho na yin la /
translated: The arising of the movement of the primary elements that arises from the blessing of intention is consciousness alone.

original: 'di sems pas byin gyis brlabs pa tsam dang / bdag pos byin gyis brlabs pa'i g-yog po dang rgyal po nye ba na gnas pa tsam gyis /
analyzed: 'di sems pas byin gyis brlabs pa tsam dang / bdag pos byin gyis brlabs pa'i g-yog po dang rgyal po nye ba na gnas pa tsam gyis /
translated: This is because the movement of the primary elements is like a servant who is merely blessed by the intention of the king, or like a servant who is merely blessed by the master, or like a servant who is merely near the king.

original: res 'ga' mngags pas g-yo bar mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: res 'ga' mngags pas g-yo bar mthong ba yin no //
translated: Sometimes it is seen that a servant moves due to being sent by the king.

original: @196b de'i phyir rang nyid mi g-yo ba yin yang /
analyzed: @196b de'i phyir rang nyid mi g-yo ba yin yang /
translated: Therefore, although it does not move by itself,

original: g-yo ba'i byed pa po nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: g-yo ba'i byed pa po nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: it becomes the agent of movement.üîΩIntention is also like that.

original: sems pa yang da lta de ltar zhes bya ba'i bdag can gyi kun du rtog pa kho na yin gyi /üîΩshes pa nye ba tsam gyis sam /üîΩde'i las zin pa nyid kyis 'byung ba rnams kyis byas pa ni des byas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sems pa yang da lta de ltar zhes bya ba'i bdag can gyi kun du rtog pa kho na yin gyi / shes pa nye ba tsam gyis sam / de'i las zin pa nyid kyis 'byung ba rnams kyis byas pa ni des byas pa ma yin te /
translated: It is merely a conception that has the nature of being like that.üîΩIt is not that the elements are moved by the mere proximity of consciousness or by the completion of its function.

original: kun du rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun du rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not that they are moved by that because it is a conception.

original: nad bsal bar bya ba'i don tu sman byin pa las bram ze shi ba yin na /
analyzed: nad bsal bar bya ba'i don tu sman byin pa las bram ze shi ba yin na /
translated: If a brahman dies from the medicine given to cure his illness,üîΩthen it would follow that the medicine-giver would be a killer of a brahman.

original: bram ze gsod pa yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / shi ba'i ro zos pa las ma zhu ba'i skyon gyis mkha' 'gro ma shi ba yin na yang /
analyzed: bram ze gsod pa yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / shi ba'i ro zos pa las ma zhu ba'i skyon gyis mkha' 'gro ma shi ba yin na yang /
translated: And if a sky-wanderer dies from the fault of indigestion from eating the corpse of a dead person,

original: shi ba po'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro /
analyzed: shi ba po'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro /
translated: then it would follow that the fault is the dead person‚Äôs.

original: de'i phyir yod pa dang med pa'i kun du rtog pa dag gis skyes bu'i 'dod pa la sbyor bar byed pa yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir yod pa dang med pa'i kun du rtog pa dag gis skyes bu'i 'dod pa la sbyor bar byed pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, the person‚Äôs desire is connected with the conceptions of existence and nonexistence.

original: kun du rtog pa rnams kyi dbye bas 'di las re re'i byed pa po nyid yin zhes bya ba de kho na rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: kun du rtog pa rnams kyi dbye bas 'di las re re'i byed pa po nyid yin zhes bya ba de kho na rigs pa yin no //
translated: It is reasonable to say that each of these is the creator in accordance with the divisions of the conceptions.

original: kun du rtog pa ji lta ba las rdzogs pa yin na /
analyzed: kun du rtog pa ji lta ba las rdzogs pa yin na /
translated: If it is completed in accordance with the conception,

original: gang ba nyid yin la de ma rdzogs pa na nyung ba nyid yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang bshad par bya'o //üîΩlas gzhan rnams kyis gang len pa //
analyzed: gang ba nyid yin la de ma rdzogs pa na nyung ba nyid yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang bshad par bya'o // las gzhan rnams kyis gang len pa //
translated: then it should be explained that when it is not completed it is incomplete.üîΩThe other actions

original: rang gi rang gi bya ba yin //
analyzed: rang gi rang gi bya ba yin //
translated: are the individual‚Äôs own activity.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa byed pa po nyid kyi rnam pa rnams la dad par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa byed pa po nyid kyi rnam pa rnams la dad par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: Thus, the aspects of the agent are not to be accepted.

original: las zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the karma is exhausted.

original: bdag nyid mi shes pa rnams kyis byas pa'i las ni dgod par byed pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: bdag nyid mi shes pa rnams kyis byas pa'i las ni dgod par byed pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If karma is created by those who do not know the self, it is not to be accepted.

original: las ma zad pa la yang de'i 'dzud byed ma yin pa rnams kyis byas pa ni dgod byed ma yin pa kho na yin te 'phen byed med pa'i ral gris mi gcod pa bzhin du /
analyzed: las ma zad pa la yang de'i 'dzud byed ma yin pa rnams kyis byas pa ni dgod byed ma yin pa kho na yin te 'phen byed med pa'i ral gris mi gcod pa bzhin du /
translated: Even if the karma is not exhausted, that which is created by those who are not the instigators is not to be accepted, just as one cannot cut with a sword that lacks momentum.

original: btsud pa nyid yin na 'gyur pa kho na yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: btsud pa nyid yin na 'gyur pa kho na yin pa'i phyir /
translated: If one is the instigator, one is the agent.

original: kun du rtog pas 'dzud byed kho na byed pa po nyid //
analyzed: kun du rtog pas 'dzud byed kho na byed pa po nyid //
translated: Imagination is the instigator alone.

original: yin pa'i 'byung rngub dbang po blo dang ni //
analyzed: yin pa'i 'byung rngub dbang po blo dang ni //
translated: The mind that controls the inhalation and exhalationüîΩis the agent.

original: zhes bya ba ni grub pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni grub pa yin no //
translated: This is established.

original: gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du gzhan la brten par ma dmigs pa'i phyir /üîΩgzhan dbang ngam /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du gzhan la brten par ma dmigs pa'i phyir / gzhan dbang ngam /
translated: Since it is not observed to depend on another, like form and so on,üîΩit is not the dependent.

original: de brten nyid kyi blo ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de brten nyid kyi blo ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: It is not the mind that controls the inhalation and exhalation.

original: rten ni bkag phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rten ni bkag phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: because the support is refuted.üîΩEven though the mind is not supported on the elements like form, etc., it is the cause of the elements, like smoke is of fire.üîΩThe idea of cause isüîΩthe idea of something that precedes and is concomitant with something else.üîΩThe idea of effect is

original: blo ni gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du 'byung ba la brten pa ma yin du chug kyang me la du ba bzhin du 'byung ba rnams kyi rgyu yin no snyam du sems pa las 'di snga ma yang yin la rjes su 'gro ba'i blo yang yin pa ni
analyzed: blo ni gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du 'byung ba la brten pa ma yin du chug kyang me la du ba bzhin du 'byung ba rnams kyi rgyu yin no snyam du sems pa las 'di snga ma yang yin la rjes su 'gro ba'i blo yang yin pa ni
translated: the idea of something that is not independent of something else.

original: rgyu'i blo yin te /üîΩde dang bral ba ni brten pa'i 'bras bu nyid kyi yin la /
analyzed: rgyu'i blo yin te / de dang bral ba ni brten pa'i 'bras bu nyid kyi yin la /
translated: The idea of support isüîΩthe idea of something that is not independent of something else.üîΩThe idea of support is

original: gang 'di 'bras bu nyid la 'ba' zhig rten ma yin par rigs pa ni /
analyzed: gang 'di 'bras bu nyid la 'ba' zhig rten ma yin par rigs pa ni /
translated: the idea of something that is not independent of something else.üîΩThe idea of support is

original: yon tan nyid la sogs pa la yang @197a * //
analyzed: yon tan nyid la sogs pa la yang @197a * //
translated: the idea of something that is not independent of something else.üîΩThe idea of support isüîΩthe idea of something that is not independent of something else.

original: sbyar bar nus pa yin par bstan pa ni /üîΩ'bras bu nyid la 'am zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sbyar bar nus pa yin par bstan pa ni / 'bras bu nyid la 'am zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The idea of support isüîΩthe idea of something that is not independent of something else.üîΩThe idea of support isüîΩthe idea of something that is not independent of something else.üîΩThe idea of support isüîΩthe idea of something that is not independent of something else.üîΩThe idea of support isüîΩthe idea of something that is not independent of something else.üîΩThe idea of support isüîΩthe idea of something that is not independent of something else.üîΩThe idea of support isüîΩthe idea of something that is not independent of something else.üîΩThe idea of support isüîΩthe idea of something that is not independent of something else.üîΩThe idea of support isüîΩthe idea of something that is not independent of something else.üîΩThe idea of support isüîΩthe idea of something that is not independent of something else.üîΩThe idea of support isüîΩthe idea of something that is not independent of something else.üîΩThe idea of support isüîΩthe idea of something that is not independent of something else.üîΩThe idea of support isüîΩthe idea of something that is not independent of something else.üîΩThe idea of support isüîΩthe idea of something that is not independent of something else.üîΩThe idea of support isüîΩthe idea of something that is not independent of something else.üîΩThe idea of support isüîΩthe idea of something that is not independent of something else.üîΩThe idea of support isüîΩthe idea of something that is not independent of something else.üîΩThe idea of support isüîΩthe idea of something that is not independent of something else.üîΩThe idea of support is

original: gzhan du yin yang zhes bya ba ni de bdag nyid kyis snga ma'i rjes su 'gro ba'i blo dang bcas pa'i lus ni rten nyid yin no zhes bya bar mi rigs so //
analyzed: gzhan du yin yang zhes bya ba ni de bdag nyid kyis snga ma'i rjes su 'gro ba'i blo dang bcas pa'i lus ni rten nyid yin no zhes bya bar mi rigs so //
translated: the idea of something that is not independent of something else.üîΩThe idea of support is

original: ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: the idea of something that is not independent of something else.

original: ma la sogs pa'i blo las nur nur po la sogs pa 'byung ba las skyes ba'i blo ni gzhan las 'byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: ma la sogs pa'i blo las nur nur po la sogs pa 'byung ba las skyes ba'i blo ni gzhan las 'byung ba ma yin te /
translated: The cognition of the embryo, etc. , that arises from the elements, such as the mother, etc. , does not arise from another,

original: thal ches pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thal ches pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that would be an extreme absurdity.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: gang dag yod na gang gyur nyid //üîΩde las gzhan pa rtogs pa na //
analyzed: gang dag yod na gang gyur nyid // de las gzhan pa rtogs pa na //
translated: When something exists, it is just that.

original: de rgyu nyid du thams cad la //
analyzed: de rgyu nyid du thams cad la //
translated: When there is the cognition of something other than that,

original: rgyu rnams thug pa med par 'gyur //
analyzed: rgyu rnams thug pa med par 'gyur //
translated: all causes would be without end.

original: snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: One might think:

original: gal te pha ma'i lus la brten par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te pha ma'i lus la brten par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhen the body of the parents is present, the embryo, etc. ,

original: ri mo la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni de'i dpe'o //
analyzed: ri mo la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni de'i dpe'o //
translated: arise from that, like a picture, etc. , on a wall.‚Äù

original: ri mo ni rtsig pa la brten pa can yin te /
analyzed: ri mo ni rtsig pa la brten pa can yin te /
translated: A picture is based on a wall.üîΩThe result, such as a sprout, is based on a seed.

original: smin pa la sogs pa'i gzugs bzhin no zhes bya ba can gyi 'bras bu yang zhes bya ba tha dad pa ni du ba gzhan las me zhes 'don par blta bar bya'i /
analyzed: smin pa la sogs pa'i gzugs bzhin no zhes bya ba can gyi 'bras bu yang zhes bya ba tha dad pa ni du ba gzhan las me zhes 'don par blta bar bya'i /
translated: The reading ‚Äúfrom another‚Äù should be understood as ‚Äúfire from another smoke,‚Äù

original: me gzhan las zhes bya ba ni bag med par 'don pa yin no //
analyzed: me gzhan las zhes bya ba ni bag med par 'don pa yin no //
translated: but ‚Äúfrom another fire‚Äù is a careless reading.

original: myos pa'i nus pa ni de'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: myos pa'i nus pa ni de'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The power of intoxication is of its own nature.

original: snga na med pa zhes bya ba ni nus pa gzhan las 'byung ba ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩde bzhin du blo yang lus dang phrad pa can dang 'du ba can ni 'bras bu 'am tha mi dad pa yin gyi /
analyzed: snga na med pa zhes bya ba ni nus pa gzhan las 'byung ba ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to // de bzhin du blo yang lus dang phrad pa can dang 'du ba can ni 'bras bu 'am tha mi dad pa yin gyi /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúnot previously existing‚Äù means that it does not arise from another potentiality.

original: sngon gyi rigs mthun pa las mi ltos pa'am rgyud gzhan du byed pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba'i dpe can la sbyor bar byed pa ni /
analyzed: sngon gyi rigs mthun pa las mi ltos pa'am rgyud gzhan du byed pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba'i dpe can la sbyor bar byed pa ni /
translated: In the same way, the mind is not a result or something that is not different from the body, nor does it depend on a previous homogeneous cause, nor does it act in another continuum.

original: de bzhin dbang po dang sems pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin dbang po dang sems pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The example is applied in the phrase ‚Äúin the same way.‚Äù

original: dbang po'i khyad par dang sems pa'i khyad par las kyang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dbang po'i khyad par dang sems pa'i khyad par las kyang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúfrom the particular sense faculty and the particular volition‚Äù means that the particular sense faculty and the particular volition are the causes of the particular consciousness.

original: de skad du bshad pa yang zhes bya ba ni pha rol po khas len pa 'di nyid la bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de skad du bshad pa yang zhes bya ba ni pha rol po khas len pa 'di nyid la bshad pa yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin the same way‚Äù means that the same explanation applies to the example.

original: 'di la ni de rnams las sems pa can dang myos pa'i nus pa bzhin du rnam par shes pa yin zhes bya ba de dag tsam la dgongs pa yin gyi lhag ma rgyas pa ni gang yang nges par brtag par bya ba yin mod kyi zhar la 'di
analyzed: 'di la ni de rnams las sems pa can dang myos pa'i nus pa bzhin du rnam par shes pa yin zhes bya ba de dag tsam la dgongs pa yin gyi lhag ma rgyas pa ni gang yang nges par brtag par bya ba yin mod kyi zhar la 'di
translated: In this context, the intention is that consciousness is merely that which is capable of cognition and intoxication, like the mind and the power of intoxication, but it is not certain that the rest are extensive.

original: nyid du nges par brtag pa yin pa'i phyir bzhi kho na zhes bya bar grangs nges par gzung ba yin no //
analyzed: nyid du nges par brtag pa yin pa'i phyir bzhi kho na zhes bya bar grangs nges par gzung ba yin no //
translated: However, since it is certain that this is a digression, it is said that there are only four.

original: 'byung ba chen po rnams ni gzugs la sogs pa lnga la yod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po rnams ni gzugs la sogs pa lnga la yod pa yin te /
translated: The great elements exist in the five such as form.

original: gzhan 'jig rten gyi ma dmigs pas de skad du tha snyad du byed pa'i phyir gtso bo nyid ma yin pa la yang ma yin te //
analyzed: gzhan 'jig rten gyi ma dmigs pas de skad du tha snyad du byed pa'i phyir gtso bo nyid ma yin pa la yang ma yin te //
translated: They are not primary because they are not perceived by others in the world, and they are not primary because they are not conventionally designated as such.

original: gtso bo gzhan la mthong ba'i phyir @197b ro ;
analyzed: gtso bo gzhan la mthong ba'i phyir @197b ro ;
translated: They are not primary because they are seen in other primary elements.

original: / gzhan du dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni brda las byung ba'i ming rjes su sbyor ba rnams gcig tu shes pa las gzhan du mi rtog pa'i shes pas cha shas bzhin du'am /
analyzed: / gzhan du dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni brda las byung ba'i ming rjes su sbyor ba rnams gcig tu shes pa las gzhan du mi rtog pa'i shes pas cha shas bzhin du'am /
translated: because there is no apprehension of anything else.

original: yon tan bzhin du yon tan can dmigs pa med pas shes pa gcig la gnod pa'i phyir ro //üîΩrnam par rtog pa ni de bzhin du bdag gi rjes su 'brang ba can tha dad pa la /
analyzed: yon tan bzhin du yon tan can dmigs pa med pas shes pa gcig la gnod pa'i phyir ro // rnam par rtog pa ni de bzhin du bdag gi rjes su 'brang ba can tha dad pa la /
translated: The cognition that is not discursive with regard to anything other than the single cognition that is connected with the name that arises from convention, apprehends the possessor of the qualities, as if it were a part or as if it were a quality, because there is no apprehension of the possessor of the qualities.üîΩDiscursive thought is the activity of apprehending as undifferentiated that which is differentiated, and is associated with the notion of self.

original: tha mi dad par rtogs par byed pa'i bya ba can gyi rtogs bya ni tha dad pa las gzhan yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tha mi dad par rtogs par byed pa'i bya ba can gyi rtogs bya ni tha dad pa las gzhan yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The object of that is different from the differentiated.

original: 'on te ro ni zhes bya ba ni reg bya'i khyad par gyi ro ste /
analyzed: 'on te ro ni zhes bya ba ni reg bya'i khyad par gyi ro ste /
translated: Or, taste is a special kind of tangible object,

original: lce yang reg pa'i khyad par yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lce yang reg pa'i khyad par yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: and the tongue is a special kind of tangible object.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bzhi po kho na'o zhes bya ba'i rnam grangs bsal nas rnam par bcad par bya ba med pa'i phyir nges par gzung bar gsal bar byed pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bzhi po kho na'o zhes bya ba'i rnam grangs bsal nas rnam par bcad par bya ba med pa'i phyir nges par gzung bar gsal bar byed pa ni /
translated: Therefore, after eliminating the enumeration ‚Äúonly four,‚Äù in order to clarify the ascertainment that there is no object of negation,

original: skad cig pa nyid la sogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: skad cig pa nyid la sogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: he says ‚Äúsuch as momentariness.‚Äù

original: bzhi kho na zhes bya ba grangs ma yin nam /
analyzed: bzhi kho na zhes bya ba grangs ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt ‚Äúonly four‚Äù a number?

original: de yang bsdus pa'i bsam pas ma yin la /
analyzed: de yang bsdus pa'i bsam pas ma yin la /
translated: And that is not by way of an inclusive consideration,

original: rgyal ba'i bsam pas kyang mi rigs par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rgyal ba'i bsam pas kyang mi rigs par bstan pa ni /
translated: and it is not tenable by way of a royal consideration.

original: thams cad pa lta bya zhes pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad pa lta bya zhes pa'o //
translated: He says, ‚Äúall are objects of knowledge.‚Äù

original: khyed kyi yang gzugs la sog pa lnga zhes bya ba'i grangs ji ltar yin /
analyzed: khyed kyi yang gzugs la sog pa lnga zhes bya ba'i grangs ji ltar yin /
translated: How is it that for you there are five such as form?

original: bsdus pa dang rgyas pa'i rnam par rtog pa srid pa med pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: bsdus pa dang rgyas pa'i rnam par rtog pa srid pa med pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa la /
translated: Thinking that it is because there is no possibility of a conception that is either inclusive or exclusive,

original: de'i phyir rten lnga'i zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rten lnga'i zhes bya'o //
translated: he says, ‚Äúthe five bases.‚Äù

original: nyid de nyid ces bya ba nges par gzung ba gnyis pa ni rnam par bcad par bya ba med par mi rigs par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: nyid de nyid ces bya ba nges par gzung ba gnyis pa ni rnam par bcad par bya ba med par mi rigs par bstan pa ni /
translated: The second ascertainment, ‚Äújust that,‚Äù is in order to demonstrate that it is not tenable that there is no object of negation.

original: thams cad stong par gang brjod pa //
analyzed: thams cad stong par gang brjod pa //
translated: What is called ‚Äúemptiness‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: is the absence of all views.

original: gal te stong nyid ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: gal te stong nyid ces bya ba ste /
translated: If ‚Äúemptiness‚Äù is the absence of all views,

original: 'jal byed dang gzhal bya thams cad med pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jal byed dang gzhal bya thams cad med pa yin no //
translated: then it is the absence of the object of measurement and the means of measurement.üîΩWhat is the emptiness of all?

original: thams cad stong nyid ci 'dra dang // zhes bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa dang bral ba lkog tu ma gyur pa rig pa ni /
analyzed: thams cad stong nyid ci 'dra dang // zhes bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa dang bral ba lkog tu ma gyur pa rig pa ni /
translated: The absence of the aspect of apprehended object and apprehending subject, not hidden, is known as ‚Äúemptiness.‚Äù

original: stong pa nyid yin no zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: stong pa nyid yin no zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is explained as ‚Äúemptiness.‚Äù

original: gal te gzugs la sogs pa kho na 'byung ba chen po lnga yin du zin pa de lta na yang /
analyzed: gal te gzugs la sogs pa kho na 'byung ba chen po lnga yin du zin pa de lta na yang /
translated: If form and so on are the five great elements,

original: de dag 'dus pa'i ngo bo lus kyi bskyed bya blo yin gyi /
analyzed: de dag 'dus pa'i ngo bo lus kyi bskyed bya blo yin gyi /
translated: then the body, which is the product of their aggregation, is the object of the mind.

original: 'jig rten pha rol pa ni ma yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol pa ni ma yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: The thought is that the next world is not.üîΩThe mother and father are the body‚Äôs activity.

original: ma dang pha'i lus kyi bya ba'o zhes gzhan du ma yin zhes bya ba ni rang dbang nyid du'o //
analyzed: ma dang pha'i lus kyi bya ba'o zhes gzhan du ma yin zhes bya ba ni rang dbang nyid du'o //
translated: It is not elsewhere.

original: gal te yang ma las byung ba'i du ba ni du ba gzhan las 'ongs pa nyid du rtogs pa ma yin te /üîΩde lta mod kyi dbang po dang blo la sogs pa'i goms pa'i bskyed bya'i khyad par las @198a * //
analyzed: gal te yang ma las byung ba'i du ba ni du ba gzhan las 'ongs pa nyid du rtogs pa ma yin te / de lta mod kyi dbang po dang blo la sogs pa'i goms pa'i bskyed bya'i khyad par las @198a * //
translated: Moreover, smoke that arises from fire is not understood to come from another smoke.

original: rang gi rigs la ltos pa dang bcas pa kho na'i lus las 'byung ba yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rang gi rigs la ltos pa dang bcas pa kho na'i lus las 'byung ba yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: However, it is taught that it arises from the body, which is dependent on its own type, due to the specific development of faculties, mind, and so on.

original: 'byung rngub la sogs pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'byung rngub la sogs pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Inhaling, exhaling, and so on are taught to be like that.

original: du ba la sogs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: du ba la sogs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that smoke and so on are not like that.

original: g-yo ba la sogs pa yang zhes bya ba'i g-yo ba la sogs pa ni rang goms pa las byung ba nyid de /
analyzed: g-yo ba la sogs pa yang zhes bya ba'i g-yo ba la sogs pa ni rang goms pa las byung ba nyid de /
translated: Movement and so on are also like that. Movement and so on arise from one's own habituation.

original: dam pa ma yin pa dang 'grogs pa la sogs pa la mthong ba yin na /
analyzed: dam pa ma yin pa dang 'grogs pa la sogs pa la mthong ba yin na /

original: ji ltar ma la sogs pa'i goms pa las 'byung ba yin /
analyzed: ji ltar ma la sogs pa'i goms pa las 'byung ba yin /

original: ji ltar byis pa rang nyid goms pa ni rgan po'i gnas skabs na yang dran pa yin la //
analyzed: ji ltar byis pa rang nyid goms pa ni rgan po'i gnas skabs na yang dran pa yin la //
translated: Just as a child's own habituation is remembered in the state of old age,

original: de bzhin du ma la sogs pa'i goms pa yang rjes su dran pa yin yang skye ba snga ma'i goms pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du ma la sogs pa'i goms pa yang rjes su dran pa yin yang skye ba snga ma'i goms pa ni /
translated: Similarly, the habitual tendencies of a mother and so on are also memory, but the habitual tendencies of a former life are not.üîΩ

original: 'du byed pa thams cad gcod par byed pa'i 'chi ba'i 'chi ba dang / mngal na gnas pa'i sdug bsngal gyis bar du bcad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'du byed pa thams cad gcod par byed pa'i 'chi ba'i 'chi ba dang / mngal na gnas pa'i sdug bsngal gyis bar du bcad pa'i phyir /

original: mi dran pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi dran pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the statement ‚Äúthey are not remembered.‚Äù

original: pha dang ma smos pa ni mes po la sogs pa nye bar mtshon pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: pha dang ma smos pa ni mes po la sogs pa nye bar mtshon pa'i don du'o //
translated: The mention of mother and father is for the purpose of illustrating grandparents and so on.

original: lus nyid las skye ba ma yin bar mi rigs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: lus nyid las skye ba ma yin bar mi rigs pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt it illogical that they are not born from the body itself?

analyzed: du ba las byung du ba ni // zhes bya ba ste /

analyzed: de bzhin du ri mo la sogs pa yang bshad par bya ba'o zhes bya ba'i don to //

translated: It is not in another.

original: 'ba' zhig kyang de'i 'bras bu nyid kha @199b na yin par lan cig de'i 'bras bu nyid du dmigs pa'i phyir du ba lta bu'o zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'ba' zhig kyang de'i 'bras bu nyid kha @199b na yin par lan cig de'i 'bras bu nyid du dmigs pa'i phyir du ba lta bu'o zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: And it is also the only one that is the effect of that, because it is observed to be the effect of that, like smoke.

original: rgyu ma mthong ba yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu ma mthong ba yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is taught by ‚ÄúAlso, the non-observation of the cause.üîΩ‚Äù

original: kye sam pa zhes bos nas /
analyzed: kye sam pa zhes bos nas /
translated: Having said ‚ÄúOh, Sampad,‚Äù

original: ji ltar gnas pa yin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ji ltar gnas pa yin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúHow is it that it exists?‚Äù

original: lto ba na zhes pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: lto ba na zhes pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: is connected with ‚Äúin the belly.‚Äù

original: ma yi lto nas skyes min gyi //
analyzed: ma yi lto nas skyes min gyi //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not born from the mother‚Äôs womb‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba dang yang sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang yang sbyar ro //
translated: is also connected with that.

original: 'di ni skye ba snga ma las ma 'ongs pa nyid kyi dpe yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni skye ba snga ma las ma 'ongs pa nyid kyi dpe yin no //
translated: This is an example of not coming from a previous birth.

original: ma he 'di dag ces bya ba ni goms pa'i bskyed bya skye ba la sogs pa las byung ba'i dbye ba'i dpe yin no //üîΩtshong dus nas 'ongs pa zhes bya ba ni goms pa dang lhan cig yod pas de'i bskyed bya nyid ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ma he 'di dag ces bya ba ni goms pa'i bskyed bya skye ba la sogs pa las byung ba'i dbye ba'i dpe yin no // tshong dus nas 'ongs pa zhes bya ba ni goms pa dang lhan cig yod pas de'i bskyed bya nyid ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: ‚ÄúThese buffaloes‚Äù is an example of the distinction arising from the produced by habituation.

original: 'byung ba tsam gyis bskyed bya nyid kyi dpe yin no //
analyzed: 'byung ba tsam gyis bskyed bya nyid kyi dpe yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving come from the marketplace‚Äù is an example of the produced by mere arising, because it is not the produced by habituation, since it exists together with it.

original: gal te lus kyi rnam pa yongs su 'gyur ba'i 'byung ba rnams las sems pa can yin na /
analyzed: gal te lus kyi rnam pa yongs su 'gyur ba'i 'byung ba rnams las sems pa can yin na /
translated: If the mind were in the elements that are the transformation of the body,

original: shi ba'i lus la yang 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: shi ba'i lus la yang 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: then the dead body would have mind.

original: mtha' dag srog chags kyi rang bzhin du ci ste mi 'gyur zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mtha' dag srog chags kyi rang bzhin du ci ste mi 'gyur zhes bya ste /
translated: Why would not the whole body be the nature of all living beings?

original: mtha' dag ces bya ba ni shi ba yang ngo //üîΩgson po'i lus sa la sogs pa rnams nyid 'ga' zhig yongs su gyur pa'am nang gi khyad par ram /
analyzed: mtha' dag ces bya ba ni shi ba yang ngo // gson po'i lus sa la sogs pa rnams nyid 'ga' zhig yongs su gyur pa'am nang gi khyad par ram /
translated: The whole body is the dead body.

original: sems can gyi gzhi gzhan sa la sogs pa kho na yin la /
analyzed: sems can gyi gzhi gzhan sa la sogs pa kho na yin la /
translated: The living body is earth, etc.,

original: shi ba ni de dang bral ba yin no //
analyzed: shi ba ni de dang bral ba yin no //
translated: and the dead body is the separation from that.

original: de'i phyir de las sems pa can ma yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir de las sems pa can ma yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the mind is not in the body.

original: yongs su gyur pa'i rnam pa'i bye brag ces bya ba'o //üîΩyongs su gyur pa de 'am /
analyzed: yongs su gyur pa'i rnam pa'i bye brag ces bya ba'o // yongs su gyur pa de 'am /
translated: This is the opinion of those who maintain that the transformation of the body is a special transformation.

original: de'i khyad par ni lus yongs su gyur pa'i khyad par ma yin nam /
analyzed: de'i khyad par ni lus yongs su gyur pa'i khyad par ma yin nam /
translated: Is that transformation or its special state not a special transformation of the body?

original: gson po'i lus bzhin du shi ba la yang 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ni yongs su gyur pa'i bye brag de nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: gson po'i lus bzhin du shi ba la yang 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ni yongs su gyur pa'i bye brag de nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: The response to this is stated in the line ‚Äúthat very transformation.‚Äù

original: 'on te de'i 'bras bu'i bskyed bya ma yin pa de lta na yang thog ma med pa snga ma snga ma'i rang gi rgyu tsam las byung ba 'ba' zhig lus las 'byung ba yin la /
analyzed: 'on te de'i 'bras bu'i bskyed bya ma yin pa de lta na yang thog ma med pa snga ma snga ma'i rang gi rgyu tsam las byung ba 'ba' zhig lus las 'byung ba yin la /
translated: If it is not the product of that, then it would arise from the body alone, which is the mere antecedent condition of the body in the beginningless continuum of cyclic existence.

original: lus yod kyang res 'ga' mi 'byung ba yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: lus yod kyang res 'ga' mi 'byung ba yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: And even if the body exists, it would not arise sometimes.üîΩThe response to this is stated in the line ‚ÄúBut if it arises from something else.‚Äù

original: 'on te gang las 'ga' zhig ces bya ba ni gson po'i lus so //
analyzed: 'on te gang las 'ga' zhig ces bya ba ni gson po'i lus so //
translated: ‚ÄúSomething else‚Äù refers to the living body.

original: gzhan ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni shi ba'i lus so //
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni shi ba'i lus so //
translated: ‚ÄúNot something else‚Äù refers to the dead body.

original: lan ni gal te yongs su gyur ba'i khyad par zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: lan ni gal te yongs su gyur ba'i khyad par zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The response is stated in the line ‚ÄúThe transformation.‚Äù

original: gal te yongs su gyur pa'am /
analyzed: gal te yongs su gyur pa'am /
translated: If it is a transformation,

original: gzhan yang rang gi rgyu las byung ba'i khyad par ni phul du byung ba'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir /üîΩsnang ba yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rang gi rgyu las byung ba'i khyad par ni phul du byung ba'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir / snang ba yin te /
translated: or if it arises from its own cause, then it is a special, unique entity.üîΩTherefore, it is perceptible.

original: mi dmigs pa ma yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa ma yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur te /
translated: It is not imperceptible.

original: ji ltar rtog par byed pa ma yin pa ni rtog pa dang mngon sum 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don @200a * //
analyzed: ji ltar rtog par byed pa ma yin pa ni rtog pa dang mngon sum 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don @200a * //

original: to ; / mthong ba'i khyad par gyi rgyu ni goms pa yin na /
analyzed: to ; / mthong ba'i khyad par gyi rgyu ni goms pa yin na /
translated: If the cause of the difference in seeing is familiarity,

original: mthong ba yang rtog pa'i yul ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: mthong ba yang rtog pa'i yul ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: then seeing is also taught to be the object of conceptualization.

original: 'on te 'bras bu mthong ba nyid las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te 'bras bu mthong ba nyid las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Or, if it is from seeing the effect itself,

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni goms pa'i rgyu grub pa'o //üîΩ'byung bar 'gyur ba'i 'jig rten pha rol sgrub pa la 'bras bu'am /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni goms pa'i rgyu grub pa'o // 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i 'jig rten pha rol sgrub pa la 'bras bu'am /
translated: then because of that, the cause of familiarity is established.üîΩIn the establishment of the future world beyond, there is no effect

original: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yod pa ma yin te /
translated: or natural reason,

original: nges pa med pa'i phyir 'jug pa med do zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: nges pa med pa'i phyir 'jug pa med do zhes zer ba ni /
translated: because there is no certainty, there is no engagement.

original: 'bras bu las skye ba snga ma'i rgyu grub mod ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu las skye ba snga ma'i rgyu grub mod ces bya ba'o //
translated: If it is said that the arising from an effect is established by the previous cause,

analyzed: 'bras bu'am rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs de'i nges pa la ma yin du zin kyang 'gal ba dmigs pa can yin no //
translated: then even if there is no certainty in that effect or natural reason, there is the observation of contradiction.

original: de ltar yang mtshams sbyor ba'i gcig gi rang bzhin gyi sems dang dbang po la sogs skye ba snga ma la dmigs pa ni de'i med pa mtshams sbyor ba ma yin pa dang / 'gal ba yin par bstan pa ni mthong ba gang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar yang mtshams sbyor ba'i gcig gi rang bzhin gyi sems dang dbang po la sogs skye ba snga ma la dmigs pa ni de'i med pa mtshams sbyor ba ma yin pa dang / 'gal ba yin par bstan pa ni mthong ba gang zhes bya ba ste /

analyzed: mtshams sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni skye ba 'di'i ngo bo mngon sum mo // skye ba snga ma'i ji ltar yin pa bstan pa ni /

original: du ba skyed par byed pa'i me ni de'i med pa skyed par byed pa ma yin te /üîΩme las byung ba'i du ba me ma yin pa yongs su gcod pas ji ltar 'byung ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: du ba skyed par byed pa'i me ni de'i med pa skyed par byed pa ma yin te /üîΩme las byung ba'i du ba me ma yin pa yongs su gcod pas ji ltar 'byung ba de bzhin du /
translated: ‚Äú The nature of the one who connects to the next life‚Äù is the nature of

original: du ba skyed par byed pa'i me yang du ba ma yin pa yongs su gcod pas skyed par byed pa yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: du ba skyed par byed pa'i me yang du ba ma yin pa yongs su gcod pas skyed par byed pa yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: If you think that,

original: gal te g-yer bag can la sogs pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gal te g-yer bag can la sogs pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúIf it is a frivolous person, etc.‚Äù

original: de goms pa zhes bya ba ni g-yer bag la goms pa las so //
analyzed: de goms pa zhes bya ba ni g-yer bag la goms pa las so //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom its habituation‚Äù means from the habituation of frivolity.

original: g-yer bag med pa las zhes bya ba rnam par 'brel pa ni mi gsal ba dang zhan pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: g-yer bag med pa las zhes bya ba rnam par 'brel pa ni mi gsal ba dang zhan pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The connection with ‚Äúfrom non-frivolity‚Äù is ‚Äúunclear and weak.‚Äù

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni mi gsal ba dang zhan pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni mi gsal ba dang zhan pa nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to unclear and weak.

original: gal te yang thog ma med pa nyid ma grub kyang mtha'i gnas skabs la ji ltar mtshams mi sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: gal te yang thog ma med pa nyid ma grub kyang mtha'i gnas skabs la ji ltar mtshams mi sbyor ba yin no //
translated: Even if beginninglessness is not established, how is there no connection at the end?

original: bar ma'i gnas skabs la mtshams sbyor ba med pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: bar ma'i gnas skabs la mtshams sbyor ba med pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: If you think that it is because there is no connection in the middle,

original: thog ma med pa nyid ma yin nam zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: thog ma med pa nyid ma yin nam zhes bya ba ste /
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúIsn‚Äôt it beginningless?‚Äù

original: yod pa ma yin pa kho na 'byung ba ji lta ba yod pa de bzhin du yod pa nyid ni 'byung pa ma yin te du ba lta bu yin no //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa kho na 'byung ba ji lta ba yod pa de bzhin du yod pa nyid ni 'byung pa ma yin te du ba lta bu yin no //
translated: Just as what is nonexistent does arise, so what is existent does not arise, like smoke.

original: thog ma med pa nyid yin na rtag tu yod pa kho na yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: thog ma med pa nyid yin na rtag tu yod pa kho na yin pa'i phyir /
translated: If there were no beginning, it would always exist.

original: mi gcod pa'i chos can nyid du nges par bzung ba'i phyir mtshams mi sbyor ba bkag pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi gcod pa'i chos can nyid du nges par bzung ba'i phyir mtshams mi sbyor ba bkag pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The refutation of the non-linking of the aggregates is to be understood as the certainty of the aggregates‚Äô nature of not being cut off.

original: snga na med pa'i @200b sems can yin zhas khas len pa dang 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: snga na med pa'i @200b sems can yin zhas khas len pa dang 'gal ba yin no //
translated: It is contradictory to accept that there are sentient beings who did not exist previously.

original: zhan pa nyid kyang goms pa'i bskyed byar mthong ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: zhan pa nyid kyang goms pa'i bskyed byar mthong ba de'i tshe /
translated: When one sees that weakness is produced by habituation,

original: skye ba dang po la yang de bzhin du 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: skye ba dang po la yang de bzhin du 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: then it would be the same in the first birth.

original: thog ma med pa kho na yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: thog ma med pa kho na yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching that there is no beginning is:

original: zhan 'jug ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhan 'jug ces bya ba ste /
translated: ‚Äúweakness enters.‚Äù

original: de sngon du 'gro ba can zhes bya ba ni goms pa sngon du 'gro ba can no ;
analyzed: de sngon du 'gro ba can zhes bya ba ni goms pa sngon du 'gro ba can no ;
translated: That which is preceded by that is preceded by habituation.

original: /'di mthong ba yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: /'di mthong ba yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching that this is seen is:

original: mig la sogs pa zhan pa ni //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa zhan pa ni //
translated: ‚Äúweakness of the eye, etc.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This is the meaning.

original: de las zhes bya ba ni zhan pa nyid las te /
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba ni zhan pa nyid las te /
translated: From that means from sleepiness.

original: goms pa las g-yer bag can nyid du 'gyur ba yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: goms pa las g-yer bag can nyid du 'gyur ba yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: From habituation, there is wakefulness.üîΩWhen is there wakefulness from habituation?

original: goms pa las g-yer bag nyid gang gi tshe yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: goms pa las g-yer bag nyid gang gi tshe yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: This is taught:

original: gnyid sad pa zhes bya ba'o //üîΩyang na gal te gnyid log pa la sogs pa goms pa las zhan pa nyid dang / sad pa goms pa las g-yer bag nyid yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gnyid sad pa zhes bya ba'o // yang na gal te gnyid log pa la sogs pa goms pa las zhan pa nyid dang / sad pa goms pa las g-yer bag nyid yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: When one awakens from sleep.

original: gnyid log pa rtsom pa dang sad pa rtsom pa la ji ltar zhan pa nyid dang g-yer bag nyid yin /
analyzed: gnyid log pa rtsom pa dang sad pa rtsom pa la ji ltar zhan pa nyid dang g-yer bag nyid yin /
translated: Or, if sleepiness and wakefulness are due to habituation to sleep and wakefulness, respectively, then how can sleepiness and wakefulness be due to habituation to sleep and wakefulness when one is beginning to sleep and beginning to wake?

original: de goms pa yang ma yin te /üîΩde'i gnas skabs rtsom pas de las 'byung ba'i bag chags ni /
analyzed: de goms pa yang ma yin te / de'i gnas skabs rtsom pas de las 'byung ba'i bag chags ni /
translated: They are not due to habituation to that.üîΩThe latent potentialities that arise from that are due to the beginning of that state.

original: de'i rtsom pa po sad pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de'i rtsom pa po sad pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: The beginning of that is wakefulness.üîΩThis is taught:

original: gnyid log pa las sad pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gnyid log pa las sad pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: When one awakens from sleep.

original: skye ba'i dang po la yang ji lta ba'i bag chags sad pa las zhan pa nyid dang / g-yer bag nyid kyi mig la sogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir /üîΩ'byung ba las byung ba nyid kyis thog ma med pa nyid nyams pa ni /
analyzed: skye ba'i dang po la yang ji lta ba'i bag chags sad pa las zhan pa nyid dang / g-yer bag nyid kyi mig la sogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir / 'byung ba las byung ba nyid kyis thog ma med pa nyid nyams pa ni /
translated: Also, in the first moment of birth, due to the arousing of the latent potentialities of the view of the transitory collection, the eye and so on become weak and unsteady.

original: ma yin no zhes gnas skabs la sbyor bar byed pa ni /
analyzed: ma yin no zhes gnas skabs la sbyor bar byed pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the assertion that the beginningless continuum of the elements is impaired by the beginning of the elements is not tenable.üîΩThus, the opponent applies the example of sleep and waking to the first moment of birth.

original: des na skye ba dang por yang /
analyzed: des na skye ba dang por yang /
translated: Therefore, in the first moment of birth,

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: the eye and so on become weak and unsteady.

original: gnyid log pa dang sad pa bzhin du zhan pa nyid dang g-yer bag nyid du skye ba'i dang po la 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gnyid log pa dang sad pa bzhin du zhan pa nyid dang g-yer bag nyid du skye ba'i dang po la 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they become weak and unsteady in the first moment of birth, just as they do when waking from sleep.

original: lus gcig la kun du rgyu bar mthong ba las lus gzhan kun du rgyu ba yin par sgrub pa la phyin ci log tu sgrub par byed pas 'gal ba ma yin par /
analyzed: lus gcig la kun du rgyu bar mthong ba las lus gzhan kun du rgyu ba yin par sgrub pa la phyin ci log tu sgrub par byed pas 'gal ba ma yin par /
translated: The opponent argues that the assertion that the eye and so on of another body are the same as those of one‚Äôs own body is a mistaken proof because it is a contradiction to see the eye and so on of another body moving and then to infer that the eye and so on of one‚Äôs own body moves.üîΩThe opponent says:üîΩHow can the eye and so on of another body

original: ji ltar lus gzhan la brten pa //
analyzed: ji ltar lus gzhan la brten pa //
translated: be the same as those of one‚Äôs own body?

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to that is:

original: lan ni / ji ltar rdzas gzhan la brten pa //üîΩzhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: lan ni / ji ltar rdzas gzhan la brten pa //üîΩzhes bya ba ste /
translated: How can the eye and so on of another bodyüîΩbe the same as those of one‚Äôs own body?

original: lus gcig bzhin du lus gzhan la kun du rgyu bar mthong ba /
analyzed: lus gcig bzhin du lus gzhan la kun du rgyu bar mthong ba /
translated: It is seen that the self moves from one body to another, just as a person moves from one house to another.üîΩIf it does not move from one body to another, it is understood that it arises in another body.

original: de la lus gcig la kun du rgyu ba med na lus gzhan la 'byung ba yin zhes rtogs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la lus gcig la kun du rgyu ba med na lus gzhan la 'byung ba yin zhes rtogs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is understood that it arises in another body.

original: bde ba'i lus la kun du rgyu bar sgrub pa 'di las bzlog par sgrub par byed pa 'gal ba ma yin nam snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: bde ba'i lus la kun du rgyu bar sgrub pa 'di las bzlog par sgrub par byed pa 'gal ba ma yin nam snyam du sems pa la /
translated: If the self is established as moving from one body to another, is it not contradictory to establish that it is not moving from one body to another?

original: dper na rmi lam rmi ba'i lus la yang mngon du byed pa yin na @201a * //
analyzed: dper na rmi lam rmi ba'i lus la yang mngon du byed pa yin na @201a * //
translated: For example, it is said that the self is manifested in the body of a dream.

original: bden pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: bden pa kho na yin no //
translated: It is true.

original: rnam par dbye ba ni 'jig rten pa'i rnam par rtog pas sprul pa kho na yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par dbye ba ni 'jig rten pa'i rnam par rtog pas sprul pa kho na yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The analysis is taught as follows:

original: rang bzhin mngon du byed pa la zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin mngon du byed pa la zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The self is manifested in the body of a dream.üîΩThus, it is established that the self is not cut off because it is beginningless.

original: des na de bzhin du thog ma med pa nyid kyis mi gcod pa'i chos can nyid du rab tu bsgrubs nas gcod pa ni 'ga' ba dmigs pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: des na de bzhin du thog ma med pa nyid kyis mi gcod pa'i chos can nyid du rab tu bsgrubs nas gcod pa ni 'ga' ba dmigs pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The self is not cut off because it is beginningless.

original: de'i phyir snga ma dang phyi ma mtshams sbyor nus pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir snga ma dang phyi ma mtshams sbyor nus pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Therefore, it is called ‚Äúable to connect the prior and subsequent‚Äù.

original: chogs pa med pa nyid kyis 'bras bu mi 'byung ba la khyab pa yin na /
analyzed: chogs pa med pa nyid kyis 'bras bu mi 'byung ba la khyab pa yin na /
translated: If the non-existence of the collection were the pervasion of the non-arising of the effect,

original: rgyu rnams tshogs pa nyid ni 'gal pa khyab pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rgyu rnams tshogs pa nyid ni 'gal pa khyab pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: the teaching that the collection of causes itself is the contradictory pervasion is

original: rgyu ma tshang na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu ma tshang na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf the cause is incomplete‚Äù.

original: ma tshang ba nyid kyis med pa la khyab pa yin pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: ma tshang ba nyid kyis med pa la khyab pa yin pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt the non-existence of the incomplete the pervasion?

original: tshang ba la yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshang ba la yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it exists even when complete.

original: 'bras bu nyid ni nge las res 'ga' 'byung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'bras bu nyid ni nge las res 'ga' 'byung ba'i phyir te /
translated: The effect itself sometimes arises from that,üîΩtherefore, the collection itself is not the contradictory pervasion.

original: de'i phyir tshogs pa nyid ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba ma yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshogs pa nyid ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba ma yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: If you think this,

original: 'on te 'di la 'gal ba ci zhig yod ce na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te 'di la 'gal ba ci zhig yod ce na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then what contradiction is there in this?

original: de la res 'ga' 'byung ba cam ni 'bras bu ma yin te /
analyzed: de la res 'ga' 'byung ba cam ni 'bras bu ma yin te /
translated: In this regard, the mere sometimes arising is not the effect,

original: rgyu ma yin pa la yang de tsam yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu ma yin pa la yang de tsam yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that mere is also in what is not the cause.

original: 'on te de yod kyang kha cig tu mi 'byung ba'i phyir rgyu nyid ma yin zhing 'bras bu nyid kyang ma yin la de 'di ni /
analyzed: 'on te de yod kyang kha cig tu mi 'byung ba'i phyir rgyu nyid ma yin zhing 'bras bu nyid kyang ma yin la de 'di ni /
translated: But if it exists, it is not a cause because it does not occur in some cases, and it is not an effect.

original: 'di yang mtshungs pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'di yang mtshungs pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The following verse shows that the same is true of the other.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po med pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po med pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe state of being a cause and effect does not exist‚Äù means that

original: tshang pa la yang 'bras bu med na /
analyzed: tshang pa la yang 'bras bu med na /
translated: if an effect does not exist,

original: de ni rgyu dang 'bras bu ma yin no zhes shes pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ni rgyu dang 'bras bu ma yin no zhes shes pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: it is not a cause and effect.

original: de'i phyir rgyu ma yin pa las 'bras bu 'di'i khyad par gdon mi za bar 'byung ba kho na yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu ma yin pa las 'bras bu 'di'i khyad par gdon mi za bar 'byung ba kho na yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the following verse shows that this effect must certainly arise from a noncause.

original: 'bras bu ni rgyu'i gzhan dbang yin par zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni rgyu'i gzhan dbang yin par zhes bya'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe effect is dependent on the cause‚Äù means that

original: de med na mi 'byung bas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de med na mi 'byung bas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: the effect does not occur without the cause.

original: rgyu ma yin pa 'di'i khyad par ma yin nam /
analyzed: rgyu ma yin pa 'di'i khyad par ma yin nam /
translated: Is this not a distinguishing feature of a noncause?

original: de med na 'bras bu 'byung ba ma yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: de med na 'bras bu 'byung ba ma yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: The thought is that an effect does not occur without it.

original: 'on te de med na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te de med na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But if it does not exist,üîΩthe phrase ‚Äúthe effect does not occur without it‚Äù means that

original: res 'ga' 'byung ba tsam ni 'khrul pa nyid yin pa'i rgyu nyid du ma grub pa yin la /
analyzed: res 'ga' 'byung ba tsam ni 'khrul pa nyid yin pa'i rgyu nyid du ma grub pa yin la /
translated: Sometimes, mere occurrence is not established as the cause of error itself.

original: de'i med pas sbyar ba'i med pa mi 'grub par bstan pa ni de med na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i med pas sbyar ba'i med pa mi 'grub par bstan pa ni de med na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement that its nonexistence is not established by the application of its nonexistence is ‚Äúif it does not exist.üîΩ‚Äù

original: gal te res 'ga' 'byung ba 'khrul pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te res 'ga' 'byung ba 'khrul pa yin na /
translated: If sometimes occurrence is error,

original: de yod na gdon mi za bar 'byung ba yin zhes ji ltar shes pa yin snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: de yod na gdon mi za bar 'byung ba yin zhes ji ltar shes pa yin snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: how is it known that if it exists, it is definitely occurrence?

original: gal te de yod na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te de yod na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement is ‚Äúif it exists.üîΩ‚Äù

original: lan ni de ltar yongs su dpyad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: lan ni de ltar yongs su dpyad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The answer is ‚Äúbecause of that thorough analysis.‚Äù

original: gang gi byed pa de'i tshe de la de byed pa po nyid kyi rang bzhin nyid du go ba yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi byed pa de'i tshe de la de byed pa po nyid kyi rang bzhin nyid du go ba yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: When its activity exists, it is understood that it has the nature of an agent.

original: @201b rgyu ma yin pa la yang de bzhin du go bar gyur pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: @201b rgyu ma yin pa la yang de bzhin du go bar gyur pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt it the case that it is understood that way even in the absence of a cause?

original: res 'ga' byung ba ni de la yang 'byung ba'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa la de med na mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: res 'ga' byung ba ni de la yang 'byung ba'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa la de med na mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Sometimes occurrence is from that, because it occurs.

original: de yod na 'byung ba dang de med na mi 'byung ba zhes bya ba 'dis /
analyzed: de yod na 'byung ba dang de med na mi 'byung ba zhes bya ba 'dis /
translated: If it exists, it is called ‚Äúarisen,‚Äù and if it does not exist, it is called ‚Äúnot arisen.‚Äù

original: nges par khyad par can du 'byung bar byed pa yin no zhes shes par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: nges par khyad par can du 'byung bar byed pa yin no zhes shes par byed pa yin la /
translated: This indicates that it is definitely a special kind of cause.

original: da lta yin na rgyu yong na gdon mi za bar 'byung ba'i 'bras bu ni khyab par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: da lta yin na rgyu yong na gdon mi za bar 'byung ba'i 'bras bu ni khyab par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: If it exists in the present, it is a pervasive cause, because if the cause exists, the effect will definitely arise.

original: 'byung ba la sogs pa gzhan las kyang 'gyur ro zhes bsal ba yin te /
analyzed: 'byung ba la sogs pa gzhan las kyang 'gyur ro zhes bsal ba yin te /
translated: But it is not the case that it arises from other things such as the elements.

original: de med na mi byung ba zhes bya bas ni gnyi ga khyab byed nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med na mi byung ba zhes bya bas ni gnyi ga khyab byed nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is excluded by the phrase ‚Äúif it does not exist, it does not arise,‚Äù because it is understood that both are pervasive causes.

original: 'di nyid ni rgyu tshogs pa'i ste /üîΩmtha'i gnas skabs thob pas gzhan la mi ltos pa'i nus pa yongs su gyur pas 'bras bu skye bar te /
analyzed: 'di nyid ni rgyu tshogs pa'i ste / mtha'i gnas skabs thob pas gzhan la mi ltos pa'i nus pa yongs su gyur pas 'bras bu skye bar te /
translated: This is the collection of causes.üîΩThe effect arises from the transformation of the potential that has attained the final stage and does not depend on anything else.

original: gdon mi za bar skye bar rjes su dpog pa'o //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar skye bar rjes su dpog pa'o //
translated: It is inferred that the effect will definitely arise.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu skye ba'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu skye ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú That‚Äù refers to the arising of the effect.

original: rang yang 'di yin la gzhan yang 'di yin pa ni rang bzhin te rgyu yin la de med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir 'bras bu yang khyab byed yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang yang 'di yin la gzhan yang 'di yin pa ni rang bzhin te rgyu yin la de med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir 'bras bu yang khyab byed yin pa'i phyir /
translated: It is a cause because it is the nature of something, and it is a result because it pervades the effect, since the effect does not occur without it.

original: rgyu yang yin no //
analyzed: rgyu yang yin no //
translated: It is also a cause.

original: 'brel pa rjes su dran pa la sogs par ji srid du byed par de srid kho na 'bras bu mngon sum nyid ma yin na ma zhes rjes su dpog pa yin /
analyzed: 'brel pa rjes su dran pa la sogs par ji srid du byed par de srid kho na 'bras bu mngon sum nyid ma yin na ma zhes rjes su dpog pa yin /
translated: As long as it functions in the memory of a relationship and so on, for that long alone, the result is not directly perceived, and it is inferred.

original: bden te thams cad la mngon sum skye ba ma yin la /
analyzed: bden te thams cad la mngon sum skye ba ma yin la /
translated: It is true that direct perception does not arise in all cases.

original: dbang po las 'das pa'am /
analyzed: dbang po las 'das pa'am /
translated: It is also that which is beyond the senses,

original: de ma thag tu nus pa yongs su gyur pas 'brel pa can la yang rjes su dpag pa 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩyang na rang bzhin 'gal ba dmigs pa'am /
analyzed: de ma thag tu nus pa yongs su gyur pas 'brel pa can la yang rjes su dpag pa 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir ro // yang na rang bzhin 'gal ba dmigs pa'am /
translated: or that which is transformed into potential immediately after, and inference engages that which is related to it.üîΩOr, it is the observation of a contradictory nature,

original: khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa yin no //
translated: or the observation of a contradictory pervasion.

original: de ma thag tu zhes ji skad bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ma thag tu zhes ji skad bstan pa yin no //
translated: Immediately after is as it was taught.

original: gnyi ga la yang zhes bya ba ni de med na mi 'byung ba dang / de yod na gdon mi za bar 'byung ba las rgyu nyid yin par ro //üîΩdes na do bzhin du ma tshang bas khyab pa'i 'bras bu mi 'byung ba yin la tshang ba yang ma tshang ba dang 'gal ba'i phyir mi 'byung bas khyab par byed pa 'gal ba'am /
analyzed: gnyi ga la yang zhes bya ba ni de med na mi 'byung ba dang / de yod na gdon mi za bar 'byung ba las rgyu nyid yin par ro // des na do bzhin du ma tshang bas khyab pa'i 'bras bu mi 'byung ba yin la tshang ba yang ma tshang ba dang 'gal ba'i phyir mi 'byung bas khyab par byed pa 'gal ba'am /
translated: ‚ÄúBoth‚Äù means that without it, the effect does not occur, and if it exists, the effect will definitely occur.

original: 'gal ba khyab par grub pa yin no zhes nye bar bsdu ba ni de'i phyir /
analyzed: 'gal ba khyab par grub pa yin no zhes nye bar bsdu ba ni de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, the effect that is pervaded by the incompleteness of the cause does not occur, and because the completeness of the cause is incompatible with the incompleteness of the cause, the pervasion is established as the incompatibility of the pervader.üîΩTo summarize, it is said:

original: ji ltar mthong ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar mthong ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAs it is seen.‚Äù

original: mngon sum nye pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir khyab bya nyid du 'dzin pa'i bya ba can ma yin pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: mngon sum nye pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir khyab bya nyid du 'dzin pa'i bya ba can ma yin pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt the object of direct perception the pervaded?

original: rnam par rtog pas nye bar bslad pa yin gyi dngos po 'jog par byed pa ni ma yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pas nye bar bslad pa yin gyi dngos po 'jog par byed pa ni ma yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: It is thought that it is contaminated by conceptual thought and does not establish the thing.

original: de ltar mthong ba med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de ltar mthong ba med pa'i phyir //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause it is not seen in that way‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba nas /
translated: up to

original: 'di yod par ni ji ltar mthong //
analyzed: 'di yod par ni ji ltar mthong //
translated: ‚Äúhow is its existence seen?‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba'i bar du ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i bar du ste /
translated: up to:

original: khyab pa @202a * //
analyzed: khyab pa @202a * //
translated: The pervasion is

original: can gyi rjes su 'gro ba la sogs pa can kho na 'bras bu nyid la sogs pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: can gyi rjes su 'gro ba la sogs pa can kho na 'bras bu nyid la sogs pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: that only that which has pervasion, concomitance, etc. is a result, etc.

original: lan du zer ba ni /
analyzed: lan du zer ba ni /
translated: The response is:

original: gal te khyab par ma mthong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te khyab par ma mthong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúBecause we do not see pervasion,‚Äù

original: 'di tha snyad du yin zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pas brdzun pa 'dzin pa'i nus pa las /
analyzed: 'di tha snyad du yin zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pas brdzun pa 'dzin pa'i nus pa las /
translated: This is conventional, i.e., from the power of the false apprehension of conceptualization,

original: de 'dra ba'i bag chags las byung ba ci las nyams su myong ba dang 'brel pa 'ga' zhig gi 'bras bu dang 'brel pa dang / de med pa yang gzhan du 'jog par byed pa'i tha snyad dang ldan pa rnams yin no //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i bag chags las byung ba ci las nyams su myong ba dang 'brel pa 'ga' zhig gi 'bras bu dang 'brel pa dang / de med pa yang gzhan du 'jog par byed pa'i tha snyad dang ldan pa rnams yin no //
translated: some arise from the latent potentialities of that sort, and are related to the experience, related to the result, and are endowed with the convention that posits the absence of that as something else.

original: gnyis su med par lta ba nyid ni 'jig rten pha rol la skur pa 'debs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis su med par lta ba nyid ni 'jig rten pha rol la skur pa 'debs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The view of non-duality is a denial of the world beyond.

original: med par smra ba rnams ni lta ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: med par smra ba rnams ni lta ba ma yin nam /
translated: Aren‚Äôt the nihilists non-view?

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: No, they are not.

original: 'jig rten pha rol sgrub pa la 'bad pas bsgrub par bya ba mya ngan las 'das pa gang yin pa de gnyis su med pa yod na /
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol sgrub pa la 'bad pas bsgrub par bya ba mya ngan las 'das pa gang yin pa de gnyis su med pa yod na /
translated: Since nirvana, which is to be accomplished, is accomplished through striving to achieve a future world, if that nonduality exists,

original: 'bad pa med pas 'grub pa'i phyir 'di ni yod par smra ba'i lta ba dam pa yin la /
analyzed: 'bad pa med pas 'grub pa'i phyir 'di ni yod par smra ba'i lta ba dam pa yin la /
translated: it is accomplished without striving. This is the highest view of the existence of things.

original: skyes bu'i don mtho ris dang byang grol la skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba ni med par smra ba'i lta ba yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: skyes bu'i don mtho ris dang byang grol la skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba ni med par smra ba'i lta ba yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The view that repudiates the purpose of human life, the higher realms and liberation, is taught to be the view of the nonexistence of things:

original: gal te gnyis med kyis tshim na //
analyzed: gal te gnyis med kyis tshim na //
translated: If one is satisfied with nonduality,

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: then one will not strive for virtue.

original: gang gi phyir gnyis su med pa'i lta ba ni phyin ci log pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gnyis su med pa'i lta ba ni phyin ci log pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir /
translated: Since the view of nonduality is the opposite of error,

original: de'i bskyed bya skye ba la sogs pa ldog par byed pa dang / gnas pa'i rgyu zhig na zin ba ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i bskyed bya skye ba la sogs pa ldog par byed pa dang / gnas pa'i rgyu zhig na zin ba ldog pa yin no //
translated: it stops the arising of that which is to be produced and so on and stops the cause of endurance once it has already arisen.
