original: yang na 'das pa'i bde ba'i sgrub byed dang ma 'ongs pa'i yang dran pa'i kun tu rtog pa dag gis rtog bzhin pa ni bag chags sad pas sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin la /
analyzed: yang na 'das pa'i bde ba'i sgrub byed dang ma 'ongs pa'i yang dran pa'i kun tu rtog pa dag gis rtog bzhin pa ni bag chags sad pas sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin la /
translated: Or else, the present is being imagined by the imagination of the past as the means of achieving pleasure, and by the imagination of the future as the object of pleasure.

original: de bzhin du da ltar ba yang yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du da ltar ba yang yin te /
translated: And in the same way, the present is also the cause of suffering, because the latent impressions are awakened.

original: mi shes pa ni don gyi sgo nas byed pa ma yin zhes brjod pas so //üîΩgnyis su med pa la gang la la gang gis 'dzin pa las bag chag sad pa'am sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: mi shes pa ni don gyi sgo nas byed pa ma yin zhes brjod pas so // gnyis su med pa la gang la la gang gis 'dzin pa las bag chag sad pa'am sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin te /
translated: And it is not the case that the present is not suffering, because it is said that ignorance is not a cause of suffering from the point of view of its object.

original: bde ba mang du bsgoms pas de'i bag chags sad pa la gegs byas pa'i phyir ro //üîΩdbang po las byung ba'i sdug bsngal nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: bde ba mang du bsgoms pas de'i bag chags sad pa la gegs byas pa'i phyir ro // dbang po las byung ba'i sdug bsngal nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: And it is not the case that the present is not suffering because of the awakening of latent impressions or because of suffering, for someone who has nondualistic intuition, because the cultivation of the many kinds of pleasure prevents the awakening of the latent impressions.

original: bsgom pas khyad par can du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgom pas khyad par can du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And it is not the case that the present is not suffering because of the suffering that arises from the senses, because it is transformed by cultivation.

original: gzugs la sogs pa ni de'i khyad par las khyad par can du 'gyur pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa ni de'i khyad par las khyad par can du 'gyur pa ma yin no //
translated: And it is not the case that the present is not suffering because of the transformation of the senses, because form, etc. are not transformed by the transformation of the senses.

original: 'o na ni phyi rol dang nang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa la brten nas /
analyzed: 'o na ni phyi rol dang nang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa la brten nas /
translated: But then, based on the conceptualization of external and internal, etc.,

original: de las bzlog pa'i gnyis su med pa la skur pa 'debs par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa'i gnyis su med pa la skur pa 'debs par byed pa yin no //
translated: one deprecates the nondual, which is the opposite of that.

original: de lta yin na 'jig rten sgrub par @202b byed pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa las de rjes su bsgrub par 'gyur ba yin gyi 'dod chags la sogs pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni /üîΩtha snyad 'jug par byed na ni //
analyzed: de lta yin na 'jig rten sgrub par @202b byed pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa las de rjes su bsgrub par 'gyur ba yin gyi 'dod chags la sogs pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni / tha snyad 'jug par byed na ni //
translated: If that is so, then one would establish the world, etc., based on conceptualization, and not on passion, etc. The latter half of the verseüîΩis related to the first half:

original: zhes bya ba phyed phyi ma rnam par 'brel pa ni nye bar bslad pa yin gyi 'og tu zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba phyed phyi ma rnam par 'brel pa ni nye bar bslad pa yin gyi 'og tu zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIf one engages in conventional usage, one is not liberated.‚Äù

original: rab tu zhi ba ni thar pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu zhi ba ni thar pa'o //
translated: Liberation is peace.

original: 'dod chags kyi rjes su sgrub pa ni mthong ba'i chos la yang smad pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi rjes su sgrub pa ni mthong ba'i chos la yang smad pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: It is taught that the establishment of passion, etc. is reprehensible even in this life:

original: 'dod chags la sogs pas nye bar bslad pa ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pas nye bar bslad pa ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúOne who is polluted by passion, etc.‚Äù

original: rnam par rtog pa la brten nas 'jig rten pha rol pa la dpyod pa ni de'i yul gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang yan lag can dang / bdag dang bdag gi rnams rjes su bsgrub pa ni 'jig rten pha rol la yin gyi /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa la brten nas 'jig rten pha rol pa la dpyod pa ni de'i yul gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang yan lag can dang / bdag dang bdag gi rnams rjes su bsgrub pa ni 'jig rten pha rol la yin gyi /
translated: The analysis of the world beyond is based on conceptual thought, and the establishment of the objects of that thought, the grasped, the grasper, the possessor of parts, the self, and what belongs to the self, is in regard to the world beyond.

original: dgra la sogs pa rjes su sgrub pa ni mi 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: dgra la sogs pa rjes su sgrub pa ni mi 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa la /
translated: But the establishment of enemies, etc. is not.

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba smos te mthong ba'i rjes su 'brang pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba smos te mthong ba'i rjes su 'brang pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni /
translated: Thus, the phrase ‚Äúin this way‚Äù refers to conceptual thought that follows after seeing.

original: tha snyad kyi mtshan ma yin gyi cig shos ni ma yin no //
analyzed: tha snyad kyi mtshan ma yin gyi cig shos ni ma yin no //
translated: The sign of verbal expression is not the other.

original: de'i phyir gnyis su med pa la sogs pa las ldog pa ni ma yin no zhes mthong ba'i rjes su 'brang ba'i dgos pa bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir gnyis su med pa la sogs pa las ldog pa ni ma yin no zhes mthong ba'i rjes su 'brang ba'i dgos pa bstan pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the avoidance of nonduality, etc. is not. Thus, the purpose of following after seeing is indicated.

original: nges na zhes bya ba ste rnam par rig pa tsam du smra ba la mig la sogs pa la ni rmi lam bzhin du mngon du byed pa tsam gyis mi bden pa yin la /
analyzed: nges na zhes bya ba ste rnam par rig pa tsam du smra ba la mig la sogs pa la ni rmi lam bzhin du mngon du byed pa tsam gyis mi bden pa yin la /
translated: If one is certain, then, for the proponent of representation only, the eye, etc. are not real, like a dream, by the mere experience of them.

original: don byed pa la mi slu ba ni bden pa yin te /
analyzed: don byed pa la mi slu ba ni bden pa yin te /
translated: Being undeceiving with regard to the function of an object is truth.

original: goms pa'i khyad par gyi khyad par can yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: goms pa'i khyad par gyi khyad par can yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is distinguished by the distinction of cultivation.

original: rnam par shes pa tsam phyi rol yin yang 'dod pa tsam 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa tsam phyi rol yin yang 'dod pa tsam 'byung ba yin te /
translated: Even though external objects are mere consciousness, they arise from mere desire,

original: goms pa'i bskyed bya yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: goms pa'i bskyed bya yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are produced by cultivation.üîΩThe summary is:üîΩThe external object is consciousness only, like the other, which is not similar to its characteristics.

original: phyi rol gzhan dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa ni rnam par shes pa kho na bzhin du 'jig rten pha rol pa yin zhes nye bar bsdu ba ni /üîΩmig la sogs pa bden pa nyid dam zhes bya ba'o //üîΩ'bras bu'i khyad par mthong ba las ma mthong ba'i khyad par rtogs pa yin na nus pa can nyid kyis mthong ba kho na goms pa'i brtag bya yin zhes bya ba ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: phyi rol gzhan dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa ni rnam par shes pa kho na bzhin du 'jig rten pha rol pa yin zhes nye bar bsdu ba ni / mig la sogs pa bden pa nyid dam zhes bya ba'o // 'bras bu'i khyad par mthong ba las ma mthong ba'i khyad par rtogs pa yin na nus pa can nyid kyis mthong ba kho na goms pa'i brtag bya yin zhes bya ba ni mi rigs te /
translated: The external object is consciousness only, like the other, which is not similar to its characteristics.

original: 'byung ba'i khyad par yang sra ba nyid la sogs pa mthong ba'i phyir ro snyam du sams  pa ni /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i khyad par yang sra ba nyid la sogs pa mthong ba'i phyir ro snyam du sams  pa ni /
translated: If the distinction of the result is understood from seeing the distinction, then it is not reasonable to say that only the potential is the object of cultivation, because the distinction of the elements is seen, such as solidity.

original: gal te 'byung ba chen po'i khyad par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te 'byung ba chen po'i khyad par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe special qualities of the great elements.üîΩ‚ÄùüîΩThe reply:

original: lan ni / gang du drod gsher sogs skye ba'i //
analyzed: lan ni / gang du drod gsher sogs skye ba'i //
translated: ‚ÄúWhere heat, moisture, etc.

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This is the second chapter, the chapter on the benefits of bodhicitta.

original: sra ba nyid la sogs pa'i khyad par gyi srog la sogs pa ni nges pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sra ba nyid la sogs pa'i khyad par gyi srog la sogs pa ni nges pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The special qualities of solidity, etc. are not the life principle,

original: de med kyang khyad par gzhan la mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med kyang khyad par gzhan la mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are seen to be different from it.

original: de bzhin du shi ba'i lus dang / @203a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du shi ba'i lus dang / @203a * //
translated: In the same way, living beings are seen in a dead body,

original: gzhan la yang srog chags mthong ba yin la /
analyzed: gzhan la yang srog chags mthong ba yin la /
translated: and in other things.üîΩTherefore, it follows that all transformations of the elements produce life, etc.üîΩThe meaning is that it follows that a dead body and a clod of earth, etc.üîΩare also like that.üîΩ‚ÄúThe special qualities‚Äù are the special qualities of solidity, etc.

original: des na 'byung ba yongs su gyur ba thams cad srog la sogs pa skyed par byed pa yin pa'i phyir shi ba'i lus dang bong ba la sogs pa la yang de dang 'dra bar thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des na 'byung ba yongs su gyur ba thams cad srog la sogs pa skyed par byed pa yin pa'i phyir shi ba'i lus dang bong ba la sogs pa la yang de dang 'dra bar thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúThe special qualities of the great elements‚Äù are the special qualities of the great elements, earth, etc.üîΩ‚ÄúThe special qualities of the great elements‚Äù are the special qualities of the great elements, earth, etc.üîΩ‚ÄúThe special qualities of the great elements‚Äù are the special qualities of the great elements, earth, etc.üîΩ‚ÄúThe special qualities of the great elements‚Äù are the special qualities of the great elements, earth, etc.üîΩ‚ÄúThe special qualities of the great elements‚Äù are the special qualities of the great elements, earth, etc.üîΩ‚ÄúThe special qualities of the great elements‚Äù are the special qualities of the great elements, earth, etc.üîΩ‚ÄúThe special qualities of the great elements‚Äù are the special qualities of the great elements, earth, etc.üîΩ‚ÄúThe special qualities of the great elements‚Äù are the special qualities of the great elements, earth, etc.üîΩ‚ÄúThe special qualities of the great elements‚Äù are the special qualities of the great elements, earth, etc.üîΩ‚ÄúThe special qualities of the great elements‚Äù are the special qualities of the great elements, earth, etc.üîΩ‚ÄúThe special qualities of the great elements‚Äù are the special qualities of the great elements, earth, etc.üîΩ‚ÄúThe special qualities of the great elements‚Äù are the special qualities of the great elements, earth, etc.üîΩ‚ÄúThe special qualities of the great elements‚Äù are the special qualities of the great elements, earth, etc.üîΩ‚ÄúThe special qualities of the great elements‚Äù are the special qualities of the great elements, earth, etc.üîΩ‚ÄúThe special qualities of the great elements‚Äù are the special qualities of the great elements, earth, etc.üîΩ‚ÄúThe special qualities of the great elements‚Äù are the special qualities of the great elements, earth, etc.

original: rnam par dbye ba zhes bya ba ni ni nges pa'o //üîΩde'i phyir nges pa can ni de'i phyir nges par byed pa gzhan brtag par bya ba yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par dbye ba zhes bya ba ni ni nges pa'o //üîΩde'i phyir nges pa can ni de'i phyir nges par byed pa gzhan brtag par bya ba yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: ‚ÄúThe special qualities of the great elements‚Äù are the special qualities

original: sems pa'i mtshan nyid kyis las tsam zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sems pa'i mtshan nyid kyis las tsam zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The characteristic of volition is called ‚Äúmere action.‚Äù

original: nges pa can dang nges pa can ma yin ba'i 'bras bu chu la sogs pa las snang bzhin pa ni ma nges pa can ma mthong bar go bar byed pa yin la /
analyzed: nges pa can dang nges pa can ma yin ba'i 'bras bu chu la sogs pa las snang bzhin pa ni ma nges pa can ma mthong bar go bar byed pa yin la /
translated: The result of the uncertain is understood from the uncertain appearance of water, etc.

original: nges pa can dang nges pa can ma yin pa la yang de nyid sbyor bar byed pa bstan pa ni de'i tshe rigs mtshungs pa thams cad ces bya ba ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: nges pa can dang nges pa can ma yin pa la yang de nyid sbyor bar byed pa bstan pa ni de'i tshe rigs mtshungs pa thams cad ces bya ba ni nges pa'o //
translated: The teaching of the application of that very thing to the certain and the uncertain is ‚Äúat that time, all that is of the same type‚Äù is the certain.

original: btsags nas ni chu tshags kyis so //
analyzed: btsags nas ni chu tshags kyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving strained‚Äù is with a water strainer.

original: mi 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni nges pa med pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni nges pa med pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe dissimilar‚Äù is the uncertain.

original: de nyid bstan pa ni mgo dmar ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa ni mgo dmar ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That very thing is taught as ‚Äúthe red-headed.‚Äù

original: nges pa can la nges pa can ma yin par snang ba nyid ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: nges pa can la nges pa can ma yin par snang ba nyid ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching that the certain is not the appearance of the uncertain is

original: de dngos zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de dngos zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äúthat entity.‚Äù

original: mthong 'dod dam ci zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mthong 'dod dam ci zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúWhat is desired to be seen?‚Äù

original: nges med las zhes bya smos so //
analyzed: nges med las zhes bya smos so //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom the uncertain‚Äù is stated.

original: srog chags kyi khyad par ni mthong ba'i sa bon las nges pa can dang / des pa can ma yin par nam yang snang ba ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: srog chags kyi khyad par ni mthong ba'i sa bon las nges pa can dang / des pa can ma yin par nam yang snang ba ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The particularity of the living being is ascertained from the seed of what is seen, and it is taught that it is never seen without a particularity.

original: nam yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nam yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú Never‚Äù is what is said.

original: de'i phyir mthong bar byed brag med pa la yang khyad bar dang ldan pa'i 'bras bu ni /üîΩkhyad par dang ldan par ma mthong bar go bar byed pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir mthong bar byed brag med pa la yang khyad bar dang ldan pa'i 'bras bu ni / khyad par dang ldan par ma mthong bar go bar byed pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: Therefore, even in the absence of a particularity of what is seen, the result that possesses a particularity is understood without seeing the particularity.üîΩThis is taught:

original: las nyid nges par byed pa yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: las nyid nges par byed pa yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe action itself is what ascertains it.‚Äù

original: don med pa'i skye bo dang 'dra ba dang / ma la sogs pa'i rang bzhin phyin ci log par mthong ba las /
analyzed: don med pa'i skye bo dang 'dra ba dang / ma la sogs pa'i rang bzhin phyin ci log par mthong ba las /
translated: Just like a person who is without purpose, from seeing the nature of a mother and so forth in a distorted way,üîΩthe result that is produced by that is not seen.

original: de'i bskyed bya nyid ma yin la phyin ci ma log par mthong ba yin na /
analyzed: de'i bskyed bya nyid ma yin la phyin ci ma log par mthong ba yin na /
translated: But if one sees in an undistorted way,

original: de'i bskyed bya nyid du mthong ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i bskyed bya nyid du mthong ba yin no zhe na /
translated: the result that is produced by that is seen.üîΩIf one sees the nature of a mother and so forth in a distorted way, the result that is produced by that is not seen.üîΩBut if one sees in an undistorted way, the result that is produced by that is seen.üîΩIf one sees the nature of a mother and so forth in a distorted way, the result that is produced by that is not seen.üîΩBut if one sees in an undistorted way, the result that is produced by that is seen.üîΩIf one sees the nature of a mother and so forth in a distorted way, the result that is produced by that is not seen.üîΩBut if one sees in an undistorted way, the result that is produced by that is seen.üîΩIf one sees the nature of a mother and so forth in a distorted way, the result that is produced by that is not seen.üîΩBut if one sees in an undistorted way, the result that is produced by that is seen.üîΩIf one sees the nature of a mother and so forth in a distorted way, the result that is produced by that is not seen.üîΩBut if one sees in an undistorted way, the result that is produced by that is seen.üîΩIf one sees the nature of a mother and so forth in a distorted way, the result that is produced by that is not seen.üîΩBut if one sees in an undistorted way, the result that is produced by that is seen.üîΩIf one sees the nature of a mother and so forth in a distorted way, the result that is produced by that is not seen.üîΩBut if one sees in an undistorted way, the result that is produced by that is seen.

original: gal te 'dod pa la sogs pa pha ma'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te 'dod pa la sogs pa pha ma'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If one sees the nature of a mother and so forth in a distorted way, the result that is produced by

original: goms pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'i khyad par ni srid pa la yod pa yin la /
analyzed: goms pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'i khyad par ni srid pa la yod pa yin la /
translated: The difference of being habituated to something is being habituated to existence in cyclic existence.

original: 'dod pa la sogs pa ni goms pa'i rgyu mtshan yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa la sogs pa ni goms pa'i rgyu mtshan yin te /
translated: Desire and so on are the reasons for habituation.

original: gang gis gang kho na dor ba dang len par 'dod pa dang goms par byed pa de 'di'i goms pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'gyur ba yin la /
analyzed: gang gis gang kho na dor ba dang len par 'dod pa dang goms par byed pa de 'di'i goms pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'gyur ba yin la /
translated: Whatever one desires to discard or adopt and whatever one is habituated to, that is what one becomes through habituation.

original: ma la sogs pa rang bzhin yang 'dis brjod pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi goms par gyur pa de'i phyir /üîΩ'di 'byung ba @203b yin gyi de bzhin du du ba la sogs pa goms pa sngon du 'gro ba can ma yin te /
analyzed: ma la sogs pa rang bzhin yang 'dis brjod pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi goms par gyur pa de'i phyir / 'di 'byung ba @203b yin gyi de bzhin du du ba la sogs pa goms pa sngon du 'gro ba can ma yin te /
translated: Since one is habituated to one's mother and so on from the beginning,

original: rang gi rgyu la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi rgyu la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
translated: this is the cause of love and so on. Smoke and so on are not preceded by habituation because they depend on their own causes.

original: 'dod pa rag las pa dang / cig shos dag la dbye ba med par khas blangs pa yin na /
analyzed: 'dod pa rag las pa dang / cig shos dag la dbye ba med par khas blangs pa yin na /
translated: If you accept that desire and so on are dependent and that there is no difference between them and other things,

original: rnam par dbye ba dang ldan pa'i 'bras bu'i spyi la sogs pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam par dbye ba dang ldan pa'i 'bras bu'i spyi la sogs pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: then the universal of effect and so on would not be differentiated.

original: de'i khyad par 'jig par byed pa'i tshad mas spyi 'jog par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /üîΩ'bras bu'i chos ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i khyad par 'jig par byed pa'i tshad mas spyi 'jog par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni / 'bras bu'i chos ni 'di yin te /
translated: because the valid cognition that destroys that does not posit the universal.üîΩThis is the meaning of the statement:

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The result is this property.

original: du ba la sogs pa yang rang gi rgyu la rag las pa yin na /
analyzed: du ba la sogs pa yang rang gi rgyu la rag las pa yin na /
translated: If smoke, etc., were dependent on their own cause,

original: de las gzhan pa las 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa las 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: they would not arise from something else.

original: bsrub shing bsrubs pa dang / me gzhan las kyang mi 'byung bar mthong la /
analyzed: bsrub shing bsrubs pa dang / me gzhan las kyang mi 'byung bar mthong la /
translated: But it is seen that fire arises from the friction of sticks and from other things.

original: autpala'i rtsa ba dang ba lang gi lci ba las kyang autpala'i rtsa ba 'byung ba de'i phyir goms pa las khyad par gang yin par bstan pa de yang gzhan du yin no //
analyzed: autpala'i rtsa ba dang ba lang gi lci ba las kyang autpala'i rtsa ba 'byung ba de'i phyir goms pa las khyad par gang yin par bstan pa de yang gzhan du yin no //
translated: And an utpala plant arises from the dung of a cow. Therefore, the teaching that a difference is due to habituation is contradicted.

original: 'dod pa la rag las pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa la rag las pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not dependent on desire,

original: 'on kyang rang gi rgyu la rag las pa yin pa'i phyir thal ches pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang rang gi rgyu la rag las pa yin pa'i phyir thal ches pa ma yin no //
translated: but it is not over-pervasive because it is dependent on its own cause.

original: yang na du ba la sogs pa yang 'dod pa la rag las pa yin gyi /
analyzed: yang na du ba la sogs pa yang 'dod pa la rag las pa yin gyi /
translated: Or else, smoke, etc., are dependent on desire,üîΩbut not on the desire of a particular person.

original: rang gi rgyu la rag las pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi rgyu la rag las pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not dependent on its cause.

original: gang gi phyir khyad par gang yin pa gzhan du yang gzhan gyi bskyed byar yang 'gyur ba de goms pa las byung ba yin par brjod pa yin na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir khyad par gang yin pa gzhan du yang gzhan gyi bskyed byar yang 'gyur ba de goms pa las byung ba yin par brjod pa yin na /
translated: If you say that a particular is produced from something else, and that it arises from habituation,

original: du ba la sogs pa yang de bzhin du yin no snyam du sems pa ni /üîΩdu ba du ba las zhes bya ba'o //üîΩlan du / du ba las byung du ba ni /
analyzed: du ba la sogs pa yang de bzhin du yin no snyam du sems pa ni / du ba du ba las zhes bya ba'o // lan du / du ba las byung du ba ni /
translated: then smoke and so on would also be like that.üîΩThe response to that is:

original: ci 'dra / zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ci 'dra / zhes bya ba ste /
translated: What is the smoke that arises from smoke like?

original: rang gi rgyu la rag las pa'i khyad par ni goms pa dang / gzhan las khyad par can du 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi rgyu la rag las pa'i khyad par ni goms pa dang / gzhan las khyad par can du 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
translated: A particular that is dependent on its cause does not arise from habituation and does not become a particular from something else.

original: de yang skye ba'i dang por de kho na bzhin du mthong ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de yang skye ba'i dang por de kho na bzhin du mthong ba yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, it is seen to be just that way at the beginning of its arising.

original: 'dod pa la rag las pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa la rag las pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not dependent on desire.

original: de goms pas khyad par du mi 'gyur ba ma yin la /
analyzed: de goms pas khyad par du mi 'gyur ba ma yin la /
translated: It is not the case that it does not become a particular through habituation.

original: me'i bskyed bya du ba la sogs pa me'i khyad par gyis khyad par du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: me'i bskyed bya du ba la sogs pa me'i khyad par gyis khyad par du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: Smoke and so on, which are produced from fire, do not become particulars from the particular of fire.

original: 'on te du ba yang khyad par dang ldan pa'i 'dod pa la rag las pa kho na yin pa'i phyogs yin pa de lta na yang thal ches pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on te du ba yang khyad par dang ldan pa'i 'dod pa la rag las pa kho na yin pa'i phyogs yin pa de lta na yang thal ches pa yin te /
translated: But if you maintain that smoke is dependent only on the desire for a particular quality, then that is too much.

original: 'jig rten ba rol la skur pa 'debs pa rnams de lta bu khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten ba rol la skur pa 'debs pa rnams de lta bu khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because worldly people do not accept that kind of non-apprehension.

original: de smra ba rnams ni 'dod pa kho na sgrub par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de smra ba rnams ni 'dod pa kho na sgrub par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because those who speak of it establish only desire.

original: de dang 'dra ba kho na yin te /üîΩ'ba' zhig tshad ma med pa'i phyir khas len pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba kho na yin te / 'ba' zhig tshad ma med pa'i phyir khas len pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa bstan pa ni /
translated: It is just like that.
The intention of the statement ‚Äúbecause there is no valid cognition of that alone‚Äù is taught.üîΩSmoke

original: ba zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ba zhes bya ba ste /
translated: is that.

original: du ba de gzhan las kyang ste /
analyzed: du ba de gzhan las kyang ste /
translated: That smoke is also from another,

original: goms pa las kyang skye ba min te /
analyzed: goms pa las kyang skye ba min te /
translated: it is not produced from habit,

original: khyad par du 'gyur ba ma yin kyang /
analyzed: khyad par du 'gyur ba ma yin kyang /
translated: it is not a particular,üîΩbut it is not produced from fire.

original: me las kyang skye ba ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: me las kyang skye ba ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: That is the meaning.

original: de bzhin gnas pa ni goms pa'i khyad par can du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin gnas pa ni goms pa'i khyad par can du 'gyur te /
translated: In the same way, it is a particular of habit,

original: goms pa'i bskyed bya yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: goms pa'i bskyed bya yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: it is produced by habit. That is the meaning.

original: me'i bskyed bya'i me bsrubs pa'i me ni nus pa las khyad par yin te /
analyzed: me'i bskyed bya'i me bsrubs pa'i me ni nus pa las khyad par yin te /
translated: The fire that is the product of rubbing is a particular of fire by virtue of its potency.

original: me de la bsregs pa'i lcags kyi reng bu dang bsregs pa'i rma la /
analyzed: me de la bsregs pa'i lcags kyi reng bu dang bsregs pa'i rma la /
translated: The iron ball that is burned by that fire and the burn that is burned by that fire

original: de'i mod la sha sar skye ba thos pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i mod la sha sar skye ba thos pa yin no //
translated: are heard to be born from the flesh immediately after.üîΩThe nature of the kadalƒ´ tree that is born from the seed and the root is a particular of the kadalƒ´ tree.

original: sa bon dang rtsa ba las skyes pa shing ka da li la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo las khyad par yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa thams cad la yang go bar bya'o //
analyzed: sa bon dang rtsa ba las skyes pa shing ka da li la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo las khyad par yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa thams cad la yang go bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, it is to be understood that all of these are established by the evidence of perception.

original: de'i phyir lus nyid dbugs 'byin par byed pa ma yin nam zhes bya ba la sogs par gang smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir lus nyid dbugs 'byin par byed pa ma yin nam zhes bya ba la sogs par gang smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said that the body itself is not the breather, and so on.

original: rang gi rigs la ltos pa med par mi rig pa kho na yin no zhes nye bar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rang gi rigs la ltos pa med par mi rig pa kho na yin no zhes nye bar bstan pa ni /
translated: It is taught that it is not known without relying on its own type.

original: rigs mtshungs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni legs par brjod pa yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rigs mtshungs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni legs par brjod pa yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: It is said that it is well expressed that it is of a similar type.

original: rang bzhin dang 'bras bu yang yod pa'i sgrub byed yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin dang 'bras bu yang yod pa'i sgrub byed yin te /
translated: Nature and effect are also the evidence for existence.

original: 'di la gnyis ni dngos po sgrub par byed pa dag yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig las so //
analyzed: 'di la gnyis ni dngos po sgrub par byed pa dag yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig las so //
translated: The two are the means of establishing the entity.

original: bdag nyid ma yin pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo la rang bzhin gyis 'brel pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag nyid ma yin pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo la rang bzhin gyis 'brel pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The effect is the means of knowing the entity that is not itself, because it is related to it by its very nature.

original: 'bras bu go byed yin gyi rgyu ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu go byed yin gyi rgyu ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the cause that is the means of knowing,

original: 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no relation between them.

original: rgyu rnams ni gdon mi za bar de dang ldan par 'gyur ba ma yin /
analyzed: rgyu rnams ni gdon mi za bar de dang ldan par 'gyur ba ma yin /
translated: It is not the case that the causes necessarily possess the effect,

original: tshogs pa rnams yin na 'gyur ro zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: tshogs pa rnams yin na 'gyur ro zhe na ma yin te /
translated: because the collection of causes is the means of knowing.

original: bar du bar du gcod pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur bar du gcod pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di ni shes par dka' ba yin te /
analyzed: bar du bar du gcod pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur bar du gcod pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di ni shes par dka' ba yin te /
translated: It is difficult to understand that an obstruction does not arise in the middle.

original: res 'ga' ma mthong ba rnams kyang yang yod par mthong bas the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //üîΩ'bras bu la rung ba nyid kyi rjes su dpog pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: res 'ga' ma mthong ba rnams kyang yang yod par mthong bas the tshom za ba'i phyir ro // 'bras bu la rung ba nyid kyi rjes su dpog pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Because sometimes what was not seen before is seen again, there is doubt.üîΩIf it is argued that the effect is inferred from the suitability of the cause,

original: rung ba nyid kyang 'bras bu la bar du gcod pa med na /
analyzed: rung ba nyid kyang 'bras bu la bar du gcod pa med na /
translated: then even suitability is inferred from the absence of obstruction in the effect.

original: 'di nyid stobs dang ldan pa kho na yin la /üîΩde'i phyir med par nges pa yin na nus pa can kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'di nyid stobs dang ldan pa kho na yin la / de'i phyir med par nges pa yin na nus pa can kho na yin no //
translated: It is only when it is strong that it is a means of valid cognition.üîΩTherefore, if it is ascertained that something does not exist, it is a means of valid cognition.

original: de'i phyir med pa la the tshom za ba kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir med pa la the tshom za ba kho na yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, it is only when there is doubt about the nonexistence of something that it is a means of valid cognition.

original: 'das pa la nges par byed pa'i 'bras bus kyang dgos pa ci yang med pa yin te /
analyzed: 'das pa la nges par byed pa'i 'bras bus kyang dgos pa ci yang med pa yin te /
translated: There is no need for a means of valid cognition to ascertain the past.

original: 'ga' yang 'das pa la 'jug par byed pa ma yin la /
analyzed: 'ga' yang 'das pa la 'jug par byed pa ma yin la /
translated: For no one engages in the past.

original: 'jug pa'i yul nye bar mthong ba yin na tshad @204b ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i yul nye bar mthong ba yin na tshad @204b ma yin gyi /
translated: If the object of engagement is seen, it is a means of valid cognition.

original: srid pa grub pa tsam ni dgos pa med pa'i rgyu mtshan ma yin no //
analyzed: srid pa grub pa tsam ni dgos pa med pa'i rgyu mtshan ma yin no //
translated: But the mere possibility of establishing the past is not a reason for the need for a means of valid cognition.

original: de yi srin bu'i grangs mkhyen pa /
analyzed: de yi srin bu'i grangs mkhyen pa /
translated: The Buddha knows the number of insects,

original: nged la mgar yang nyer mkho med //
analyzed: nged la mgar yang nyer mkho med //
translated: but we have no need of a blacksmith.

original: ces bya bas kyang bkag pa'i phyir ro //üîΩdu ba las sam tshig las me'am /
analyzed: ces bya bas kyang bkag pa'i phyir ro // du ba las sam tshig las me'am /
translated: This passage refutes the existence of a means of valid cognition that establishes the past.

original: smra ba po de'i tshe rjes su dpog pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: smra ba po de'i tshe rjes su dpog pa ni ma yin te /
translated: One does not infer fire from smoke or a speaker from words.

original: 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because there is no relation between them.

original: 'das pa nyid kyang de'i dus su dpog pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'das pa nyid kyang de'i dus su dpog pa ma yin te /
translated: Nor does one infer the past itself at that time.

original: ltos pa med pa nyid kyi rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ltos pa med pa nyid kyi rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not a cause that is independent.

original: gang gi phyir yod pa ma yin pa'i 'bras bu ni rang sgrub pa la gzhan la ltos pa yin gyi yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir yod pa ma yin pa'i 'bras bu ni rang sgrub pa la gzhan la ltos pa yin gyi yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Because an existent effect does not depend on another for its own establishment, but an existent does not.

original: de dang tshogs pa gcig pa la rag las pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de dang tshogs pa gcig pa la rag las pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it depends on the collection of causes and conditions.

original: du bas rang gi dus kyi me rjes su dpog par byed pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: du bas rang gi dus kyi me rjes su dpog par byed pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Smoke infers fire at the time of the smoke.

original: 'bras bu smra ba don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu smra ba don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: The statement of the effect would be meaningless.

original: de'i ched kho na la de smra ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i ched kho na la de smra ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say it is for that purpose alone,

original: de yang 'das pa'i byed pa po'i tshig la 'am dbugs 'byung ba la sogs pa la nus pa med pa yin la des rang gi dus kyi byed pa po'am dbugs 'byin pa la sogs pa rjes su dpog par byed pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de yang 'das pa'i byed pa po'i tshig la 'am dbugs 'byung ba la sogs pa la nus pa med pa yin la des rang gi dus kyi byed pa po'am dbugs 'byin pa la sogs pa rjes su dpog par byed pa ma yin la /
translated: that also is not possible, because the past agent word or the exhalation, etc. are not capable, and it does not infer the past agent or exhalation, etc.

original: du ba la sogs pa gang la dpog ba de yang /
analyzed: du ba la sogs pa gang la dpog ba de yang /
translated: And that which is inferred from smoke, etc.

original: du ba bzhin du 'jug pa'i yul ma yin la /
analyzed: du ba bzhin du 'jug pa'i yul ma yin la /
translated: is not an object of engagement like smoke.

original: 'das pa yang 'jug pa'i yul ma yin te /
analyzed: 'das pa yang 'jug pa'i yul ma yin te /
translated: And the past is not an object of engagement.

original: tshad mar mi nus pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: tshad mar mi nus pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan zin to //
translated: because it is not a valid cognition.

original: rung ba tsam gyi the tshom kho na las 'jug pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rung ba tsam gyi the tshom kho na las 'jug pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that one engages in activity merely out of doubt,

original: de lta na /üîΩ'jig rten pha rol the tshom yang /
analyzed: de lta na / 'jig rten pha rol the tshom yang /
translated: thenüîΩ‚ÄúEven though the wise have doubts about a future world,

original: mkhas rnams mi dge nyid spong ste //
analyzed: mkhas rnams mi dge nyid spong ste //
translated: they still avoid nonvirtue.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba ni de nyid brjod bya yin no //üîΩmtshams sbyor bar //üîΩnus ldan mthong ba gang de la //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de nyid brjod bya yin no // mtshams sbyor bar // nus ldan mthong ba gang de la //
translated: This is what you are saying.üîΩWhy do you say,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ci'i phyir brjod /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ci'i phyir brjod /
translated: ‚ÄúThat which is seen to be capable . . .‚Äù?

original: tshad ma can rnams the tshom la 'jug pa yin zhes bya ba ni legs par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma can rnams the tshom la 'jug pa yin zhes bya ba ni legs par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not right to say that those who have valid cognitions engage in activity out of doubt.

original: de'i phyir 'di dang pha rol la yang rjes su dpag pa las 'jug pa'i yul la the tshom za ba kho na yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di dang pha rol la yang rjes su dpag pa las 'jug pa'i yul la the tshom za ba kho na yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: Therefore, you think that even in this world and the next, one engages in activity out of doubt about the object.

original: 'bras bu las rgyu grub mod ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu las rgyu grub mod ces bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe effect is established from the cause.‚Äù

original: lan ni de bshad pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lan ni de bshad pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The answer is ‚ÄúThat is explained . . . ‚Äù and so on.

original: snga ma snga ma ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: snga ma snga ma ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
translated: ‚ÄúThe former . . . ‚Äù and so on.

original: mi bden sogs pa 'thad par dka' //
analyzed: mi bden sogs pa 'thad par dka' //
translated: It is difficult to accept that what is not real can be a cause.

original: zhes bya ba'i bar gyis /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i bar gyis /
translated: Up to this point.

original: mtshams sbyor bar nus pa dang ldan par mthong ba gang zhes bya ba de tsam rjes su brjod par bya ba nyid grub pa'i don du /üîΩskye ba'i dang por de bzhin gnas //
analyzed: mtshams sbyor bar nus pa dang ldan par mthong ba gang zhes bya ba de tsam rjes su brjod par bya ba nyid grub pa'i don du / skye ba'i dang por de bzhin gnas //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúWhatever is seen as having the capacity to make a connection‚Äù is a mere repetition of what is accepted by others, in order to establish the point that it is possible to connect.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bsgrubs pa nyid spros par byed pa ste /üîΩgnas skabs @205a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bsgrubs pa nyid spros par byed pa ste / gnas skabs @205a * //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúFirst, it exists in that way‚Äù and so on is a further elaboration of the proof.

original: grub pa'i de ma thag pa yin pa'i phyir rgyu ma tshang pa med pa ni mngon sum mam rjes su dpag pa las rtogs pa ni /
analyzed: grub pa'i de ma thag pa yin pa'i phyir rgyu ma tshang pa med pa ni mngon sum mam rjes su dpag pa las rtogs pa ni /
translated: Because it is immediately established, the absence of an incomplete cause is understood from direct perception or inference.

original: 'jig par byed pa ma byung gi bar du gnas pa yin par rtogs pa ni bum pa bzhin du ste /
analyzed: 'jig par byed pa ma byung gi bar du gnas pa yin par rtogs pa ni bum pa bzhin du ste /
translated: The understanding that it endures until the cause of its destruction occurs is like the case of a pot.

original: bum par byung ba ni rgyun yod pa yin la /
analyzed: bum par byung ba ni rgyun yod pa yin la /
translated: The occurrence of a pot is the existence of a continuum.

original: de bzhin du bdag du byed pa dang bcas pa'i sems la sogs pa la yod pa yang rgyun nyid du dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag du byed pa dang bcas pa'i sems la sogs pa la yod pa yang rgyun nyid du dmigs pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, the existence of the mind and so on that is associated with the self is also observed as a continuum.

original: bum pa ni ji srid du 'jig pa'i rgyu ma byung ba de srid du rgyun gnas pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: bum pa ni ji srid du 'jig pa'i rgyu ma byung ba de srid du rgyun gnas pa yin no zhe na /
translated: A pot endures as long as it does not encounter the cause of its destruction.

original: 'di la ni 'jig par byed pa med pa'i phyir phyi mar yang yin no //
analyzed: 'di la ni 'jig par byed pa med pa'i phyir phyi mar yang yin no //
translated: But in this case, it would not be destroyed later, because there would be no cause of its destruction.

original: shi ba'i 'jig par byed pa yin no zhe na /üîΩshi ba'i 'jig byed mthong ba ni /
analyzed: shi ba'i 'jig par byed pa yin no zhe na / shi ba'i 'jig byed mthong ba ni /
translated: Death is the cause of its destruction.üîΩThe cause of the destruction of a living being is seen in this life.

original: de nyid las 'dir 'das pa la'o //
analyzed: de nyid las 'dir 'das pa la'o //
translated: The cause of the destruction of a dead person is seen in the next life.

original: mthong ba la sogs pa med kyang ji ltar lan tshva la sogs pa'i gnod pas bum pa rang nyid rgyun chad par 'gyur ba ni ma yin nam /
analyzed: mthong ba la sogs pa med kyang ji ltar lan tshva la sogs pa'i gnod pas bum pa rang nyid rgyun chad par 'gyur ba ni ma yin nam /
translated: Even though there is no seeing, etc., is it not the case that a pot is destroyed by the destruction of its continuum, due to the harm caused by salt, etc.?

original: de bzhin du sems la sogs pa yang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems la sogs pa yang ngo //
translated: In the same way, the mind, etc., are also destroyed.

original: de la phan par byed pa'i nga rgyal la sogs pa bdag med ba mthong bas nye bar mthong ba yin no de ltar 'gyur ba zhig na ni /
analyzed: de la phan par byed pa'i nga rgyal la sogs pa bdag med ba mthong bas nye bar mthong ba yin no de ltar 'gyur ba zhig na ni /
translated: The harm caused by seeing the selflessness of pride, etc., which are helpful to it, is seen.

original: so so'i skye bo ni de ltar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo ni de ltar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: But this is not the case for ordinary beings.

original: de'i phyir de ni rang nyid rgyun chad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni rang nyid rgyun chad pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that its continuum is destroyed by itself.

original: bum pa zhes bya ba'am sngon po zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i rjes su 'brang ba'i rnam par rtog pa yin te /
analyzed: bum pa zhes bya ba'am sngon po zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i rjes su 'brang ba'i rnam par rtog pa yin te /
translated: The thought ‚Äúpot‚Äù or the thought ‚Äúblue‚Äù is a thought that follows after seeing.

original: tho bar bya ba'i 'bras bur mthong ba la de nyid kyis nges par byed pa yin zhes /
analyzed: tho bar bya ba'i 'bras bur mthong ba la de nyid kyis nges par byed pa yin zhes /
translated: It is seen to be the effect of the hammer, and it is that which ascertains.

original: tshad ma nyid sems pa zhes bya bar rnam par dpyad par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma nyid sems pa zhes bya bar rnam par dpyad par bya ba yin no //
translated: It is to be analyzed as to whether it is a valid cognition.

original: ji skad du dngul du 'dzin pa ni yun ring por gnas par 'dzin pa yin te /
analyzed: ji skad du dngul du 'dzin pa ni yun ring por gnas par 'dzin pa yin te /
translated: As it is said, ‚ÄúThe apprehension of silver is the apprehension of something that endures for a long time.

original: ji srid du ma 'ongs pa'i nya phyis kyi shes pa'i dus kyi bar du khyab pa yin la /
analyzed: ji srid du ma 'ongs pa'i nya phyis kyi shes pa'i dus kyi bar du khyab pa yin la /
translated: It is pervaded by the time of the future oyster consciousness.

original: de bzhin du de lta bu'i du ba las kyang me shes pa la yang 'jug pa'i dus na yod pa khyab pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du de lta bu'i du ba las kyang me shes pa la yang 'jug pa'i dus na yod pa khyab pa nyid yin no //
translated: In the same way, the cognition of fire from such smoke is also pervaded by the time of its existence when it is engaged in the cognition of fire.

original: de'i bar du 'jig par byed pa nye bar 'ongs pa the tshom za ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: de'i bar du 'jig par byed pa nye bar 'ongs pa the tshom za ba ma yin nam /
translated: Is it not doubtful that in the meantime a destroyer has come?

original: ji ltar tshad ma nyid yin /
analyzed: ji ltar tshad ma nyid yin /
translated: How can it be a valid cognition?

original: 'jog par byed pa yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: 'jog par byed pa yin du zin kyang /
translated: Even if it is a determiner,

original: yod pa nyid ces da ltar ba bzhin du tshad ma nyid ma nyams pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: yod pa nyid ces da ltar ba bzhin du tshad ma nyid ma nyams pa nyid yin te /
translated: Existence is like the present, and the valid cognition itself is not impaired,

original: thob par byed pa'i nus pas tshad ma nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thob par byed pa'i nus pas tshad ma nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the ability to attain is valid cognition.

original: yang na shes pa gang la bang du chod pa de med par nges pa'i shes pa de ni thob par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: yang na shes pa gang la bang du chod pa de med par nges pa'i shes pa de ni thob par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: Or, the cognition that ascertains the absence of obstruction in that cognition is the attainment,

original: gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: but not any other.

original: 'di 'dra ba'i nges pa ni 'jig rten du rnyed bla ba yin gyi yang dag par gsungs pa las /
analyzed: 'di 'dra ba'i nges pa ni 'jig rten du rnyed bla ba yin gyi yang dag par gsungs pa las /
translated: Such certainty is easy to find in the world, but in the perfect teachings,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa @205b brten pa nyid du rtogs pa la /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa @205b brten pa nyid du rtogs pa la /
translated: one realizes the omniscience of the Buddha,

original: 'di 'dra ba'i the tshom yang med do //
analyzed: 'di 'dra ba'i the tshom yang med do //
translated: and there is no such doubt.

original: de ni de 'dra ba'i gsung las mdzad pa chen po las 'gro ba ma lus pa'i de kho na nyid thugs su chud pas /
analyzed: de ni de 'dra ba'i gsung las mdzad pa chen po las 'gro ba ma lus pa'i de kho na nyid thugs su chud pas /
translated: From such teachings, through the great deeds, he comprehended the reality of all beings without exception,

original: 'gro ba'i bya ba mi zad pa dang bsod nams la sogs pa'i tshogs chen po rdzogs pa rnams rgyun chad pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'gro ba'i bya ba mi zad pa dang bsod nams la sogs pa'i tshogs chen po rdzogs pa rnams rgyun chad pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir /
translated: and because there is no cause for interrupting the great accumulations of merit and so on and the endless activities of beings,

original: shin tu rgyun mi 'chad pa'i chos can du nges pa /üîΩda ltar yang bsnyen bkur bya ba kho na yin la /
analyzed: shin tu rgyun mi 'chad pa'i chos can du nges pa / da ltar yang bsnyen bkur bya ba kho na yin la /
translated: It is certain that the effect is of the same nature as the cause.

original: de bzhin du 'jig rten pha rol tu rgyun du yang yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'jig rten pha rol tu rgyun du yang yin no //
translated: It is now being served, and in the same way it will be served in the next world.

original: 'jig rten 'di pa'i rjes su dpag par yod du zin kyang /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di pa'i rjes su dpag par yod du zin kyang /
translated: Even though the effect is inferred from the present world,

original: 'jig rten pha rol po ni nges pa'i 'bras bu can ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol po ni nges pa'i 'bras bu can ma yin te /
translated: the next world is not without a definite effect,

original: ma mthong ba'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gang smras pa de bsal ba yin te /
analyzed: ma mthong ba'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gang smras pa de bsal ba yin te /
translated: because it is not seen.

original: rgyun gyi rgyu rtog pa ma yin pa nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyun gyi rgyu rtog pa ma yin pa nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The cause of the continuum is not imagined, because it is definite.

original: mtshams sbyor bar /
analyzed: mtshams sbyor bar /
translated: In the Pratƒ´tyasamutpƒÅda it is said:

original: nus ldan mthong ba gang de la //
analyzed: nus ldan mthong ba gang de la //
translated: ‚ÄúWhat is seen is capable of being seen.

original: ci zhig yod ces bya bas /üîΩrgyu ni gdon mi za bar 'byung ba'i 'bras bu can nyid du bstan pa yin zhing /
analyzed: ci zhig yod ces bya bas / rgyu ni gdon mi za bar 'byung ba'i 'bras bu can nyid du bstan pa yin zhing /
translated: What is there?‚ÄùüîΩThus, the cause is taught to be necessarily productive of an effect.

original: de yang de med na mi 'byung ba'i 'bras bu kho na yin par yang ngo //
analyzed: de yang de med na mi 'byung ba'i 'bras bu kho na yin par yang ngo //
translated: And that effect is only one that does not occur in the absence of the cause.

original: de ni de'i tshe mtshams sbyor bar nus pa dang ldan pa gang yin pa ni snga ma snga ma ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /üîΩmig la sogs pa bden pa nyid dam /
analyzed: de ni de'i tshe mtshams sbyor bar nus pa dang ldan pa gang yin pa ni snga ma snga ma ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas / mig la sogs pa bden pa nyid dam /
translated: That which is able to make contact at that time is the prior one, etc.üîΩIt is true that the eye, etc. are real,

original: phyi rol gyi don yin pa de lta na yang //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don yin pa de lta na yang //
translated: or external objects.

original: rang bzhin 'di thog ma med pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang bzhin 'di thog ma med pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: However, since this nature is beginningless,

original: 'khor ba thog mtha' med pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyis bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'khor ba thog mtha' med pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyis bstan pa yin no //
translated: samsara is beginningless.

original: de yod pa nyid ni 'byung ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de yod pa nyid ni 'byung ba'i phyir //
translated: This teaches that since it exists,

original: 'bras bu ni nges pa can yin la /
analyzed: 'bras bu ni nges pa can yin la /
translated: the effect is definite,

original: rgyu ni nges par byed pa yin par bstan pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rgyu ni nges par byed pa yin par bstan pa yin gyi /
translated: and the cause is the definite producer.

original: 'byung ba kho na zhes bya ba gang du dgos pa yin te /
analyzed: 'byung ba kho na zhes bya ba gang du dgos pa yin te /
translated: But where is there a need to say ‚Äúonly‚Äù?

original: nges par byed pa yin pa la ni de bzhin du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: nges par byed pa yin pa la ni de bzhin du 'gyur gyi /
translated: If it is the definite producer, then it is so.

original: de lta bu nyid rtogs pa'i yan lag kyang ma yin la /
analyzed: de lta bu nyid rtogs pa'i yan lag kyang ma yin la /
translated: But it is not a part of the realization of that.

original: nges pa can nyid gzhan du mi 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: nges pa can nyid gzhan du mi 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
translated: And the definite one does not become otherwise.

original: de yong na res 'ga' 'byung bas nges pa can nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yong na res 'ga' 'byung bas nges pa can nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because if it were to occur, it would be understood to be certain to occur on every occasion.

original: mi rigs te thal ches pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi rigs te thal ches pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not reasonable, because it is absurd.

original: rgyu ma yin pa la yang res 'ga' 'byung ba yod pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu ma yin pa la yang res 'ga' 'byung ba yod pa yin no //
translated: Sometimes, even when there is no cause, an effect occurs.

original: de la ni de yong pa nyid na zhes bya ba med pa yin no zhe na //
analyzed: de la ni de yong pa nyid na zhes bya ba med pa yin no zhe na //
translated: But in that case, it is not the case that when it exists, it occurs.

original: de yod pa nyid na zhes bya ba 'di yang 'bras bu ni de'i dbang nyid yin par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de yod pa nyid na zhes bya ba 'di yang 'bras bu ni de'i dbang nyid yin par brjod pa yin no //
translated: When it exists, the effect is said to be under its power.

original: gang gi tshe ma tshang ba med pa'i rgyu mtshan de yod kyang /
analyzed: gang gi tshe ma tshang ba med pa'i rgyu mtshan de yod kyang /
translated: Even when the cause is complete,

original: rang nyid kho na mi 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: rang nyid kho na mi 'byung ba yin no //
translated: it does not occur by itself.

original: de'i tshe de'i dbang du 'gyur ba ma yin no //üîΩgang gi phyir de yod pa la dbang @206a * //
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i dbang du 'gyur ba ma yin no // gang gi phyir de yod pa la dbang @206a * //
translated: At that time, it is not under its power.

original: ba ni de yod na mi 'byung ba ma yin la /
analyzed: ba ni de yod na mi 'byung ba ma yin la /
translated: Because when it exists, it is not the case that it does not occur.

original: de'i tshe rgyu med pa nyid du shes pa yin no /
analyzed: de'i tshe rgyu med pa nyid du shes pa yin no /
translated: At that time, it is understood to be causeless.

original: 'bras bu'i dus su yang de nyid yin pa'i phyir rgyu ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i dus su yang de nyid yin pa'i phyir rgyu ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur zhing /
translated: Even at the time of the effect, it is not the cause because it is the same.

original: 'bras bu ni rang dbang du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'bras bu ni rang dbang du 'gyur te /
translated: The result is independent,

original: rang nyid kho na res 'ga' 'byung ba'am mi 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: rang nyid kho na res 'ga' 'byung ba'am mi 'byung ba yin no //
translated: because it sometimes occurs and sometimes does not occur by itself alone.

original: gal te rang dbang yin na de mad kyang ci ste 'byung bar mi 'gyur ji ltar mthong ba de kho na bzhin du 'gyur ba yin la /
analyzed: gal te rang dbang yin na de mad kyang ci ste 'byung bar mi 'gyur ji ltar mthong ba de kho na bzhin du 'gyur ba yin la /
translated: If it were independent, then even when the cause does not exist, how could the result not occur? It would occur just as it is seen.

original: nges pa can du mthong ba dang rang dbang nyid ni 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: nges pa can du mthong ba dang rang dbang nyid ni 'gal ba yin no //
translated: It is contradictory that it is seen to be certain and independent.

original: de'i phyir nges pa can mthong ba las de'i dbang du 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir nges pa can mthong ba las de'i dbang du 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is certain that it is dependent on that cause, because it is seen.

original: de la yang res 'ga' mi 'byung na gzhan la ni smos kyang ci dgos /üîΩde med pa ni rang dbang yin pa ni de med kyang yod la /
analyzed: de la yang res 'ga' mi 'byung na gzhan la ni smos kyang ci dgos / de med pa ni rang dbang yin pa ni de med kyang yod la /
translated: If it does not occur even when that cause exists, then what need is there to mention when the cause does not exist?

original: yod kyang res 'ga' yod pa'i thams cad du cis med pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: yod kyang res 'ga' yod pa'i thams cad du cis med pa yin zhe na /
translated: If the result exists even when the cause does not exist, and if it exists even when it sometimes exists, then why does it not exist everywhere?

original: 'bras bus gegs byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bus gegs byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the result is obstructed.

original: de yang yod na gegs byed kyi med na ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang yod na gegs byed kyi med na ni ma yin no //
translated: If the cause exists, then the result is obstructed. If the cause does not exist, then it is not obstructed.

original: med pa nyid la ci'i phyir ma yin zhe na rgyu med na de med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba yin gyi yod na ni ma yin no ;
analyzed: med pa nyid la ci'i phyir ma yin zhe na rgyu med na de med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba yin gyi yod na ni ma yin no ;
translated: But if it exists, it is not nonexistent.

original: / snga na yod pa med pas bar du bcad pa'i phyir zhes bstan pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: / snga na yod pa med pas bar du bcad pa'i phyir zhes bstan pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is taught that it is obstructed because it does not exist prior to the cause,

original: de lta na gang gi tshe 'bras bu yin pa de'i tshe yang rgyu tsam gyi gnas skabs na de med pa yod pa'i phyir bar du chod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na gang gi tshe 'bras bu yin pa de'i tshe yang rgyu tsam gyi gnas skabs na de med pa yod pa'i phyir bar du chod par 'gyur ro //
translated: then when it is the effect, it is also obstructed because it exists when the state of the cause alone exists.

original: rgyu ni med pas bsgribs nas nan gyis 'bras bu bskyed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu ni med pas bsgribs nas nan gyis 'bras bu bskyed pa yin zhe na /
translated: If you say that the cause is obstructed because it is nonexistent and it generates the effect with difficulty,

original: gzhan gyi tshe yang de dang 'dra ba lan na gyis skyed par byed par 'gyur ba'i phyir med pas bar du bcad pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi tshe yang de dang 'dra ba lan na gyis skyed par byed par 'gyur ba'i phyir med pas bar du bcad pa ni ma yin no //
translated: then it would generate it at another time as well, because it is similar. Therefore it is not obstructed by nonexistence.

original: 'bras bu ni rang nyid kho na mi 'byung ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'bras bu ni rang nyid kho na mi 'byung ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the effect does not arise by itself,

original: rang nyid kho na 'byung bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang nyid kho na 'byung bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: it would arise by itself.

original: gzhan dbang nyid du rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan dbang nyid du rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is understood to be dependent on another,

original: gdon mi za bar 'byung ba yang de'i khyab byed du 'gyur la /
analyzed: gdon mi za bar 'byung ba yang de'i khyab byed du 'gyur la /
translated: and the invariable occurrence of the effect would be the pervasion of that.üîΩBut the causes would not invariably possess that.

original: rgyu rnams ni gdon mi za bar de dang ldan par mi 'gyur ro zhes ma tshang ba'i gnas skabs la ltos nas yin la /
analyzed: rgyu rnams ni gdon mi za bar de dang ldan par mi 'gyur ro zhes ma tshang ba'i gnas skabs la ltos nas yin la /
translated: This is in terms of the incomplete state.

original: gdon mi za bar 'byung ba yang yod pa tsam las ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gdon mi za bar 'byung ba yang yod pa tsam las ni ma yin gyi /
translated: And the invariable occurrence of the effect is not just from mere existence.

original: 'on kyang nges pa can nyid ni rgyu mtshan yin la /
analyzed: 'on kyang nges pa can nyid ni rgyu mtshan yin la /
translated: But rather, the certainty is the reason.

original: de med na rang dbang nyid kyis nges pa can med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de med na rang dbang nyid kyis nges pa can med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is absent, then the certainty is absent by its own power.

original: nges pa can nyid ni 'bras bu nyid ma yin pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: nges pa can nyid ni 'bras bu nyid ma yin pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt the certainty itself the effect?

original: shing sha ba yang shing gi de nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shing sha ba yang shing gi de nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it follows that the ≈õim≈õapƒÅ tree is the reality of the tree.

original: ldog pa nges pa nyid kho na 'bras bu nyid yin te /
analyzed: ldog pa nges pa nyid kho na 'bras bu nyid yin te /
translated: Only the certainty of the exclusion is the effect,

original: de las mi skyen de la mi 'khrul par nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las mi skyen de la mi 'khrul par nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because without it, there is no certainty that it does not arise from that and is not mistaken for that.

original: smin drug shar ba la sogs pa las @206b snar ma yang nye ba la sogs pa yin par 'dis bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: smin drug shar ba la sogs pa las @206b snar ma yang nye ba la sogs pa yin par 'dis bshad pa yin no //
translated: This explains that the m·πõga≈õƒÅrikƒÅ, etc., are near, etc., from the rising of M·πõga≈õiras, etc.

original: de med na mi 'byung bar nges pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de med na mi 'byung bar nges pa yin gyi /
translated: It is certain that without that, it will not occur.üîΩ

original: gdon mi za bar 'byung ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar 'byung ba ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the case that it must exist.

original: de dang 'dra ba kho na yin pa de las mi 'byung na de ji ltar nges par byed pa yin zhing /
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba kho na yin pa de las mi 'byung na de ji ltar nges par byed pa yin zhing /
translated: If it is only similar to that, and does not arise from that, how can it be a determiner of that?

original: de nges par byed pa ma yin na de la ji ltar nges pa zhes bya ba yin /
analyzed: de nges par byed pa ma yin na de la ji ltar nges pa zhes bya ba yin /
translated: And if it is not a determiner of that, how can it be determined by that?

original: shing ni shing sha pa gdon mi za bar yod pa kho nar nges par byed pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: shing ni shing sha pa gdon mi za bar yod pa kho nar nges par byed pa kho na yin te /
translated: A tree is only a determiner of the existence of a ≈õim≈õapƒÅ tree,

original: de dang ldan pa ma yin pa de ni de'i nges par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩshing ma yin pa rnam par gcod pa 'ba' zhig gis sam /
analyzed: de dang ldan pa ma yin pa de ni de'i nges par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro // shing ma yin pa rnam par gcod pa 'ba' zhig gis sam /
translated: because that which does not possess it is not a determiner of it.üîΩIf it is only by the exclusion of non-tree,

original: me ma yin pa rnam par gcod pas nges bzhin pa na /
analyzed: me ma yin pa rnam par gcod pas nges bzhin pa na /
translated: or by the exclusion of non-fire, that there is determination,

original: de dang de ma yin pa rgyud kyis so sor snang ba yin te /
analyzed: de dang de ma yin pa rgyud kyis so sor snang ba yin te /
translated: then that and its opposite appear separately in the continuum.

original: gzhan du na nges par bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na nges par bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would be impossible to determine.

original: du ba la sogs pa ni nges pa la yang nges pa can kho na yin te /
analyzed: du ba la sogs pa ni nges pa la yang nges pa can kho na yin te /
translated: Smoke and so on are only determiners of what is determined,üîΩbecause they are not seen in the opposite.

original: nges pa can de kho na rjes su 'brangs ba rnams ni de yod pa nyid na 'byung la /üîΩde med na mi 'byung ba kho na yin zhes bya ba la sogs par tha snyad du byed kyi /
analyzed: nges pa can de kho na rjes su 'brangs ba rnams ni de yod pa nyid na 'byung la / de med na mi 'byung ba kho na yin zhes bya ba la sogs par tha snyad du byed kyi /
translated: Those who are certain about that alone follow it, and they make the convention that ‚Äúwhen that exists, this occurs;üîΩwhen that does not exist, this does not occur.‚Äù

original: de med na mi 'byung ba ni de la nges par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de med na mi 'byung ba ni de la nges par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: But the mere fact that this does not occur when that does not exist does not prove that this is produced from that.

original: de dag tsam ni nges par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag tsam ni nges par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that alone does not prove it.

original: 'bras bu bzhin du rgyu yang de med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir khyad par med pas rtogs par byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu bzhin du rgyu yang de med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir khyad par med pas rtogs par byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as the effect is not different from the cause, because the cause does not occur when that does not exist, it is understood that the cause is not different from the effect.

original: de'i phyir 'bras bu'am rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin zhes bya ba'i phyag rgya chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'bras bu'am rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin zhes bya ba'i phyag rgya chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the seal is broken, saying, ‚ÄúIt is either an effect or a reason based on the nature of things.‚Äù

original: de ltar rtogs pa yin na de yang 'bras bu nyid yin pas khyad par med pa kho na yin pa'i phyir phyag rgya gcad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar rtogs pa yin na de yang 'bras bu nyid yin pas khyad par med pa kho na yin pa'i phyir phyag rgya gcad pa ma yin no //
translated: If it is understood in that way, then because that is also an effect, there is no difference, and therefore the seal is not broken.

original: de lta yin na da ltar rgyu nyid bor ba yin pa la ma bor na ni de yang go bar byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir de dang 'dra bar phyag rgya gcad pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta yin na da ltar rgyu nyid bor ba yin pa la ma bor na ni de yang go bar byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir de dang 'dra bar phyag rgya gcad pa yin no //
translated: If that were so, then the cause would be abandoned at the present time, but if it were not abandoned, then it would be like the probans, because it is the very thing that is to be proven.üîΩGranted, but if it is just like that, then it is just the effect.

original: bden te 'ba' zhig de bzhin na 'byung ba kho na yin zhe na de nyid kho na nges par bya ba yin no //üîΩ'byung bar byed pa kho na bdag nyid kyi yang de dang bral ba'i gnas skabs la gnod par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: bden te 'ba' zhig de bzhin na 'byung ba kho na yin zhe na de nyid kho na nges par bya ba yin no // 'byung bar byed pa kho na bdag nyid kyi yang de dang bral ba'i gnas skabs la gnod par byed pa yin no //
translated: If it is just the effect, then it is the very thing that is to be proven.üîΩBut if it is the very thing that is to be proven, then it is not the probans.

original: de'i phyir khongs su gtogs pa'i bskyed bya nyid kho na skyed par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir skyon med do //üîΩre zhig 'bras bu de ltar rtogs pa ni go byed yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir khongs su gtogs pa'i bskyed bya nyid kho na skyed par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir skyon med do // re zhig 'bras bu de ltar rtogs pa ni go byed yin la /
translated: Therefore, there is no fault, because the very thing that is to be produced, which is included in the effect, is the very thing that produces it.üîΩThe effect is the very thing that is to be proven, because it is the very thing that is to be understood.

original: rgyu yang de nyid du rtogs bzhin pa ni 'bras bu kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: rgyu yang de nyid du rtogs bzhin pa ni 'bras bu kho na yin gyi /
translated: The cause is the very thing that is to be proven, because it is the very thing that is being understood.üîΩBut it is not the very thing that is to be proven, because it is the very thing that is being understood.

original: 'ba' zhig ni ma yin te gang gis gtan tshigs gsum par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig ni ma yin te gang gis gtan tshigs gsum par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the third probans is not the very thing that is to be proven.

original: gal te yang goms pa las byung ba yin na de'i @207a * //üîΩkhyad par can du byas pa'i dbugs la sogs pa lus sam /
analyzed: gal te yang goms pa las byung ba yin na de'i @207a * // khyad par can du byas pa'i dbugs la sogs pa lus sam /
translated: If it arises from cultivation,üîΩthen what is the need for the transformation of the body or the elements,

original: 'byung ba rnams yongs su gyur pa'i khyad par yang rung ba /
analyzed: 'byung ba rnams yongs su gyur pa'i khyad par yang rung ba /
translated: such as the breath, which are qualified by that cultivation?

original: dbye ba du ma las cis ltos pa yin //
analyzed: dbye ba du ma las cis ltos pa yin //
translated: What is the need for the many divisions?

original: de'i phyir yongs su gyur pa'am khyad par las 'byung ba goms pas khyad par du byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir yongs su gyur pa'am khyad par las 'byung ba goms pas khyad par du byed pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, the transformation or the difference that arises from cultivation is the qualifier.

original: me la sogs pa dang phrad pas gzugs la sogs pa lta bu yin gyi /üîΩgoms pa'i bskyed bya yang khyad par las sam /
analyzed: me la sogs pa dang phrad pas gzugs la sogs pa lta bu yin gyi / goms pa'i bskyed bya yang khyad par las sam /
translated: It is like the form, etc., that arises from contact with fire, etc.

original: yongs su gyur pa las gcig gi rnam par 'gyur ba can ma yin te /
analyzed: yongs su gyur pa las gcig gi rnam par 'gyur ba can ma yin te /
translated: The product of cultivation is not a transformation of one thing into another,

original: sna tshogs nyid du mthong ba'i phyir ro //üîΩsna tshogs pa de nyid yongs su gyur ba'am /
analyzed: sna tshogs nyid du mthong ba'i phyir ro // sna tshogs pa de nyid yongs su gyur ba'am /
translated: because it is seen to be manifold.üîΩIf that very manifold thing is the transformation

original: gzhan yang 'gro ba sna tshogs ba nyid kyi rgyu yod pa yin na /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'gro ba sna tshogs ba nyid kyi rgyu yod pa yin na /
translated: or the cause of the manifold world,

original: cis rang gi rigs kyi rgyur rtog pa yin /
analyzed: cis rang gi rigs kyi rgyur rtog pa yin /
translated: why imagine that it is the cause of its own class?

original: 'bras bu dang rgyu nyid med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu dang rgyu nyid med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it the case that there is no effect and cause,

original: yongs su gyur pa la sogs pa sna tshogs pa nyid rgyu nyid du mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su gyur pa la sogs pa sna tshogs pa nyid rgyu nyid du mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because a transformation, etc., is seen to be the cause of a variety.

original: da ltar ni goms pa las yongs su gyur pa la sogs pa las 'byung ba'i phyir skye ba dang po la de bzhin du bstan pa yin na //
analyzed: da ltar ni goms pa las yongs su gyur pa la sogs pa las 'byung ba'i phyir skye ba dang po la de bzhin du bstan pa yin na //
translated: Now, because of habituation, it arises from a transformation, etc., and therefore it is taught that way in the first stage.

original: zhe na yang /
analyzed: zhe na yang /
translated: But if you say that

original: me dang phrad pa las snga rol du yang gzugs la sogs pa kho na yin pa'i phyir phyis kyi bzhin du de las 'byung ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: me dang phrad pa las snga rol du yang gzugs la sogs pa kho na yin pa'i phyir phyis kyi bzhin du de las 'byung ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: because form, etc., exist prior to contact with fire, it would arise from that, as it does later.

original: sngon po nyid dang dmar po la sogs pa'i dbye ba yin na ni mtshungs pa yin te /
analyzed: sngon po nyid dang dmar po la sogs pa'i dbye ba yin na ni mtshungs pa yin te /
translated: If it is a distinction of blue, red, etc., it is the same,

original: 'di la yang ji ltar yang dbye ba mthong ba'i phyir ro//
analyzed: 'di la yang ji ltar yang dbye ba mthong ba'i phyir ro//
translated: because here also a distinction is seen.

original: de'i phyir dang po yongs su gyur pa'i bye brag las 'byung ba ni dbugs la sogs pa yin la yongs su gyur pa la sogs pa yang snang ba'am /
analyzed: de'i phyir dang po yongs su gyur pa'i bye brag las 'byung ba ni dbugs la sogs pa yin la yongs su gyur pa la sogs pa yang snang ba'am /
translated: Therefore, arising from a transformation, etc., is due to a distinction in the first transformation, and the transformation, etc., is either an appearance or not.

original: gzhan yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is not another.

original: khyad par du rtogs pa dogs pa med ba'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: khyad par du rtogs pa dogs pa med ba'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa la /
translated: In particular, because there is no doubt about the realization.

original: gang du drod gsher la sogs skye ba'i zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gang du drod gsher la sogs skye ba'i zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In response to this, Vasubandhu says, ‚ÄúWhere would heat, moisture, etc. arise?‚Äù

original: re zhig 'byung ba rnams kyi sems pa dang / cig shos la sogs pa rnams kyis 'di rnam par dbye ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig 'byung ba rnams kyi sems pa dang / cig shos la sogs pa rnams kyis 'di rnam par dbye ba ni ma yin te /
translated: The mind of the elements and the mind of the other, etc., do not distinguish this,

original: thams cad la srog chags skye ba mthong bas sra ba la sogs pa'i khyad par ni nges par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad la srog chags skye ba mthong bas sra ba la sogs pa'i khyad par ni nges par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the difference of solidity, etc., is not ascertained, since living beings are seen to be born in everything.

original: khyad par can yongs su gyur pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: khyad par can yongs su gyur pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is there a transformation of the special ones,

original: 'byung ba rnams kyi khyad par du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba rnams kyi khyad par du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the difference of the elements is not tenable.

original: 'phel ba dang 'grib pa dag 'dres pa'i khyad par can du gyur ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'phel ba dang 'grib pa dag 'dres pa'i khyad par can du gyur ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is asked whether the special ones become mixed with the increase and decrease,

original: 'byung ba las khyad par med na 'dres pa'i 'phel ba dang 'grib pa dag gi gzhan sems pa can la sogs pa yongs su gyur pa ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: 'byung ba las khyad par med na 'dres pa'i 'phel ba dang 'grib pa dag gi gzhan sems pa can la sogs pa yongs su gyur pa ni mi rigs te /
translated: if there is no difference from the elements, it is not tenable that the transformation of the other, the mind, etc., is mixed with the increase and decrease.

original: ba glang dang rta la sogs pa @207b pa'i 'dres pa'i khyad par gyis /üîΩde'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i dngos po skye bar mthong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: ba glang dang rta la sogs pa @207b pa'i 'dres pa'i khyad par gyis / de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i dngos po skye bar mthong ba ma yin no //
translated: due to the specific mixing of the cow, horse, etc.

original: chang la sogs pa ni de ma yin pa'i ngo bo yin no zhe na /
analyzed: chang la sogs pa ni de ma yin pa'i ngo bo yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the nature of the cow, etc., is not the nature of the wine, etc.,

original: ma yin te de la yang log par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te de la yang log par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then that is not so, because there is a misconception about that.

original: gang gi phyir 'gro ba yongs su gyur pa thams cad kho na rtsod pa'i gzhi yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'gro ba yongs su gyur pa thams cad kho na rtsod pa'i gzhi yin la /
translated: Because the entire transformation of the world is the basis of dispute,

original: de'i phyir yongs su gyur pa yang sems pa dang cig shos nyid las rnam par dbye ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir yongs su gyur pa yang sems pa dang cig shos nyid las rnam par dbye ba ma yin te /
translated: therefore, the transformation is not distinguished from the mind and the other.

original: sa la sogs pa'i cha shas yongs su gyur pa 'ga' yang med de /
analyzed: sa la sogs pa'i cha shas yongs su gyur pa 'ga' yang med de /
translated: There is no transformation of a part of earth, etc.,

original: gang du drod gsher sogs skye ba'i skye bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i dbye ba med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang du drod gsher sogs skye ba'i skye bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i dbye ba med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: where there is no distinction of a person, etc., from which heat, moisture, etc., arise.

original: skye bo zhes bya ba ni nye bar mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: skye bo zhes bya ba ni nye bar mtshon pa ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúperson‚Äù is an illustration.

original: shing dang chang la sogs pa'i dbye ba med par yang 'byung ba la sogs pa'i sems pa dang / cig shos la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye ba'i rgyu med na mi rigs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shing dang chang la sogs pa'i dbye ba med par yang 'byung ba la sogs pa'i sems pa dang / cig shos la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye ba'i rgyu med na mi rigs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
